dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Amber
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Alaskan Brewing Co. Alaskan Amber
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Richly malty and long on the palate, with just enough hop backing to make this beautiful amber colored "alt" style beer notably well balanced.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Double Bag
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Long Trail Brewing Co. Double Bag
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:This malty, full-bodied double alt is also known as “Stickebier” – German slang for “secret brew”. Long Trail Double Bag was originally offered only in our brewery taproom as a special treat to our visitors. With an alcohol content of 7.2%, please indulge in moderation. The Long Trail Brewing Company is proud to have Double Bag named Malt Advocate’s “Beer of the Year” in 2001. Malt Advocate is a national magazine devoted to “expanding the boundaries of fine drinks”. Their panel of judges likes to keep things simple, and therefore of thousands of eligible competitors they award only two categories: “Imported” and “Domestic”. It is a great honor to receive this recognition.33 IBU\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Long Trail Ale
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Long Trail Brewing Co. Long Trail Ale
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Long Trail Ale is a full-bodied amber ale modeled after the “Alt-biers” of Düsseldorf, Germany. Our top fermenting yeast and cold finishing temperature result in a complex, yet clean, full flavor. Originally introduced in November of 1989, Long Trail Ale beer quickly became, and remains, the largest selling craft-brew in Vermont. It is a multiple medal winner at the Great American Beer Festival.25 IBU\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Doppelsticke
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Brewery: Uerige Obergärige Hausbrauerei GmbH / Zum Uerige
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Uerige Obergärige Hausbrauerei GmbH / Zum Uerige Uerige Doppelsticke

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Sleigh'r Dark Doüble Alt Ale
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Ninkasi Brewing Company Sleigh'r Dark Doüble Alt Ale
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Called 'Dark Double Alt' on the label.Seize the season with Sleigh'r. Layers of deeply toasted malt are balanced by just enough hop bitterness to make it deceivingly drinkable. Paired with a dry finish, Sleigh’r is anything but your typical winter brew.An Alt ferments with Ale yeast at colder lagering temperatures. This effect gives Alts a more refined, crisp lager-like flavor than traditional ales. The Alt has been “Ninkasified” raising the ABV and IBUs. Sleigh'r has a deep, toasted malt flavor that finishes dry and balanced.50 IBU\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Sticke
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Brewery: Uerige Obergärige Hausbrauerei GmbH / Zum Uerige
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Uerige Obergärige Hausbrauerei GmbH / Zum Uerige Uerige Sticke

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Okto Festival Ale
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Widmer Brothers Brewing Company Okto
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Classified as a German Altbier by the Widmer Brothers; brewed with an (ale) Alt yeast strain.availability: early Aug. - late Oct.bitterness : 28 IBUoriginal gravity: 13.5° PLATO\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Southampton Altbier
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Southampton Publick House Southampton Altbier

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Copper
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: The Olde Mecklenburg Brewery OMB Copper
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:OMB’s flagship, Copper, is an authentic Düsseldorf style “Altbier” or Amber Ale. There are no crazy flavors or gimmicks with Copper – its full-flavored start transitions to a smooth, balanced, easy-drinking finish. It’s the beer that tastes like beer.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Organic Münster Alt
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Brauerei Pinkus Mueller Organic Münster Alt

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Altbier
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Brewery: Uerige Obergärige Hausbrauerei GmbH / Zum Uerige
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Uerige Obergärige Hausbrauerei GmbH / Zum Uerige Uerige Altbier (Classic)
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Uerige Alt is the most bittered beer in Germany. In spite of this (or just for that reason), this legendary Altbier from Düsseldorf is so full-bodied, aromatic and wholesome.Our top-fermented specialty has been brewed since 1862 from barley malt, caramel malt, roasted malt, hops, water - and with our very special Uerige yeast.Our Uerige Alt is regularly chosen among the ten best beers in Germany. It has an alcohol content of 4.7% and a minimum fresh date of eight weeks.Unser Uerige Alt wird regelmäßig unter die zehn besten Biere Deutschlands gewählt. Es hat einen Alkoholgehalt von 4,7% und ein Mindestfrischedatum von acht Wochen.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Gerst Amber
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Yazoo Brewing Company Gerst Amber
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Check out a piece of Nashville brewing history! Gerst Brewery was the original Nashville brewery, but never recovered after prohibition. We are excited to partner with the Chandler Family, owners of the Gerst Haus Restaurant, to bring this beer back right where it belongs – Nashville, Tennessee.This is a very “clean” beer, with mostly German malts and a hint of flaked maize, remaining as true as possible to the original Gerst recipe.11 IBUs\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Ad Astra Ale
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Free State Brewing Co. Ad Astra Ale
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:This ale is the first brewed in Kansas since pioneering days. The name "Ad Astra comes from the Kansas State Motto - Ad Astra per Aspera, Latin words meaning "To the Stars through Difficulties". We've blended Pale, Caramel, and Munich malts for a rich amber beer. The hops balance this malty sweetness, and we've chosen Northern brewer and Fuggles hops for their flavor.24 IBU\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Copperhead Ale
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Fordham Brewing Company Fordham Copperhead Ale
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:The name isn’t a coincidence. This Düsseldorf style Altbier blends caramelized malted barley with pronounced hop character to create a subtle copper hue. Copperhead Ale is famous for its signature balanced flavor & impeccable smoothness.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Ten Years Alt
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Victory Brewing Company Ten Years Alt
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:A Doppelsticke Altbier brewed for Victory Brewing's 10th Anniversary, released in Feb 2006 and debuting at BeerAdvocate's 3rd Annual Extreme Beer Fest in 2006. A dark ale with malty depth, but with the fragrance and bold, brassy tang of European hops. 8.5%. According to Victory, they believe that this could be the first Doppelsticke brewed in the US.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Three Blind Mice
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Mother's Brewing Company Three Blind Mice
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Three Blind Mice is inspired by our favorite qualities from English brown ales, German altbiers, and Irish reds. Mother’s trio of beer connoisseurs sipped away many a night, working to find this ideal combination. Mother’s beautiful brown beer is medium-bodied with caramel, toffee, and subtle chocolate malt flavors—all balanced by moderate hop notes and a clean, dry finish.Three Blind Mice combines components of several malty beers for the unique brown beer experience you've been missing. After lots of research to find the perfect styles for our base, the clear winners were the lighter body and caramel characters of Irish red ales, the soft chocolate and toffee flavors from English brown ales, and the hop component and balance of German altbiers. We used traditional elements from each beer style and added our own touch for one incredible brown beer.24 IBU\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Ishmael
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Rising Tide Brewing Company Ishmael
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Ishmael is our richly-flavored American copper ale. This American interpretation of the altbiers of Düsseldorf is brewed with continental Munich malt, American-grown hops, and a clean-fermenting ale yeast to produce a slightly sweet and malty beer balanced by a firm bitterness.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Headwall Alt
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Tuckerman Brewing Co. Headwall Alt
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:This is traditional style of altbeir from Düsseldorf, Germany. Alt literally means old in German. Staying as true to the recipe as possible, the Headwall Alt is brewed using German malts, plus German and American hops. Like the Pale Ale, the Headwall Alt is cold conditioned, dry-hopped and krausened in the bottle or keg. Similar to the Pale Ale, the process takes about 30 days.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Alt-eration Ale
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Hops & Grain Alt-eration Ale

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Schell's Schmaltz's Alt
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: August Schell Brewing Company Barrel Aged Schmaltz's Alt
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:One of Warren's favorite pastimes back in the 30's was a trip to the city dump to shoot rats–so much that it was a common date for him and his wife-to-be, Casey. The manager of the city dump was John Schmaltz–hence the nickname "Schmaltz" Marti. We hope you enjoy our Schmaltz's Alt, a creamy smooth dark alt brewed even better than before.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Frankenheim Alt
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Privatbrauerei Frankenheim Frankenheim Alt

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Iron Works Alt
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Metropolitan Brewing Iron Works Alt
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:An assertively hoppy top-fermented beer, polished by the wisdom and patience of lagering. Think of it as an octogenarian with a punk rock attitude. Slightly dry, this beer pairs well with hearty cuisine. We also suggest sipping it on its own; the complexity will keep you entertained and happy.45 IBU\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Diebels Premium Altbier
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Brauerei Diebels GmbH & Co KG Diebels Premium Altbier

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Mission Amber
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Mission Brewery Mission Amber

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Hövels Original
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Hövels Hausbrauerei Hövels Original Bitterbier

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Secret Spot Alt Ale
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Evolution Craft Brewing Company Secret Spot Winter Ale

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Lighthouse Amber
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Cheboygan Brewing Company Lighthouse Amber
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Our German style Alt has a brilliant amber hue, and silky smooth medium body. Its light tan head is thick, retaining, and laces the glass all the way down. A Noble hop aroma up front finishes with a caramel malt nose. Our old world brewing method brings out a light toasted-bread flavor you’ll want to savor again and again. It’s a mouthwatering, thirst quenching delight.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Série Signature Sticke Alt
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Les Trois Mousquetaires Série Signature Sticke Alt
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Malts: Pilsner, Pale, Caramel 60, Caramel 160/ 74 IBU / Hops: Magnum, N Brewer, HallertauOG: 15.3ºP FG:4.3ºP / SRM: 19 / 12 month aging\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Crooked Coast Altbier
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Driftwood Brewery Crooked Coast Amber Ale
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Inspired by the original Alt-style beer of Dusseldorf, Crooked Coast brings together the aromas of German noble hops and Munich malt to produce a very refreshing and mellow ale that is the perfect companion on any shape of coast.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Gravel Road
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Rahr & Sons Brewing Company Gravel Road

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Little Red Cap
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Grimm Brothers Brewhouse Little Red Cap
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Altbier is German for “Old Beer”, this refers to the “old” style of brewing using an ale yeast (As opposed to a lager yeast fermentation which is a relatively new process). This beer originated in the Westphalia region of Germany in a town named Dusseldorf. Due to the cool climate of Dusseldorf, Altbiers employee an ale yeast that has evolved over time to ferment at somewhat cooler temperature than that of other ale yeasts. This cool fermentation produces subtle yeast derived esters and leaves a clean malty beer. In addition to this cool clean fermentation, altbiers are then lagered at cold temperatures to help smooth and refine the beer. The result of this is a very clean and hoppy red ale.Coming in at 6.2% ABV and IBUs Little Red Cap is an easy drinking hop forward beer worthy of its heritage. We use a bit of Cascade hop to give it an “American Twist” while maintaining its German heritage. This beer won a Gold Medal at the 2011 and 2016 GABF and a Bronze at the 2012 GABF. It also won a Silver Award at the 2016 World beer cup.

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Festivale
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Beau's All Natural Brewing Company Festivale
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Festivale is an amber ale, with balanced high-intensity maltiness and hop presence. Caramunich malts give Festivale its colour and a rich caramel sweetness. Festivale bucks the trend of pale summer beers, offering up amber hues and tastiness for a unique result that is both quaffable and refreshing.40 IBU\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Moby D
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Buzzards Bay Brewing Moby D

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Über Alt
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Rush River Brewing Company Über Alt
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Our Alt is a much stronger version of the traditional Dusseldorf Altbiers. An ancient style from the Rhineland, Altbiers are ales that were virtually wiped out by German lagers in the 1800’s. We use plenty of European hops and German pilsner malts to brew a remarkably clean beer. We then rest it in the cooler for two months to achieve the mellow finish that is the Überalt’s trademark.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Füchschen Alt
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Brauerei Im Füchschen Im Füchschen Alt

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Sticke It To The Man
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: O'Fallon Brewery Sticke It To The Man

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Evan Altmighty
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Blue Mountain Brewery Evan Altmighty
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:34 IBUPilsner, CaraPils and Vienna MaltsHallertau Mittelfruh HopsAle YeastDeep Well Water\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: ALTerior Motive
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: COAST Brewing Company ALTerior Motive
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Our altbier is crafted after the authentic, or sticke, style that originated in Germany. It is extremely malty, aggressively hoppy and cold conditioned for a clean, smooth finish.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: The Detroit Dwarf
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Detroit Beer Co. Detroit Beer Co. The Detroit Dwarf
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:"This beer has won a bronze, silver and gold as an Alt at the Great american beer festival, and now a silver at the world beer cup as an Alt."\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Olde School Barleywine
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Dogfish Head Brewery Olde School Barleywine
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Bold, yet smooth! Fermented with dates and figs, this bone-crushing barleywine has a unique flavor.85 IBUABV varies from 13-16%.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Brewer's Reserve Bourbon Barrel Barleywine
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Central Waters Brewing Company Bourbon Barrel Barleywine
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Aged for 1 year in used bourbon barrels.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Old Ruffian
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Great Divide Brewing Company Old Ruffian Barley Wine
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Old Ruffian is a hefty, hop-forward barley wine. Seemingly mellow at the start with subtle fruit aromas and complex caramel sweetness, it quickly becomes aggressive with its bold hop flavors and huge hop bitterness. Ultimately, the big body, succulent sweetness and massive hop character come together to work wonders on your palate.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Old Horizontal
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Victory Brewing Company Old Horizontal
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Massive amounts of barley malts, combined with fresh harvest American hops make it aromatic and spicy on the nose. Floral, fruity aromas slide into honeyed malt depth with lingering sensations of candied and citrus fruit. Late warming alcohol brings all of these flavors into wonderful harmony to finish.Malt: Imported 2 row German maltsHops: Whole flower American hopsFood Pairings: Meat pies and English cheese\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Behemoth
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Three Floyds Brewing Co. & Brewpub Behemoth Blonde Barleywine
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:A huge, sweet barleywine with complex caramel malt notes, balanced by generous hopping and a high alcohol content. This fruity and malty beer is best enjoyed while keeping warm in the brutal winter months.80 IBU2005 Bottle release - Pink Wax 2007 Bottle release - Yellow Wax, hands not skull on flat finish label (Brewed in Nov 06) 2008 Bottle release - Purple Wax 2009 Bottle release - Blue Wax2010 Bottle release - Green Wax2011 Bottle release - White Wax2011 Bottle release - Yellow Wax, glossy label, skull on label (Ohio only)2012 Bottle release - Red Wax2013 Bottle release - Orange Wax2014 Bottle release - Blue Wax2015 Bottle release - Purple Wax2016 Bottle release - Black Metallic Wax2017 Bottle release - Silver Wax\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Olde GnarlyWine
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Lagunitas Brewing Company Olde GnarlyWine
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:2011: 10.6% ABV, 69 IBU\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Old Numbskull
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: AleSmith Brewing Company AleSmith Old Numbskull

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Flying Mouflan
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Tröegs Brewing Company Flying Mouflan
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:This strong alluring ale is two beers in one. Cracking open a fresh bottle unleashes hops and heat with more than 100 IBUs emanating from three hop varieties and sweet burn of 9.3% ABV. Cellaring the Flying Mouflan in a cool dark place at 50 degrees for a minimum of four months will mellow out the hops and wash away the heat. If you can resist temptation you will be rewarded with two memorable beers in a single bottle.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: XS Old Crustacean
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Rogue Ales XS Old Crustacean
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Formerly "Old Crustacean"8 Ingredients:Hugh Baird Carastan and Rogue Micro Barley Farm DareTM & RiskTM Malts; Chinook and Rogue Micro Hopyard Revolution & Freedom Hops, Pacman Yeast & Free Range Coastal Water.25º PLATO110 IBU83 AA57º Lovibond\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Doggie Claws
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Brewery: Hair of the Dog Brewing Company / Brewery and Tasting Room
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Hair of the Dog Brewing Company / Brewery and Tasting Room Doggie Claws
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:"a Barley Wine made in the West Coast style. Big malt and hops make this copper colored ale one of our most popular products. Produced in September and October and released in November, this Beer will improve for years to come. Alcohol: 11.5% by volume. IBU's 70"\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Helldorado
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Firestone Walker Brewing Co. Helldorado
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Part of the adventure of aging beer in retired spirits barrels is the synergistic interaction of different malt flavors with the oak and spirit flavors from the barrel. Darker beers like stouts and darker barley wines have typically been the favored candidates for barrel-aging, due to their deeper caramel and roasted flavors. Helldorado breaks that mold with a deep golden color from being brewed solely with English and American pale malts. The bready, honeyed flavors of pale malts pull out rich wildflower honey, vanilla and coconut notes from the oak, creating an overall flavor evocative of bourbon-glazed graham crackers that stands as singularly unique in our Vintage lineup.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Cockeyed Cooper
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Uinta Brewing Company Cockeyed Cooper
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Aged in bourbon barrels.65 IBU\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Solstice D'hiver
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Brasserie Dieu Du Ciel Solstice D'hiver
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:This noble winter beer is brown in colour with flaming red highlights. It has a complex aroma of fruits, alcohol and hops. Its taste is delicately sweet and liquor-like with a hint of burnt caramel. It is a very bitter beer with aromas and flavours reminiscent of red fruit. The aftertaste is accentuated by the wonderful flavour of hops.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Anniversary Barley Wine Ale
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Uinta Brewing Company Anniversary Barley Wine
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Rich and complex, this all malt barley wine exhibits hints of dried fruits, toffee and caramel balanced by an abundance of American hops.72 IBU\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Barleywine Style Ale
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Green Flash Brewing Co. Barleywine Style Ale

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Lower De Boom Barleywine
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: 21st Amendment Brewery Lower Da Boom Barleywine

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Killer Penguin Barleywine
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Boulder Beer / Wilderness Pub Killer Penguin Barleywine
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:This limited, small-batch release is dark garnet red in color with a candied-fruit like aroma and flavor. At 10% ABV, Killer Penguin is a big barleywine that comes across very smooth and extremely balanced -- the perfect beer to share among friends.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Great
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Alpine Beer Company Great
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:The base of this beer was available at a couple of festivals as a barleywine named "Good". The remainder of the batch spent several months aging in fresh Jack Daniels barrels and became "Great".\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Griffin's BowBoston Beer Company (Samuel Adams)
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Boston Beer Company (Samuel Adams) Griffin's Bow
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:From the aroma and notes of sweet honeysuckle, pineapple, and grapefruit, to richer hints of burnt sugar, and toffee, this intriguing brew is full of complex flavors. The distinct character of toasted oak adds depth and contrasts the light fruit sweetness. This unique take on a barley wine ale surprises with its smoothness and balance of fruit, hop citrus, and warmth.Hops: Nelson Sauvin, ZeusMalts: Two-Row Harrington, Metcalfe, Copeland Pale, Paul’s CaramaltAged on toasted oak\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Sisyphus
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Real Ale Brewing Company Sisyphus

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Gratitude
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: East End Brewing Company Gratitude
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:A limited edition Barleywine Style Ale, brewed in November in the American tradition and hand packaged to specially commemorate the anniversary of the brewery each year.Gratitude Wax Colors:2005-Red Wax2006-Orange Wax2007-Yellow Wax2008-Green Wax2009-Blue Wax2010-Indigo Wax2011-no wax, blank cap (Flatitude)2012-no wax, "12" on cap (Flatitude)2013-Violet Wax2014 - red wax, label made to look like paper\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Barleywine Ale
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: The Duck-Rabbit Craft Brewery Duck-Rabbit Barleywine Ale
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:The Duck-Rabbit Barleywine is the hoppiest of all the Duck-Rabbit brews. This is a Farmville-style Barleywine, crafted the way brewers in Farmville have always done. Loads of Amarillo hops give a piney citrusy bitterness that's supported beautifully by a toffee malt backbone.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: The Vermonster
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Rock Art Brewery Vermonster
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:We brewed The Vermonster with 110 pounds of malt per barrel and jacked up the pour into a wide mouth thin glass goblet.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Smuttynose Barleywine Style Ale (Big Beer Series)
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Smuttynose Brewing Company Smuttynose Barleywine Style Ale (Big Beer Series)
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:First brewed in England, these potent, malty monsters were frequently aged before being put into small bottles and sold as strong beers or even medicinal tonics. The American version has been blown up with more alcohol, larger bottles and more hops.Smuttynose Barleywine straddles these two branches of the barleywine tree. When you taste it, you’ll notice deep, rich caramel malt flavors, balanced with hop bitterness. Fruity hop flavors act as a garnish for its amped-up but classic flavor. For a more refined experience, tuck a few bottles away for a year or two. The alcohol will mellow and the hop aromas will fade into the background, leaving the luscious malt to shine on its own.65 IBU2007 - 11.4%2009 - 11.1%\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: John Barleycorn Barleywine Ale
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Mad River Brewing Company John Barleycorn Barleywine Ale
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Same recipe each year. ABV varies slightly 9.5-11.0%\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Barrel Aged Behemoth
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Three Floyds Brewing Co. & Brewpub Barrel Aged Behemoth
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:American barleywine aged in Woodford Reserve bourbon barrels.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Old Ruffian - Barrel-Aged
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Great Divide Brewing Company Barrel Aged Old Ruffian

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Brewery: Nøgne Ø - Det Kompromissløse Bryggeri A/S
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Nøgne Ø - Det Kompromissløse Bryggeri A/S # 100
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:23,5° P, 80 IBU.First brewed to celebrate the 100th batch. Ingredients: Maris Otter, wheat, and chocolate malt; Columbus, Chinook, and Centennial hops; English ale yeast, and our local Grimstad water.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Old Numbskull - Bourbon Barrel-Aged
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: AleSmith Brewing Company AleSmith Old Numbskull - Barrel Aged
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:A West Coast style barleywine. A huge malt profile and a very aggressive dose of premium domestic hops give Old Numbskull a tantalizing complexity, from the aroma to the aftertaste. A year spent in bourbon barrels adds amazing depth and complexity.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Devil's Milk
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: DuClaw Brewing Company Devil's Milk
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Our award winning barleywine will seduce you with its assertive hop bill (that changes each year to make each vintage unique), citrus flavors, and warming 10% ABV. Devil’s Milk is best served in a snifter to accommodate its ABV and allow complex flavors to emerge as it warms in your hands.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Big Worse
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Mikkeller ApS Big Worse
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Brewed at De Proefbrouwerij.Ingredients: Water, malt (pils and caramunich), candy sugar, hops (nugget, cascade and centennial) and ale yeast.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Chicken Killer Barley Wine
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Santa Fe Brewing Company Chicken Killer Barley Wine
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Chicken Killer Barley Wine is the revolutionary beer that will someday define America's unique Barley Wine style. It is brewed with twice the ingredients of the Santa Fe Brewing Company's other beers, and only half the usual amount of liquid is extracted from these ingredients. This makes one substantial beer. At over ten percent alcohol, Chicken Killer is actually as substantial as wine, but this is not to say that it is difficult to drink. On the contrary; be careful with this one. The flavors of the beer are at first as overwhelming as the intense Santa Fe sun. But in the same way our sun gives us the unrivaled brilliant colors of Santa Fe, the potency of Chicken Killer gives us the remarkable spectrum of flavors that can be found in no other beer, in no other city. If you did not have the opportunity to try last year's vintage, come try this year's!\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Olde Bluehair Barley Wine
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Big Sky Brewing Company Olde Bluehair - Barrel Aged
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:75 IBU\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Old Blarney Barleywine
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Moylan's Brewery Old Blarney Barleywine

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Druid Fluid
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Middle Ages Brewing Co., Ltd. Druid Fluid

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Holidale
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Berkshire Brewing Company Inc. Holidale

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Old Howling Bastard
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Blue Point Brewing Company Blue Point Old Howling Bastard
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Our special barley wine is made with English 2-row barley and Vienna malt. Its robust, malty, caramel flavor is balanced by lots and lots of hops, giving it a great depth of character.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Old Backus Barleywine
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Free State Brewing Co. Old Backus Barleywine
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Bronze Medal Winner, 1997 World Beer Championships - Barleywines.Old Backus contains just over 2,000 pounds of malt and 55 pounds of hops. The original gravity is 25.6 P/1092 which contributes to an alcohol content of 10.5% by volume. This is a tremendously complex beer that should be savoured slowly and in moderation. It will continue to change with age as it is served unfiltered.This barleywine is named after Richard Backus, an old friend to the Brewery.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: §ucaba
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Firestone Walker Brewing Co. §ucaba (Abacus)
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Also known as Abacus2011 Reserve Series Bottle Notes:O.G. 27 PlatoF.G. 4.7 PlatoI.B.U. 42 unitsYeast: British Ale (House)Cases: 1500 producedColor: 36SRM (Dark Ruby)2014 Bottle NotesO.G. 27 PlatoF.G. 4.7 PlatoI.B.U. 42 unitsYeast: British Ale (House)Cases: 3500 producedColor: 36SRM (Dark Ruby)Matured for 1 year in a blend of Heaven Hill, 4 Roses, and Old Fitzgerald barrels.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Insanity
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Weyerbacher Brewing Co. Insanity
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Insanity, 13.3% ABV, is made by aging our Blithering Idiot Barleywine Ale in whiskey barrels. The barrel aging imparts an additional level of complexity to an already intense malt profile by adding a combination of vanilla, oak and whiskey notes.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Blithering Idiot
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Weyerbacher Brewing Co. Blithering Idiot

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Mother Of All Storms
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Pelican Pub & Brewery Mother Of All Storms
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:First Release - November 2008 'The Perfect Storm'2007 Stormwatcher's Winterfest Barleywine, aged in 1998 Evan Williams Bourbon Barrels.Second Release - October 2009 'The Perfect Storm'2008 Stormwatcher's Winterfest Barleywine, aged in 1998 Evan Williams Bourbon Barrels.***NOTE - Third Release - November 2010 The name was changed to 'Mother of All Storms' for trademark reasons.***Fourth Release - November 201131.7 degrees PlatoAlcohol: 13.5% by volumeBitterness: 40 IBU\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Old Foghorn
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Anchor Brewing Company Anchor Old Foghorn
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Old Foghorn® is brewed based on historic English barleywine methods. It is highly hopped, fermented with a true top-fermenting ale yeast, carbonated by a natural process called "bunging" to produce champagne-like bubbles, and dry-hopped with additional Cascade hops while it ages in our cellars. Made only from “first wort,” the rich first runnings of an all-malt mash, three mashes are required to produce just one barleywine brew.ABV varies slightly over the years.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Double Double Barrel Ale
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Firestone Walker Brewing Co. Double Double Barrel Ale

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Mirror Mirror
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Deschutes Brewery Mirror Mirror
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Bottled/kegged vintages:2005 - Released February 20062009 - Released April 20092014 - Released April 2014The Reserve Series romance all began with our first release of this limited-edition brew. Mirror Mirror, born of a double batch of Mirror Pond Pale Ale, is an inspired barley wine ale layered with intriguing nuances. Explore this latest incarnation and enjoy its delicious complexity in every sip.30 IBU\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Arctic Devil Barley Wine
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Midnight Sun Brewing Co. Arctic Devil Barley Wine
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Arctic Devil Barley Wine, aptly named after the ferocious wolverine of the north, is an English-style (meaning malt-inclined) barley wine. Though the recipe and process for Arctic Devil have evolved over the years, it is brewed once a year then aged in oak barrels for several months before the entire batch is blended, bottled and released.In its youth, Arctic Devil gnarls and snarls its way across the palate. Containing this beast of a beer for long periods in oak barrels--some having previously aged port, wine or whiskey--tames the unleashed malt and fierce hop flavors, melding and mellowing this powerful liquid into an incredible elixir worthy of a brewer's table.Each annual batch of Arctic Devil Barley Wine represents the brewers' resolve to create an intriguing and sought-after barley wine by precisely brewing to well-designed specifications, carefully selecting the type and combination of barrels to use for aging, and meticulously checking the beer as it ages. Distinct nuance and complexity are contributed by the wood's previous tenants, resulting in unique flavor profiles in each batch that continue to change over time. We invite you to savor Arctic Devil Barley Wine upon its release then cellar some for future enjoyment.20 IBU\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Horn Dog
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Flying Dog Brewery Horn Dog Barley Wine Style Ale

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Bourbon Barrel-Aged Barley Wine
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Kuhnhenn Brewing Company Kuhnhenn Bourbon Barrel Barley Wine

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: J.W. Lees Harvest Ale (Lagavulin Whisky Cask)J.W. Lees & Co (Brewers) Ltd
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: J.W. Lees & Co (Brewers) Ltd J.W. Lees Harvest Ale (Lagavulin Whisky Cask)

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Bligh's Barleywine Ale
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Dry Dock Brewing Co. Bligh's Barleywine Ale
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Malty and complex, this big beer has a strong caramel backbone supporting oak and whiskey flavors with hints of dark fruits. The nose wafts of coconut, toffee, and a smooth hint of alcohol. The flavor and aroma meld, becoming one after just a single sip. This beer is ready to drink, but also ages with the best of them.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: J.W. Lees Harvest Ale (Calvados Cask)J.W. Lees & Co (Brewers) Ltd
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: J.W. Lees & Co (Brewers) Ltd J.W. Lees Harvest Ale (Calvados Cask)

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: J.W. Lees Harvest Ale (Port Cask)J.W. Lees & Co (Brewers) Ltd
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: J.W. Lees & Co (Brewers) Ltd J.W. Lees Harvest Ale (Port Cask)
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:This fully fermented ale can be enjoyed now or laid down like a fine wine for enjoyment to come.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Ridge Runner
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Rock Art Brewery Ridge Runner
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:"Robust, Dark and Smooth, hold on to your hat cause you’ll lose your feet on this one!" Brewed with pale, dark crystal, Munich, flaked barley, black and chocolate malts. Hops include Cascade, Crystal, Challenger and Perle.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: J.W. Lees Harvest Ale (Sherry Cask)J.W. Lees & Co (Brewers) Ltd
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: J.W. Lees & Co (Brewers) Ltd J.W. Lees Harvest Ale (Sherry Cask)

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Irish Walker
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Olde Hickory Brewery Irish Walker
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:A long slow fermentation and cold aging makes Irish Walker a well rounded, complex Barley Wine Ale. Released only once a year, it exhibits malty sweetness, fruity esters, and hoppy balance. This ale will age well for years to come.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Criminally Bad Elf Barleywine-Style Ale
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Ridgeway Brewing Criminally Bad Elf

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Commander
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Lift Bridge Brewery Commander
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:The Commander™ is our English-Style Barleywine ale brewed with heavy fists of malts and subtle, sweet Cardamom. Aged in bourbon barrels, its bold, complex flavor reaches heights measured only by the building of its namesake. This 12.5% ABV treat is best enjoyed in smaller portions when you have some time to savor it, between now and 2020.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Pugsley's Signature Series: Barley Wine
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Shipyard Brewing Co. Shipyard Barley Wine Style Ale (Pugsley's Signature Series)
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:This addition to the Pugsley's Signature Series collection is a big beer made with six different malts and balanced with a very full hop charge. It is a deep reddish brown in color with a complex fruity nose, a very full body, and an interesting balance between grains and hops which ends with a pleasing dry taste.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Bommen & Granaten
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Brouwerij De Molen Bommen & Granaten
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:750ml: 53.9 IBU 330ml: 57 IBU\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Double Old Thumper Ale
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Shipyard Brewing Co. Double Old Thumper Ale

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Wooden Hell
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Flossmoor Station Restaurant & Brewery Wooden Hell
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:GABF 2006 Strong Barrel Aged Bronze, Woodford Reserve Barrel Aged Barleywine\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Golden Pride
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Fuller Smith & Turner PLC Golden Pride

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Stormwatcher's Winterfest
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Pelican Pub & Brewery Stormwatcher's Winterfest
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:32.1 degrees PlatoAlcohol: 13.0% by volumeBitterness: 31 IBUColor: 54 SRM\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Old Abominable
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Stoudts Brewing Co. Old Abominable

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Fuller's ESB
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Style: Bitter - English Extra Special / Strong Bitter (ESB)
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Fuller Smith & Turner PLC Fuller's ESB
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Twice named World Champion Beer, Fuller’s ESB is one of the most decorated ales of its time. A winner born and brewed, it’s a strong, full-bodied ale that has delighted drinkers for decades with its smooth, mellow bitterness and superbly satisfying finish.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Hobgoblin Ruby
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Style: Bitter - English Extra Special / Strong Bitter (ESB)
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Wychwood Brewery Company Ltd Hobgoblin
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Formerly HobgoblinDrink legendary. This distinct ruby beer’s sweet caramel and fruity aromas tease the taste buds. Brewed with smooth and rich Chocolate and Crystal malts & a blend of Fuggles and Styrian Golding hops. Expect a delicious full-bodied toffee flavour and a fruity finish of figs, raisins and dates. Hobgoblin: Born Different.Hops: Fuggles & StyriansMalt: Pale, Crystal & ChocolateOnly bottled Hobgoblin Ruby is 5.2% which is this listing. Canned, cask (tap and hand-pull draft), and 5L mini-cask's of Hobgoblin Ruby are 4.5% and reviews of them belong under that separate listing.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Sawtooth
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Style: Bitter - English Extra Special / Strong Bitter (ESB)
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Left Hand Brewing Company Sawtooth Ale
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Sessionable. Unpretentious. Left Hand's original flagship. Proof that a beer can be both complex and balanced. Malty chewiness slowly transitioning over to herbal, earthy hops with a dry finish. Brewed to be enjoyed with friends and to stimulate serendipity.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Harvest Ale
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Style: Bitter - English Extra Special / Strong Bitter (ESB)
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Southern Tier Brewing Company Harvest Ale
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Our celebration of the change of the seasons, a deeply comforting ale to usher in the sunset as the evenings get cooler. In salutation to that special moment in time when the year’s harvest is a gracious cornucopia before us, we brew a classic ESB. Harvest is brewed with a combination of fresh English hops, cracked barley, and hard work. This is a classic English style Extra Special Bitter of the highest order. Harvest’s deep ruby color envokes a bright autumn mountainside where a warm sweater, a good beer, and the gratitude for the seasons are all you need.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Old Thumper
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Style: Bitter - English Extra Special / Strong Bitter (ESB)
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Shipyard Brewing Co. Old Thumper ESA
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Old Thumper Extra Special Ale was created in 1979 by veteran British brewer, Peter Austin, founder of the Ringwood Brewery in Hampshire, England and mentor to Shipyard's master brewer Alan Pugsley. A British Grand Champion beer, Old Thumper is a non-traditional English Bitter, brewer in the US solely by Shipyard.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Abbot Ale
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Style: Bitter - English Extra Special / Strong Bitter (ESB)
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Greene King / Morland Brewery Abbot Ale
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Hailed by the late beer writer Michael Jackson as ‘one of the great characters of the beer world’, Abbot Ale is brewed for quality of the highest order. Abbot is an irresistible ale with masses of fruit characters, a malty richness and superb hop balance. It is brewed longer to a unique recipe, which makes it the full-flavoured, smooth and mature beer it is today.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Anvil
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Style: Bitter - English Extra Special / Strong Bitter (ESB)
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: AleSmith Brewing Company Anvil Ale ESB

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Scarlet Lady Ale
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Style: Bitter - English Extra Special / Strong Bitter (ESB)
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Stoudts Brewing Co. Stoudt's Scarlet Lady ESB
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:This English-style ale is brewed with Marris Otter and Caramel malts for a rich, reddish-copper color and smooth malty palate. The use of bittering and aroma addition hops balances the regal, sweet maltiness and imparts a softly perfumed aroma.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Lord Rear Admiral
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Style: Bitter - English Extra Special / Strong Bitter (ESB)
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Three Floyds Brewing Co. & Brewpub Lord Admiral Nelson
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Three Floyds version of an ESB, this deep amber ale has a complex malt sweetness and pronounced apricot hoppiness. Named after Admiral Lord Horatio Nelson.55 IBU\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Extra Special Ale (ESA)
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Style: Bitter - English Extra Special / Strong Bitter (ESB)
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Yards Brewing Co. Extra Special Ale (ESA)
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Our first ever and most beloved brew, ESA helped establish a following for cask-conditioned beer in the United States back in the ‘90s. East Kent Golding hops give this English style ale a subtle spiciness, which compliments its strong malt backbone. Hints of chocolate and caramel round out this deep chestnut colored ale. Floral, earthy, smooth.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Foster's Premium Ale
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Style: Bitter - English Extra Special / Strong Bitter (ESB)
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Foster's Group Limited Foster's Premium Ale

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Belk's ESB
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Style: Bitter - English Extra Special / Strong Bitter (ESB)
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Anderson Valley Brewing Company Boont ESB
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Inspired by the classic “Bitters” from Great Britain, our Belk’s ESB is an innovative take on the style. With a deep, golden hue and big malty foundation, the spicy, herbal hop aromas and crisp, bitter bite give a West Coast flair to this classic recipe.Formerly Boont ESB.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: ESB
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Style: Bitter - English Extra Special / Strong Bitter (ESB)
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Green Man Brewery Green Man ESB
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:A malty amber ale boasting rich toasted and caramel flavors, Green Man ESB is one of our award-winning signature brews. Our blend of authentic British malts and hops creates a nutty aroma, full body, and a sweet finish. Prepare yourself for a truly exceptional interpretation of a traditional English style.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Motor Boat
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Style: Bitter - English Extra Special / Strong Bitter (ESB)
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: SweetWater Brewing Company Sweetwater Motor Boat

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: ESB Special Ale
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Style: Bitter - English Extra Special / Strong Bitter (ESB)
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Ska Brewing Co. ESB Special Ale

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Autumn Ale
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Style: Bitter - English Extra Special / Strong Bitter (ESB)
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Short's Brewing Company Short's Autumn Ale
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:A malty amber ale over toned with slight caramel flavors and notable pleasant hoppiness throughout. An international award winning recipe. 30 I.B.U.'s13 deg. Plato 5.75 % A.B.V\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Halloween Ale
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Style: Bitter - English Extra Special / Strong Bitter (ESB)
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Gritty McDuff's Brewing Company Gritty McDuff's Halloween Ale
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Every fall marks the return of our legendary Extra Special Bitter for the season, Halloween Ale – the beer so good, it's scary! From its humble beginnings in 1990 as a small-batch seasonal in our Portland Brew Pub, Halloween Ale has grown to be one of the year's most anticipated beer releases. This robust brew has a deep amber color, a bold, malty palate and a well-rounded hop finish. The perfect beer for a crisp autumn day!\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Bishops Finger
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Style: Bitter - English Extra Special / Strong Bitter (ESB)
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Shepherd Neame Ltd Bishops Finger

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: 13 Rebels ESB
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Style: Bitter - English Extra Special / Strong Bitter (ESB)
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: French Broad Brewing Co. 13 Rebels ESB
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:French Broad Brewery’s interpretation of the classic UK Extra Special Bitter. A bright copper color with a complex malt palate is complemented by traditional British hops, notably East Kent Golding. French Broad has made this classic public house session beer a cult classic with its skull and crossbones artwork.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Beast Bitter
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Style: Bitter - English Extra Special / Strong Bitter (ESB)
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Middle Ages Brewing Co., Ltd. Beast Bitter

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Moondog Ale
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Style: Bitter - English Extra Special / Strong Bitter (ESB)
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Great Lakes Brewing Company Great Lakes Moondog ESB
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Inspired by our rock 'n' roll city, Moondog's smooth body and undomesticated hop bite set the stage for late night howling.Wild, floral hop scents shred their way through a tail waggin’, toe tappin’ blend of crisp, sweet malts.30 IBU\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Magnumus Ete Tomahawkus ESB³
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Style: Bitter - English Extra Special / Strong Bitter (ESB)
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Rock Art Brewery Magnumus Ete Tomahawkus ESB³
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:An ESB squared! It’s big! It’s bitter and it’s balanced! Heck, we even dry hopped it with Tettnang hops, but I’ll admit the Tomahawk chewed up the dry hop and didn’t spit it out!\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: The Wise ESB
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Style: Bitter - English Extra Special / Strong Bitter (ESB)
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Elysian Brewing Company The Wise ESB
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Exquisitely balanced.Tasting Notes: Pours reddish-copper with a thin, creamy beige head. Subtle smells of caramel, honey, citrus and grassy floral hops entice while the taste delivers a pleasantly bold hop flavor against a very strong malt backbone. Well-balanced and delicious.Malts: Pale, Munich, C77, CaraHell and Belgian Special B.Hops: Bittered with Chinook, finished with Cascade and Centennial.Body: Medium.IBU: 60\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Red Rack Ale
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Style: Bitter - English Extra Special / Strong Bitter (ESB)
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Woodstock Inn Brewery Red Rack Ale
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Amber in color with slight caramel sweetness. Medium hop bitterness. Malty up front with a nice hop/ malt balance.23.3 IBU\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Christmas Ale
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Style: Bitter - English Extra Special / Strong Bitter (ESB)
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Gritty McDuff's Brewing Company Gritty McDuff's Christmas Ale
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:If it looks like Ed just got merrier, you're right. Every November heralds the return of our holiday seasonal, Christmas Ale – available on draft and in six-packs. Our Christmas Ale is a robust E.S.B. (Extra Special Bitter) full of holiday cheer. Christmas Ale has a lovely, dark red/amber color and a rich, full-bodied, malty taste with a slightly roasted undertone. We brew our Christmas Ale to an original gravity of 1064 (about 6.2% alcohol by volume) using only the finest English Pale and Crystal Malts, with a touch of Roasted Barley as well. A blend of Clusters, Styrian Goldings, Saaz and Yakima Goldings leaf hops round out this hearty brew. Gritty's Christmas Ale has no additives, fruits or spices. It's just a good honest ale, perfect for the season. And to top it all off, it's already gift-wrapped! Happy Holidays!28.5 IBU\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Bachelor ESB
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Style: Bitter - English Extra Special / Strong Bitter (ESB)
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Deschutes Brewery Bachelor ESB
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Alc. by Vol.: 5.3%IBUs: 50180 calories per 12 oz serving\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Bleeding Buckeye Red Ale
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Style: Bitter - English Extra Special / Strong Bitter (ESB)
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Elevator Brewery & Draught Haus Elevator Bleeding Buckeye Red Ale
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Formerly known as Bott Brothers ESB (the original occupants), this alehouse favorite is a complex medley of malt and hops.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Extra Special Bitter (ESB)
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Style: Bitter - English Extra Special / Strong Bitter (ESB)
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Propeller Brewery Propeller Extra Special Bitter (ESB)
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Bitter was originally a draught ale served very fresh under no pressure (gravity or hand pump dispensing only) at cellar temperatures. Lucky for you today its available everywhere!Our ESB is a rich, full-bodied English-style bitter, brewed with carefully selected malts and hops. This copper coloured, English styled ale is our best seller. Smooth, Full bodied and All Natural, like all our beers.Our most popular brew is not really a bitter beer, it's a better Bitter!30 IBU\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Steel Wheels ESB
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Style: Bitter - English Extra Special / Strong Bitter (ESB)
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Blue Mountain Brewery Steel Wheels ESB

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Batemans XXXB
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Style: Bitter - English Extra Special / Strong Bitter (ESB)
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Brewery: George Bateman and Son Ltd. / Batemans Brewery
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: George Bateman and Son Ltd. / Batemans Brewery Batemans XXXB

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: XX Bitch Creek
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Style: Bitter - English Extra Special / Strong Bitter (ESB)
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Grand Teton Brewing Co. XX Bitch Creek
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Bitch Creek ESB was first brewed in 2003, and perfectly balances big malt sweetness and robust hop flavor for a full-bodied mahogany ale. It has quickly become our best-selling beer, as well as our most-critically acclaimed, having won medals-including two golds— at four out of the past five Great American Beer Festivals.XX Bitch Creek Double ESB is all that and more. We took the Bitch Creek recipe and doubled everything: double the malt, double the hops, twice the flavor.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Adnams SSB (Suffolk Special Bitter)
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Style: Bitter - English Extra Special / Strong Bitter (ESB)
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Adnams plc, Sole Bay Brewery Adnams SSB (Suffolk Special Bitter)

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Naughty Hildegard ESB
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Style: Bitter - English Extra Special / Strong Bitter (ESB)
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Driftwood Brewery Naughty Hildegard ESB
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Brewed to honor Hildegard Von Bingen, a 12th century Benedictine nun who allegedly was the first to record the use of hops as an ingredient in beer. While this is open to debate, we like Hildegard's style and we can't imagine a beer without hops. This extra special bitter has lots of hops- Hildegard would be proud. We are! Cheers Hildy!\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Honker's Ale
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Goose Island Beer Co. Honker's Ale
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Golden sunset color, fruity hop aroma, biscuity malt flavor, soft body.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Fuller's London Pride
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Fuller Smith & Turner PLC Fuller's London Pride
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Not just the iconic ale of the capital, London Pride is an all-British affair that unites a nation of beer drinkers. It’s brewed with entirely home-grown hop varieties - Target for bittering and Northdown, Challenger and Goldings for aroma - but the soul of the beer is unquestionably in the malt. Crystal malts combine with spring-harvested Pale Ale varieties Concerto and Propino, to give Pride its inimitable depth and balance.This tawny-coloured premium ale borrows sweet raisin, biscuit and dried-fruit notes from the Crystal malt, while fresh, piney herbs emanate from the hops. Rich, smooth and elegant on the palate, it draws to a clean, satisfying finish with beautifully balanced bitterness.4.1% ABV on cask, 4.7% ABV for bottles, cans and kegs.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Bluebird Bitter
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Coniston Brewing Co. Ltd Bluebird Bitter
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Bluebird is a fine session ale with a light golden colour. The intense resinous and spicy hop character which is the beer's hallmark is derived from the use of unusual quantities of English Challenger hops, each bale being individually and personally selected by the brewer. The malt is, of course, Maris Otter fermented slightly warm to give a soft fruitiness with a faint hint of scented geranium.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Spitfire Premium Kentish Ale
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Shepherd Neame Ltd Spitfire (Premium Ale Export)
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:This 4.2% Kentish ale (bottle 4.5%) was first brewed in 1990 to celebrate the Battle of Britain which was fought in the skies above Kent 50 years earlier. The beer is named after the legendary Spitfire aeroplane designed by RJ Mitchell. The versatility of the aircraft and the courage of its pilots were essential to victory and were a key symbol of the spirit of that time.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Younger's Special Bitter
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Rogue Ales Younger's Special Bitter

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: The Naughty Nurse
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: City Steam Brewery Café City Steam Naughty Nurse Pale Ale
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:The Naughty Nurse has become quite the popular lady in the Nutmeg State. With her classy and sensual elegance, combined with just the right amount of...ahem...bite, she has made many a friend both inside and outside of our brewpub. Don't let that "come hither" look fool you, though - she is all business when it comes to performance. In fact, she is our best seller! If the Nurse needs a match, it can be a nice beefy burger, or almost anything else on a pub style menu. And with her moderate alcohol content, she can stand alone and make your next Session last a long, long time! This fine ale is brewed for a spicy, slightly bittersweet finish using traditional English malt, hops, yeast and manners. Available short or tall, of course!\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Ruddles County
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Greene King / Morland Brewery Ruddles County

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Foster's Special Bitter
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Foster's Group Limited Foster's Special Bitter

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Uncle Teddy's Bitter
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Victory Brewing Company Uncle Teddy's Bitter

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Doom Bar
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Sharp's Brewery Doom Bar Bitter
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Doom Bar is inspired by its namesake, the treacherous sandbank at the mouth of the Camel Estuary near Sharps' home at Rock. Accomplished and precise, Doom Bar is the epitomy of consistency, balance and moreish appeal and is now the UK's no.1 selling cask beer.An enticing aroma of resinous hop, sweet malt and delicate roasted notes. The mouth feel is a balanced, complex blend of succulent dried fruit, lightly roasted malt and a subtle yet assertive bitterness. The finish is dry and refreshing.ABV: 4.0% (cask), 4.3% (bottle)\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Long Haul Session Ale
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Two Brothers Brewing Company Long Haul Session Ale
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:"Ale aged a minimum of 4 weeks in French Oak Foudres."\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Best Bitter
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Gritty McDuff's Brewing Company Gritty McDuff's Best Bitter
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Best Bitter was the first beer we ever brewed, way back in 1988 at our Portland Brew Pub. This true English classic has been the anchor of our draft selection ever since.Best Bitter is a copper-hued and well-balanced ale with real old world integrity. We use fine Yakima Golding hop flowers in the brewing of this beer for a fine dry finish that compliments the malty palate. The taste captures the freshness of a hand-drawn ale that goes right from the conditioning tank to your glass!25 IBU\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Old Golden Hen
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Greene King / Morland Brewery Old Golden Hen

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Hopback Summer Lightning
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Hop Back Brewery plc Hopback Summer Lightning

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Belhaven Best
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Belhaven Brewery Company Ltd. Belhaven Best
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:The pint of pints. Belhaven Best is the main man of draught ales. Best colour, best flavour, best balance - the pint for all occasions. We Scots are often not known for blowing our own trumpets, modest souls that we are, but we've named this Best for a reason. We're sure you'll agree.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Adnams Southwold Bitter
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Adnams plc, Sole Bay Brewery Adnams Southwold Bitter

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Geary's Winter Ale
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: D.L. Geary Brewing Company Geary's Winter Ale
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Geary’s new Winter Ale is a well balanced and more aggressive bitter, both in alcohol and hop character, without being overpowering. It is dark gold and coppery in color with moderate carbonation. Malt flavors are toasty and fruity, resulting in a tasty blend with firm body balanced by English hops.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Brakspear Bitter
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: W.H. Brakspear & Sons plc Brakspear Bitter

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Goliath
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Wychwood Brewery Company Ltd Goliath

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: McNellie's Pub Ale
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Marshall Brewing Company McNellie's Pub Ale
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Inspired by the house ales found in the pubs of Great Britain and Ireland, McNellie’s Pub Ale is a traditional ale brewed in the style of a Best Bitter. Various maltings of two-row barley are joined with American Glacier hops to give this beer its color, complexity, and a bit of a New World twist. The Old World character present in this ale is largely influenced by its yeast, which originates in the port city of Hull, East Yorkshire, England.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Ruby Red Ale
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: St. Peter's Brewery Co Ltd St. Peter's Ruby Red Ale
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:A rich, red ale with subtle malt undertones and a distinctive spicy hop aroma from Styrian Goldings. Brewed with skill and patience in one of Britain's finest small breweries.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Op & Top
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Brouwerij De Molen Op & Top

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Tetley's Smoothflow
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Carlsberg-Tetley Brewing Ltd Tetley's Smoothflow

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Arkell Best Bitter
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Wellington County Brewery Arkell Best Bitter
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Originally served as a real ale, Arkell Best Bitter has a loyal following. This delicate and well-balanced bitter is Wellington’s session beer.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Chester County Bitter
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Sly Fox Brewing Company Chester County Bitter
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:This traditional British Ale is authentic cask conditioned beer with a smooth malt profile balance by a subtle hop presence. Dry-hopping in the cask produces an enticing hop aroma in this quaffable session ale.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Cain's Finest Bitter
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Robert Cain & Company Limited Cain's Best Bitter

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Bitter
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Ridgeway Brewing Ridgeway Bitter

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Colonel Blides Cask Ale
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Cricket Hill Brewing Co. Colonel Blides Cask Ale
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:5.5% ABV31 IBU'S\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: T.E.A. (Traditional English Ale)
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Hog's Back Brewery T.E.A. (Traditional English Ale)
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:An enticing amber colour with a hoppy and slightly fruity aroma. We use the finest English malt carefully balanced with local Fuggles hops. This is gently fermented to leave some of the natural malt sugars, to give a full and satisfying flavour with a long, dry finish.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: XB Bluebird Bitter
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Coniston Brewing Co. Ltd XB Bluebird Bitter

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Pitchfork Rebellious Bitter
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: RCH Brewery Pitchfork Rebellious Bitter
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:The name comes from the Pitchfork rebellion of 1685 the last battle to be fought on English soil of the Civil War.A golden bitter with floral citric hop aroma. It has a hoppy predominate taste which is slightly sweet and fruity and leaves you wanting more.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: HopHead
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Dark Star Brewing Company Limited HopHead
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:An extremely clean-drinking pale golden ale with a strong floral aroma and elderflower notes from the Cascade hops. This beer is full-bodied and full-flavoured yet gentle enough to make it a favourite session beer.50 IBU\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Old Brewery BitterSamuel Smith Old Brewery (Tadcaster)
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Samuel Smith Old Brewery (Tadcaster) Samuel Smith's Old Brewery Bitter

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Little Dog
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Brewery: Hair of the Dog Brewing Company / Brewery and Tasting Room
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Hair of the Dog Brewing Company / Brewery and Tasting Room Little Dog
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:An experimental beer, moderately hopped and low alcohol. First made from second runnings of Doggie Claws 2010; subsequent releases of Fred or Adam second runnings.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Best Bitter
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: St. Peter's Brewery Co Ltd St. Peter's Best Bitter
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:A traditional best bitter ale brewed wth Pale and Crystal malts and Goldings aroma hops. The result is a full-bodied ale with distinctive fruity caramel notes. Brewed with skill and patience in one of Britain's finest small breweries.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Camerons Strongarm
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Brewery: Castle Eden & Camerons Brewing Company Ltd
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Castle Eden & Camerons Brewing Company Ltd Camerons Strongarm

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: HSB (Horndean Special Bitter)
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: George Gale & Company Ltd HSB (Horndean Special Bitter)

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: St. Patrick's Best
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Strangford Lough Brewing Company Ltd St. Patrick's Best

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Hooky Bitter
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Hook Norton Brewery Co. Ltd. Hooky Bitter

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: West Bank Pub Ale
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Minneapolis Town Hall Brewery West Bank Pub Ale
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:British style pale ale featuring the the rich character of UK Golden Promise malt with a distinct finish from the use of British Fuggles and Golding hops.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Adnams Bitter
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Adnams plc, Sole Bay Brewery Adnams Bitter

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: DeuS (Brut Des Flandres)
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Brouwerij Bosteels DeuS (Brut Des Flandres)
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:This extraordinary and sparkling "DeUs, Brut des Flandres", brewed with barley, is fermented and matured in Belgium, refermented in the bottle, followed but the traditional "remuarge" and "dégorgement" in France. Serve chilled (2 - 4º C) and pour gently into a chilled flute or chalice glass.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Nelson Sauvignon (Nelson Sauvin Brut)
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Mikkeller ApS Nelson Sauvignon (Nelson Sauvin Brut)
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Aged in white wine barrels.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Malheur Bière Brut (Brut Reserve)
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Brouwerij De Landtsheer NV Malheur Bière Brut (Brut Reserve)

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Malheur Brut Noir (Black Chocolate)
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Brouwerij De Landtsheer NV Malheur Brut Noir (Black Chocolate)

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Krait Prestige
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Cobra Beer Partnership Limited Krait Prestige

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Eisenbahn Lust
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Cervejaria Sudbrack Ltda Eisenbahn Lust

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Šamp - Pivní Sekt
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Pivovarský Dům ?amp - Pivní Sekt
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:TWith addition of champagne style yeast, this beer ferments and ages for several weeks in bottles. It is an excellent welcome drink, aperitif, and/or beverage accompanying a dessert. It has been produced in cooperation with the brewery in the city of Strakonice (South Bohemia).\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Eisenbahn Lust Prestige
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Cervejaria Sudbrack Ltda Eisenbahn Lust Prestige

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Summer Love
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Victory Brewing Company Summer Love
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:CompositionMalt: imported 2 row German maltsHops: whole flower Tettnang Tettnang, Simcoe and Citra hopsABV: 5.2%FlavorWith the sublime, earthy familiarity of noble European hops backed up by fresh, clean German malts, Summer Love Ale ends with a surprising burst of lemony refreshment from fistfuls of American whole flower hops. Love Summer, now.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Sweet Action
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Sixpoint Brewery Sweet Action
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Ever heard of Sweet Action...the magazine? That short-lived sensation sparked one of our first collaborations--the beer you hold in your hand. Our quest to classify SWEET ACTION has ended; it's a beer your brain can't categorize, but instead speaks directly to your palate. Our senses and intuition sometimes conquer rational thought. It's Mad Science.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Big Wave Golden Ale
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Kona Brewing Co. Big Wave Golden Ale
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Big Wave is light golden ale with a subtle fruitiness and delicate hop aroma. A smooth, easy drinking refreshing ale. The lightly roasted honey malt contributes to the golden hue of this beer and also gives a slight sweetness that is balanced out by our special blend of hops.20 IBU\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Twilight Summer Ale
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Deschutes Brewery Twilight Ale
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Summer has its own rules. As luck would have it, it also has it's own beer. This clever golden-hued ale pours remarkably crisp and clean. A distinctive malt body complements a refreshing hop profile led by a heady dose of bold Amarillo hops. Enjoy.Malt: Pale, Carapils, Crystal, MunichHops: Sterling, Celeia, Cascade, Tettnang38 IBU\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Tire Bite Golden Ale
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Flying Dog Brewery Tire Bite Golden Ale

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Export Ale
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Shipyard Brewing Co. Shipyard Export Ale

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Fireman's #4
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Real Ale Brewing Company Fireman's #4

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: India Pale Ale
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Alexander Keith's India Pale Ale
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:The pride of Nova Scotia.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Samurai Ale
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Great Divide Brewing Company Samurai Ale
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Samurai is the perfect beer for your zen garden after battle, or your patio after a long day of work. The addition of rice gives a slightly fruity, crisp, refreshing element to this hazy unfiltered ale, creating a light, easy-going beer suitable for the peaceful warrior. This may be your first Samurai, but it certainly won’t be your last.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Bombshell Blonde
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Southern Star Brewing Company Bombshell Blonde
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:A rich, creamy golden colored ale fermented at a cool temperature to give a clean finish. Hints of yeasty bread and a touch of hops combine to make a beer that is truly more than the sum of its parts.20 IBUMalt: Rahr Special Pale, Wyermann ViennaHops: Saphir, SterlingYeast: California Ale\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Farmhouse Summer Ale
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Flying Fish Brewing Company Farmhouse Summer Ale
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:A tribute to the highly drinkable "every day" beers from French-speaking Belgium. Contains Belgian two-row pale malt and 7% wheat. This beer is lightly filtered with an earthy, spicy hop character from imported Styrian Goldings hops and a beautiful rich creamy head from the wheat.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Single Chair Golden Ale
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Magic Hat Brewing Company Single Chair Ale
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Single Chair celebrates the uniqueness of the Mad River Glen Cooperative Ski Area in Vermont. Medium bodied and ideally balanced for all tastes, Single Chair's tempting light golden color, heady aroma and smooth liquid go down effortlessly and often!17 IBU\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Citra Blonde Summer Brew
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Widmer Brothers Brewing Company Citra Summer Blonde Brew

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: True Blonde Ale
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Ska Brewing Co. True Blonde Ale
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:A Smooth and Sexy Brew.Like golden waves of yeast crashing on a golden beach of golden sand with golden taps spewing golden beer that’s smooth as gold.A Crisp Blonde Ale. Golden in color, medium in body—she’s brewed with the help and the honey of Durango’s Honeyville™ bees.SOUL MATESLight enough not to overwhelm tasty greens regardless of dressing. Works well with delicate fish. Pleasant accompaniment to lobster, clams, shrimp and crab – great w/ lobster bisque. Thirst quencher, works well with spicy/hot foods.The taste is mildly sweet from the use of local honey, followed by bready malts, a touch of tangy wheat, a pleasantly mild bitterness, and citrus hop flavors in the end.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Prairie Path Ale
