dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Finlandia Strong Sahti
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Finlandia Sahti Ky Finlandia Strong Sahti

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Puhti IV B
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Lammin Sahti Oy Puhti IV B

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Hennepin
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Brewery Ommegang Hennepin (Farmhouse Saison)
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Hoppy, farmhouse saison with champagne like effervescence; flavors include ginger, spice, orange and toasted grain.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Tank 7
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Boulevard Brewing Co. Tank 7 Farmhouse Ale
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Most breweries have at least one piece of equipment that’s just a bit persnickity. Here at Boulevard we have fermenter number seven, the black sheep of our cellar family. Ironically, when our brewers were experimenting with variations on a traditional Belgian-style farmhouse ale, the perfect combination of elements came together in that very vessel. You could call it fate, but they called it Tank 7, and so it is. Beginning with a big surge of fruity aromatics and grapefruit-hoppy notes, the flavor of this complex, straw-colored ale tapers off to a peppery, dry finish.38 IBU\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Sofie
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Goose Island Beer Co. Sofie
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:80% Belgian Style Ale, 20% Belgian Style Ale aged in wine barrels with citrus peel. Champagne color, white pepper aroma, citrus & vanilla flavor, sparkling body.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Saison Dupont
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Brasserie Dupont sprl Saison Dupont
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:The Saison Dupont is a top fermentation beer with refermentation in the bottle. Since 1844, this beer has been brewed in our farm-brewery, during the winter time. Then this beer became a second refermentation in the barrel. During the next summer, this very thirst-quenching beer was served to the “saisoniers” which were working on the fields. Surely therefore, our Saison Dupont is considered as “the classic” among the Belgian season beers!Coppery blond, the finest aromas and a strong bitterness transform this beer into a thirst-quenchener with no equal, just the way it was created. Our selection of yeasts is the perfect base for these typical aromas and ditto taste. A real refermentation in the bottle, which will continue for a long time in your cellar, result into this complex and particular aromatic beer.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Saison-Brett
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Boulevard Brewing Co. Saison - Brett
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Saison-Brett, based on our very popular Tank 7, is assertively dry hopped, then bottle conditioned with various yeasts, including Brettanomyces, a wild strain that imparts a distinctive earthy quality. Though this farmhouse ale was given three months of bottle age prior to release, further cellaring will continue to enhance the “Brett” character, if that's what you're after.38 IBU\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Sorachi Ace
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Brooklyn Brewery Brooklyn Sorachi Ace
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:This is a saison featuring the rare Japanese-developed hop Sorachi Ace. The Sorachi Ace hop varietal is noted for its unique lemon zest/lemongrass aroma.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Arthur
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Hill Farmstead Brewery Arthur
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Arthur (1922-2005) was our grandfather’s youngest brother; Hill Farmstead Brewery rests upon the land that was once home to him and his 13 siblings. In his honor, this Saison is crafted from American malted barley, American and European hops, our distinctive farmhouse yeast and water from our well. Unfiltered and naturally carbonated, this is the ale that I dream to have shared with Arthur.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Fantôme Saison
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Brasserie Fantôme Fantôme Saison

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Pepe Nero Belgian Style Ale
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Goose Island Beer Co. Pepe Nero
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Belgian style Farmhouse Ale brewed with peppercorns.Mahogany color, black pepper aroma, roasted malt and spice flavor, creamy body.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Colette
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Great Divide Brewing Company Colette Farmhouse Ale
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Colette is our homage to the saisons that Belgian farm workers have enjoyed for centuries. Brewed with barley, wheat and rice and fermented at high temperatures with a special blend of four different yeast strains, Colette is fruity and slightly tart, with a dry finish that makes it that rarest of treats — a beer as refreshing as it is complex.2010 Great American Beer Festival, Silver Medal, French & Belgian-Style Saison2010 Silver Australian International Beer Awards2011 Australian International Beer Awards, Bronze Medal, Belgian and French Style Ale\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Anna
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Hill Farmstead Brewery Anna
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Anna is Bière de Miel, brewed with 20% raw wildflower Vermont honey and our house saison yeast.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Saison Du BUFF
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Dogfish Head Brewery Saison Du BUFF
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Plans call for Saison du BUFF to be a 6% alc/vol Saison brewed with parsley, sage, rosemary and thyme. This beer will be brewed three times, once at each brewery using the same recipe.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Seizoen Bretta
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Logsdon Farmhouse Ales Seizoen Bretta
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:"Special Brettanomyces yeast provides added dryness and crisp complexity to the Seizoen Bretta. Bottle conditioned with pear juice for a natural carbonation."\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Avec Les Bons Voeux
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Brasserie Dupont sprl Avec Les Bons Voeux
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Les Bons Voeux means best wishes, which is what Brasserie Dupont sends with this very special saison ale brewed for the holidays. Redolently aromatic, rich and velvety. Rich gold color, fragrant (lemony with hints of pepper, banana and clove), as all the beers of Dupont are with a full, deep malt richness that lingers on your tongue for what seems the whole holiday season. Considered by some the finest offering from this unparalleled Brewery. “The best Belgian beer, if ever there could be such an award...a sumptuous, seductive 9.5% beer. Because of it’s intensity, I would recommend the novice graduate to this beer. However, if a saison that is starting to lean towards being a triple appeals to you, and if its in season, don’t hesitate.”\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Opal
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Firestone Walker Brewing Co. Opal
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Bringing down the Farmhouse! Our interpretation of the rustic Wallonian Saison style is a harmonious blend of rustic grains, spicy yeast and unique sauvignon blanc tones. Inviting lemon grass and gooseberry meet peppery spice and fresh grain aromas. Spicy Belgian yeast create a complex yet dry and refreshing canvas with splashes of citrus and stone fruit with a bright tropical white wine finish. Hop bitterness is assertive yet harmonious rounding out slightly tart and refreshing.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Bam Bière
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Jolly Pumpkin Artisan Ales Bam Bière
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:This delicious farmhouse ale is named for our Jack Russell, who struck by a car, bounced back in fine tenacious Jack Russell fashion, and is brewed for those of us who knocked down, have picked up, dusted off and carried on undaunted. Golden, naturally cloudy, bottle conditioned and dry hopped for a perfectly refreshing balance of spicy malts, hops and yeast. Please enjoy our beers in good health, And look both ways when crossing the street!

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Interlude
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Allagash Brewing Company Allagash Interlude
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Two yeast strains were used to create this unique Belgian-style ale. The first, a Saison yeast, establishes the flavor foundations of a classic Belgian-style ale. The second, our house strain of Brettanomyces yeast, contributes myriad flavors including pear, apricot, graham cracker, and bread crust. A portion of Interlude is aged in red wine barrels, which imparts a distinctive vinous, plum character and a dry, almost tannic, finish.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Le Merle
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: North Coast Brewing Co. Le Merle

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Surette Provision Saison
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Crooked Stave Artisan Beer Project Crooked Stave Surette
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Artisan ale aged in oak barrels\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Cellar Door
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Stillwater Artisanal Ales Cellar Door
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Over the ages the term ’cellar door’ has numerously been referred to as the most beautiful term in the English language. Upon setting out to create the first summer addition to the Stateside line up of ales; the feeling that almost instantly came to me was that of beauty & cleansing. Many summer offerings tend to lack the complexity of their bigger, colder season counterparts; so my goal was to craft an ale of extreme balance with a delicate complexity that allows for contemplation while also providing quaffable refreshment. Starting with a base of German wheat & pale malts this crisp slightly hazy foundation was then accented with a blend of Sterling & Citra hops providing a intricate blend of herbal grass & tangerine citrus flavors and aroma. To pull this all together and to complete the ’cleansing’ aspect of my vision I gently finished the ale off with a touch of white sage, lending a mild earthy spice character to the blend. Of course let’s not forget our house saison yeast that brought all the elements together leaving a dry yet intricate finish.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Rabbid Rabbit
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Three Floyds Brewing Co. & Brewpub Rabbid Rabbit
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:7.4% ABV, 25 IBUs - This Franco-Belgian style Farmhouse Ale has an effervescent body and a light straw color. Rabbid Rabbit, with it’s light malt body, augmented by spices, is a complex and frothy beverage with a deceptively high alcohol content. March release.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Helios (V Saison)
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Victory Brewing Company Helios (V Saison)
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Repackaging of V Saison\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Red Barn Ale
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: The Lost Abbey Red Barn Ale
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:This Farmhouse Ale traces its roots to the small rustic breweries of Southern Belgium. The word Saison comes to us from the French language and it means Season. Lightly spiced with Organic Ginger, Orange Peels, Black Pepper and Grains of Paradise, this brew promises to quench your thirst on the hottest Southern California days or wherever your travels may take you.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Stateside Saison
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Stillwater Artisanal Ales Stateside Saison
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Stateside Saison pays homage to old world tradition while celebrating new world innovation. Naturally brewed with the finest European malts & fresh aromatic hops from the United States & New Zealand. It’s then fermented using a classic farmhouse ale yeast and bottle conditioned to enhance stability. The outcome is a beer of unique design and exquisite taste, showcasing some of the best attributes of modern-day craft brewing.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Bam Noire
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Jolly Pumpkin Artisan Ales Bam Noire

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: St. Feuillien Saison
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Brasserie St. Feuillien St. Feuillien Saison

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Carnevale
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: The Lost Abbey Carnevale
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Farmhouse style Saison with Brettanomyces, Amarillo and Simcoe Hops. Brewed in celebration of Lent and Easter season, Carnevale is light bodied Saison, using Brettanomyces along with Amarillo and Simcoe hops to generate flavor and depth. Carnevale’s complexity grows with time. The citrus notes tend to wane and the wild yeast rears its wonderfully tasting head.2008 (first release) did not have brettanomyces.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Love Buzz Saison
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Anchorage Brewing Company Love Buzz Saison
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Ale brewed with Hobbs Family rose hips, peppercorns, and fresh orange peels. Dry-hopped in the barrel with Citra hops. Second fermentation in Pinot Noir barrels.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Foret
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Brasserie Dupont sprl Foret

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Das Wunderkind!
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Jester King Craft Brewery Das Wunderkind
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Mature beer, refermented in oak barrels with wild yeast and souring bacteria is blended with fresh, dry-hopped beer prior to bottle-conditioning. Dry and lightly tart, with notes of citrus, barnyard, and tropical fruit.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Clara Grisette
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Hill Farmstead Brewery Clara
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Clara (1906-1969) was our grandfather’s sister; Hill Farmstead Brewery rests upon the land that was once home to her and her 13 siblings. In her honor, this Grisette is crafted from American malted barley, Vermont Organic Wheat, European and American hops, our distinctive farmhouse yeast and water from our well. Unfiltered and naturally carbonated, this is the ale that I dream to have shared with Clara. Pale Malt, Organic Vermont Wheat, American and European Hops, Ale Yeast, and our Well Water\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Magic Hat Brewing Company #9
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:A beer cloaked in secrecy. An ale whose mysterious and unusual palate will swirl across your tongue and ask more questions than it answers. A sort of dry, crisp, refreshing, not-quite pale ale. #9 is really impossible to describe because there's never been anything else quite like it.20 IBU\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Samuel Adams Cherry WheatBoston Beer Company (Samuel Adams)
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Boston Beer Company (Samuel Adams) Samuel Adams Cherry Wheat

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Raspberry Tart
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: New Glarus Brewing Company Raspberry Tart
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Treat yourself to a rare delight. The voluminous raspberry bouquet will greet you long before your lips touch your glass. Serve this Wisconsin framboise very cold in a champagne flute. Then hold your glass to a light and enjoy the jewel-like sparkle of a very special ale. Oregon proudly shares their harvest of mouth watering berries, which we ferment spontaneously in large oak vats. Then we employ Wisconsin farmed wheat and year old Hallertau hops to round out this extravaganza of flavor.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Summer Shandy
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Jacob Leinenkugel Brewing Company Leinenkugel's Summer Shandy

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Rübæus
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Founders Brewing Company Founders Rübæus
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:This brew achieves its unique raspberry taste by the addition of only fresh raspberries at five seperate stages in the brewing process.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Wisconsin Belgian Red
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: New Glarus Brewing Company Wisconsin Belgian Red
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:You hold the marriage of wine and beer. Belgian Red is a tapestry of flavor. This beer is brewed with whole Montmorency Cherries, Wisconsin Farmed Wheat and Belgian Roasted Barleys, lagered in oak tanks and balanced by Hallertau hops we aged in our brewery one full year. Over a pound of Door County Cherries in every bottle makes this beer uniquely "Wisconsin." So unique, in fact, that we applied for a patent. Expect this beer to be ruby red, with a medium body that is highly carbonated and intense with cherry flavor and bouquet. Serve your friends Belgian Red in a brandy snifter or champagne flute and toast life with beer from the land of Wisconsin.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Purple Haze
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Abita Brewing Co. Purple Haze
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Experience the magic of Purple Haze.® Clouds of real raspberries swirl in this tart and tantalizing lager inspired by the good spirits and dark mysteries of New Orleans. Brewed with pilsner and wheat malts along with Vanguard hops, let the scent of berries in the hazy purple brew put a spell on you.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Hell Or High Watermelon Wheat Beer
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: 21st Amendment Brewery Hell Or High Watermelon Wheat Beer
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Like Lady Liberty, we stand for independence and perseverance. In the pursuit of innovative beer, there is no obstacle too great. No journey too long. No fruit too gigantic. This American wheat beer is brewed with real watermelon, for a flavor that’s surprisingly crisp, dry and refreshing—summer in a can.17 IBU\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Blushing Monk
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Founders Brewing Company Founders Blushing Monk
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:When our love of fruit and our love of beer come together, Blushing Monk happens. Brewed with a ridiculous amount of raspberries for tart yet luscious raspberry-jam character and fermented with Belgian yeast for subtle fruit and spice esters. Think of Blushing Monk as Rubaeus’ older sibling – more intense, slightly larger and just a little bit more mature.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Éphémère (Apple)
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Unibroue Éphémère (Apple)
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:As its name suggests, Éphémère is an ephemeral ale that comes and goes with the seasons. It was developed as a series to feature a seasonal fruit in a refreshing, lightly spiced white ale. The label depicts a fairy, an ephemeral spirit associated with fruits picked at the peak of ripeness during each harvest season. She first appeared in the spring of 2001 and has since been celebrated on a variety of seasonal fruit ales such as apple (brewed all year long), cranberry, blackcurrant, peach, raspberry and blueberry.The most beloved and well known of the Éphémère beer series. Its amazing popularity across North America has made it a year-round favourite instead of only a seasonal brew.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Autumn Maple
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: The Bruery Autumn Maple
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Brewed with 17 lbs. of yams per barrel (in other words, a lot of yams!), this autumn seasonal is a different take on the "pumpkin" beer style. Brewed with cinnamon, nutmeg, allspice, vanilla, molasses, and maple syrup, and fermented with our traditional Belgian yeast strain, this bold and spicy beer is perfect on a cold autumn evening.ABV: 10%, IBU: 25, SRM: 15, Release: Fall\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Thumbprint Apple Ale
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: New Glarus Brewing Company Apple Ale

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Black & Blue
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Dogfish Head Brewery Black & Blue
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Black & Blue is a Belgian-style golden ale fermented with blackberries and blueberries. Because we dose Black & Blue with real berries -- rather than artificial flavoring -- the fruit comes through in the flavor, not just the aroma.The pureed berries are added as the beer leaves the brewhouse. In fermentation, the yeast -- the same one we use in Red & White and Pangaea -- feeds on sugars from the barley and the berries, giving Black & Blue a unique complexity and a high ABV.25 IBU\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Cerise
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Founders Brewing Company Founders Cerise
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:You’ll have a soft spot for this one. Using only fresh Michigan tart cherries, this beauty tantalizes with intense flavors combined with a no hesitation malt bill. Adding fresh cherries at five separate stages of fermentation achieves the ultimate balance between tartness and sweetness\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Strawberry Lager
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Abita Brewing Co. Strawberry Harvest Lager
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Strawberry Harvest Lager is a wheat beer made with real Louisiana strawberries, picked late in the season when they’re at their sweetest. This brew has earned quite a reputation in a short time, causing the brewery to up their production year after year. When this brew is found, emails and phone calls fly to friends informing them of the store’s location. Strawberry Harvest is a crisp, light lager with just a hint of strawberry sweetness.13 IBU\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Samuel Adams Cranberry LambicBoston Beer Company (Samuel Adams)
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Boston Beer Company (Samuel Adams) Samuel Adams Cranberry Lambic

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Shiner Ruby Redbird
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Spoetzl Brewery Shiner Ruby Redbird
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:This refreshing brew is made with juice from freshly picked Texas Ruby Red grapefruits, the prize of the Rio Grande Valley.A bold kick of ginger flavor combines with the tartness of the citrus for a tasty brew that's perfect anytime of year. Pure two row and Munich malts along with Mt. Hood, Citra, and Willamette hops give it a nicely balanced, lip-smacking finish. We like to think popping open this bottle is like slicing into a ripe Texas grapefruit. So pucker up and enjoy!\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Tweason'ale
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Dogfish Head Brewery Tweason'ale
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:For our first new 12-ounce 4-packs in nearly half a decade, we replaced the classic barley foundation of beer with a mild sorghum base. The hints of molasses and pit-fruit are balanced by vibrant strawberry notes and a unique complexity that comes with the addition of a malty buckwheat honey.We believe health-conscious beer drinkers and the millions of Americans who suffer from Celiac disease can cut back on gluten while relishing the distinction and drinkability of this very special brew.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Fort
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Dogfish Head Brewery Fort
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:An ale brewed with a ridiculous amount of pureed raspberries (over a ton of 'em!). Fort has a Belgian-style base, then we follow a similar fermentation process to the one we use on our other super-high ABV beers, 120 Minute IPA and World Wide Stout.49 IBUABV varies from 15-18%.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Soft Parade
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Short's Brewing Company Imperial Soft Parade
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Soft Parade is a Fruit Rye Ale brewed with rye flakes and loaded with pureed strawberries, blueberries, raspberries and blackberries. The rose colored ale has aromas of ripe strawberries and grain. With flavors of fresh berries and rye, Soft Parade finishes dry and eminently drinkable.Soft Parade was originally developed because Joe Short wanted to create a beer that incorporated a medley of berries, had a great color, and appealed to wine drinkers. The name Soft Parade stemmed from two moments in Joe Short’s life. First, because Joe worked as a brewer at the Traverse Brewing Company and The Doors album, The Soft Parade, played every day at the end of the brew shift. The second moment occurred when Joe was driving by himself, flipping through CD’s in his car, and came across The Soft Parade album again. At the time, The Soft Parade beer had not been named and it dawned on Joe that the medley of fruit infusing into the golden beer reminded him of a soft parade. That day the beer was named!\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Blue
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: SweetWater Brewing Company Sweetwater Blue

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Pyramid Apricot Ale
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Pyramid Breweries, Inc. Audacious Apricot Ale
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Originally named Apricot Weizen\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Stiegl Radler (Grapefruit)
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Stieglbrauerei zu Salzburg GmbH Stiegl Radler (Grapefruit)
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Real grapefruit juice gives this deliciously refreshing Radler (mixed beer drink) its amber natural cloudiness and pleasant tangy taste. The refreshingly fruity taste makes Stiegl-Radler Grapefruit a wonderful thirst quencher.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Tangerine Wheat
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Lost Coast Brewery and Cafe Tangerine Wheat

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Cucumber Saison
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Cigar City Brewing Cucumber Saison
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:We employ the humble cucumber in a low gravity Saison to create a vibrant ale with notes of melon, tropical fruit, lemongrass and, of course, cucumber. Put some cucumber wheels on your eyes, relax, and enjoy. Ahhhh.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Pumpkinfest
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Terrapin Beer Company Terrapin Pumpkinfest
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Although this is a pumpkin beer, it is a lager and therefore doesn't belong in the pumpkin ale category. Originally a Side Project, now a Fall seasonal in six-packs.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Apricot Wheat
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Ithaca Beer Company Apricot Wheat
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Our smooth wheat beer is light in color and body…perfect for those looking for a lighter taste. The combination of wheat and barley gives Apricot Wheat a different malt character than our other ales. The hint of apricot gives this beer a pleasant nose and fruity finish.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: UFO Raspberry Hefeweizen
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Harpoon Brewery UFO Raspberry Hefeweizen
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:We have added natural raspberry flavor to our UFO Hefeweizen to create this beer. Consistent with the hefeweizen style, this beer is unfiltered and cloudy with a solid foamy head. UFO Raspberry has a distinctive, hazy rose color. The scent of fresh raspberries hits the nose immediately, along with a subtle bready aroma from the wheat and yeast. The body is light and the unfiltered yeast provides a soft mouthfeel. The taste of the fruit compliments the beer nicely, neither overwhelms the other. There is a faint sweetness on the palate, which finishes cleanly in a semi-dry, tart finish.10 IBU\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Son Of A Peach
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: RJ Rockers Brewing Company Son Of A Peach
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:An unfiltered American wheat ale made with real mean peaches. The only thing missing is the fuzz. Savor the anger. Available during the late Spring and Summer months.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Bumble Berry Honey Blueberry Ale
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Fat Heads Brewery & Saloon Bumbleberry Honey Blueberry Ale
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Brewed with fresh harvested spring honey and infused with fresh blueberries. A light, refreshing ale with a nice blueberry aroma, crackery malt flavors, a hint of sweetness and a refreshing blueberry finish.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Blackbeary Wheat
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Long Trail Brewing Co. Blackbeary Wheat
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:This brew combines 2-Row Pilsen malt, a hint of Crystal malt, and of course, plenty of malted wheat. A hint of blackberry at the finish makes this beer a real thirst quencher! For the health conscious, Blackbeary Wheat has less than 6 grams of carbs and only 110 calories per bottle!10 IBU\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Raspberry Ale
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Dark Horse Brewing Company Dark Horse Raspberry Ale
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:This beer is a light bodied, easy drinking ale. We use real raspberries late in fermentation, giving this beer a mild fruit flavor while keeping a very balanced malt profile. This may not be what some would expect from a "fruit" beer, but our brewers make good beer; not fruity, carbonated malt beverages. Our motto is, "beer first, fruit second".\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Blueberry Ale
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Blue Point Brewing Company Blue Point Blueberry

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Pumpkin Lager
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Lakefront Brewery, Inc. Pumpkin Lager Beer
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Beer Brewed with Pumpkin and Spices\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Delirium Red
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Brouwerij Huyghe Delirium Red
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Also known as La Bouffonne Rouge\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Orange Blossom Cream Ale
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Buffalo Bill's Brewery Orange Blossom Cream Ale
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:A light ale with hints of fresh orange. Brewed with sweet orange peel, orange blossom extract and honey.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Pugsley's Signature Series: Smashed Blueberry
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Shipyard Brewing Co. Shipyard Smashed Blueberry (Pugsley's Signature Series)

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Fraoch Heather Ale
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Williams Brothers Brewing Company Fraoch Heather Ale
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Brewed in Scotland since 2000 B.C. heather ale is probably the oldest style of ale still produced in the world. From an ancient Gaelic recipe for "leann fraoich" (heather ale) it has been revived and reintroduced to the Scottish culture. Into the boiling bree of malted barley, sweet gale and flowering heather are added, then after cooling slightly the hot ale is poured into a vat of fresh heather flowers where it infuses for an hour before being fermented.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Alba Scots Pine Ale
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Williams Brothers Brewing Company Alba Scots Pine Ale
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Introduced by the Vikings, spruce and pine ales were very popular in the Scottish Highlands until the end of the 19th century. Many early explorers, including Captain Cook, used spruce ale during long sea voyages since it prevented scurvy and ill health. Shetland spruce ale was said to "stimulate animal instincts" and give you twins. Alba is a triple style ale brewed to a traditional Highland recipe from Scots pine and spruce shoots pickled during early spring. Pure malted barley, is boiled with the young sprigs of pine for several hours then the fresh shoots of the spruce are added for a short infusion before fermentation.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Ebulum Elderberry Black Ale
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Williams Brothers Brewing Company Ebulum Elderberry Black Ale
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Introduced to Scotland by Welsh druids in the 9th Century, elderberry black ale was part of the Celtic Autumn festivals when the "elders" would make this strong ale and pass the drink round the people of the village. The recipe was taken from a 16th Century record of domestic drinking in the Scottish Highlands. Elderberries were used for many natural remedies to cure sciatica, other forms of neuralgia, influenza and rhumatism as they contain tannins and fruit oils. Ebulum is made from roasted oats, barley and wheat boiled with herbs then fermented with ripe elderberries.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Grozet
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Williams Brothers Brewing Company Grozet Gooseberry & Wheat Ale
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:From the Gaelic "Groseid", Since at least the 16th century Scots monks and alewives brewed indigenous drinks from cereals, wild herbs and ripe fruits. Tibbie Shiels green Grozet was immortalised by such Scots literati as Sir Walter Scott, Jas Hogg. (The Ettrick shepherd) and Robert Burns whoconsidered it a most convivial drink. Brewed with lager malt, wheat, bog myrtle, hops and meadowsweet then secondary fermented with ripe Scottish gooseberries.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Kelpie Seaweed Ale
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Williams Brothers Brewing Company Kelpie Seaweed Ale
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:At least four hundred years ago, the coastal & Island farmers of Scotland used seaweed beds to grow their cereal crops. This barley produced very interesting flavors in the ale and whiskey they produced. Including bladderwrack seaweed in the mash tun along with organic barley gives this wholesome dark ale a distinctive flavor.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: 13th Century Grut Bier
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Professor Fritz Briem Professor Fritz Briem 13th Century Grut Bier
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Created by Dr. Fritz Briem of Doemens Institute ( http://www.doemens.org ), brewed by Weihenstephan & Doemens.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Posca Rustica
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Brasserie Dupont sprl Posca Rustica

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Koyt
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Jopen Bier BV Haarlem Jopen Koyt
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Jopen Koyt is a gruitbeer (herb beer) that is brewed according to the bierkeur (city recipe) from 1407. The beer is brewed with malted barley, malted wheat and oats and has a malty taste with a smooth herbal finish. The aroma has a hint of herbs and spices mixed with dark malt. Jopen Koyt is the only gruitbeer from the Netherlands. Gold medal winner at the European Beerstar competition in 2009 and a silver medal at the European Beerstar Competition in 2011.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Bog Water
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Beau's All Natural Brewing Company Bogwater
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Malty, with a plum-like fruitiness that is offset by spicy, earthy bitterness.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Working For Tips
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Moonlight Brewing Company Working For Tips

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Weekapaug Gruit
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Magnolia Pub & Brewery Weekapaug Gruit
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Discovery your inner Viking with our ever-changing unhopped fruit ale. Combining gentian and angelica root, cherry bark, yarrow, elderberries and dandelion greens, it is a distinctly unique beer from an ancient brewing tradition.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Blessed Thistle
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Cairngorm Brewery Company, The Blessed Thistle
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Truly unique. A reddish brown ale that is primarily bittered with "Blessed Thistle". The late addition of Goldings hops and ginger add to the flavours of this most complex of beers.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Heather Ale
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Kuhnhenn Brewing Company Kuhnhenn Heather Ale

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Artemis
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Moonlight Brewing Company Artemis

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Two Weeks Notice
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Moonlight Brewing Company Two Weeks Notice

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: La Clef Des Champs
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Brasserie Dieu Du Ciel La Clef Des Champs

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Gothic Ale
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Triumph Brewing Company Gothic Ale

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Andromeda Heather Ale
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Dragonmead Microbrewery Dragonmead Andromeda Ale
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Dragonmead uses heather tips imported from Scotland to create this unusual brew. Its malty sweet aroma does not disappoint. Chocolate Malt imparts a great deal of the flavor of this beer but does not over-power the finish, which is defined by the powdery dryness of the heather. All in all, a malty brew with a very clean finish.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Reggae Junkie
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Upright Brewing Company Reggae Junkie

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Kirin Tanrei
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Kirin Brewery Company, Limited Kirin Tanrei

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Kinmugi (Rich Malt)
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Suntory Suntory Rich Malt

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Clear Sakura Beer
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Asahi Breweries Ltd Clear Asahi

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Asahi Honnama Red
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Asahi Breweries Ltd Asahi Honnama Red

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Kirin Tanrei Green Label
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Kirin Brewery Company, Limited Kirin Tanrei Green Label

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Asahi Honnama Aqua Blue
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Asahi Breweries Ltd Asahi Honnama Aqua Blue

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Orion Mugi Shokunin
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Orion Beer Co., Ltd. Orion Mugi Shokunin

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Sapporo Draft One
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Sapporo Breweries Ltd. Sapporo Draft One

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Kinshachi Nagoya Red Miso Lager
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Land Beer Kinshachi Nagoya Red Miso Lager

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Orion Southern Star
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Orion Beer Co., Ltd. Orion Southern Star

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Kirin Enjuku
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Kirin Brewery Company, Limited Kirin Enjuku

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Helios Goya Dry
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Helios Distillery Co., Ltd. Helios Goya Dry

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Asahi Honnama Gold
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Asahi Breweries Ltd Asahi Honnama Gold

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Kirin Nodogoshi
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Kirin Brewery Company, Limited Kirin Nodogoshi

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Kirin Shirokirin
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Kirin Brewery Company, Limited Kirin Shirokirin

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Jokki (Jug Nama)
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Suntory Jokki (Jug Nama)

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Asahi Shinnama
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Asahi Breweries Ltd Asahi Shinnama

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Kirin Enjuku Kuro
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Kirin Brewery Company, Limited Kirin Enjuku Kuro

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Honkaku Karakuchi Mugi
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Kirin Brewery Company, Limited Honkaku Karakuchi Mugi

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Sapporo Mugi To Hopppu (trans. Barley And Hop)
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Sapporo Breweries Ltd. Sapporo Mugi To Hopppu (trans. Barley And Hop)

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Asahi Strong Off
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Asahi Breweries Ltd Asahi Strong Off

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Orion Nangoku Monogatari
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Orion Beer Co., Ltd. Orion Nangoku Monogatari

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Akiraku
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Suntory Akiraku

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Midas Touch
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Dogfish Head Brewery Midas Touch Golden Elixir
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:This sweet yet dry beer is made with ingredients found in 2,700-year-old drinking vessels from the tomb of King Midas. Somewhere between wine and mead, Midas will please the chardonnay and beer drinker alike.12 IBU\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Chateau Jiahu
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Dogfish Head Brewery Chateau Jiahu
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Let's travel back in time again for another Dogfish Head Ancient Ale (Midas Touch was our first foray and Theobroma our most recent). Our destination is 9,000 years ago, in Northern China! Preserved pottery jars found in the Neolithic villiage of Jiahu, in Henan province, have revealed that a mixed fermented beverage of rice, honey and fruit was being produced that long ago, right around the same time that barley beer and grape wine were beginning to be made in the Middle East!Fast forward to 2005. Molecular archaeologist Dr. Patrick McGovern of the University of Pennsylvania Museum of Archaeology and Anthropology calls on Dogfish Head to re-create another ancient beverage, and Chateau Jiahu is born.In keeping with historic evidence, Dogfish brewers use brown rice syrup, orange blossom honey, muscat grape, barley malt and hawthorn berry. The wort is fermented for about a month with sake yeast until the beer is ready for packaging.10 IBU\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Good Juju
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Left Hand Brewing Company Good Juju (Ginger Ale)

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Juniper Pale Ale
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Rogue Ales Juniper Pale Ale
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:10 Ingredients:Malts: Northwest Harrington, Crystal,Triumph, Maier Munich & C-15.Hops: Styrian Golding & Amarillo.Specialty: Juniper berries. Rogue' s Yeast & Water: Rogue's Pacman Yeast & Free Range Coastal Water.13º PLATO34 IBU77 AA3º Lovibond\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Agave Wheat
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Breckenridge Brewery Agave Wheat
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Agave complements the refreshingly light quality of our wheat and adds a subtle note of flavor that expands this beer’s uplifting taste profile. It is familiar, yet creative.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Rosée D'Hibiscus
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Brasserie Dieu Du Ciel Rosée D'hibiscus
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Rosée D’Hibiscus is a delicate wheat beer with a floral and lightly acidic character. Its beautiful pink colour comes from the hibiscus flowers used in the brewing process. A perfumed aroma invokes fresh pink grapefruit and the pleasing texture persists nicely. A refreshing, quenching ale perfect for hot summer days & nights.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Ta Henket
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Dogfish Head Brewery Ta Henket
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:For this ambitious liquid time capsule, we used ingredients and traditions plucked from Egyptian hieroglyphics.Ta Henket is brewed with an ancient form of wheat and loaves of hearth-baked bread, and it's flavored with chamomile, dom-palm fruit and Middle Eastern herbs. To ferment this earthy ancient ale, Sam and friends traveled to Cairo, set out baited petri dishes and captured a native Egyptian saccharomyces yeast strain.7 IBU\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Poor Richard's Tavern Spruce Ale
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Yards Brewing Co. Poor Richard's Tavern Spruce Ale
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Based on Franklin’s original recipe, which called for barley, molasses, and essence of spruce, our Tavern Spruce is as approachable and engaging as was the man himself. We source blue spruce clippings from a local organic farmer, steeping them in the kettle to create this one-of-a-kind deep amber ale.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Hitachino Nest Real Ginger Ale
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Kiuchi Brewery Hitachino Nest Real Ginger Brew
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Marketed as "Real Ginger Brew" in the USA.Ginger Ale is brewed using fresh fragrant raw ginger.Malts: Marris Otter, Munich, Crystal, ChocolateHops: Chinook, Perle, Styrian GoldingAdjuncts: raw ginger\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Jaw-Jacker
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Arcadia Brewing Company Arcadia Jaw-Jacker
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:This spiced amber-wheat ale is our celebration of the arrival of Autumn. Using the finest malted barley and a small amount of wheat for mouthfeel, Jaw-Jacker displays a brilliant orange-amber color, despite the absence of pumpkin in the recipe. The addition of cinnamon, all-spice, and nutmeg (in the exact proportions of a family pumpkin pie recipe) creates a refreshingly spicy, season brew.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Mandarin Nectar
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Alpine Beer Company Mandarin Nectar
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Fresh organic orange zest and cracked coriander complement the orange blossom honey used in this ale. Like a mountain breeze through the citrus trees. 1.060 OG 6 IBU\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: El Mole Ocho
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: New Holland Brewing Company New Holland El Mole Ocho
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Our exploration into the flavors of mole, the legendary sauce of central Mexico. Malty aroma and rich, cocoa-laden body laced with an invigorating tinge of dries chilies and coffee.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Applehead
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Shipyard Brewing Co. Applehead
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Applehead is a crisp, refreshing wheat ale with a delightful apple aroma and subtle cinnamon flavor.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Baladin Nora
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Birrificio Le Baladin Baladin Nora
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:This Egyptian inspired brew is spiced with ginger, myrrh, and orange peel ... very complex.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Bison Organic Gingerbread Ale
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Bison Brewing Bison Organic Gingerbread Ale
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:20 IBU\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Mexican Chocolate Stout
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Copper Kettle Brewing Company Mexican Chocolate Stout
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Gold Medal Winner at Great American Beer Fest - Herb and Spice Category. A rich black ale with roasted malt flavors blended with bittersweet chocolate, our own blend of three Mexican chili peppers and cinnamon.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Bison Organic Honey Basil
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Bison Brewing Bison Organic Honey Basil
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:This Bison classic brew is infused with honey for a hint of sweetness and aroma. Fresh organic basil lends a slight herbal note and a hint of basil - a perfectly refreshing brew.

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Rude Elf's Reserve
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Allentown Brew Works Rude Elf's Reserve

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Underlig Jul
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Brewery: Nøgne Ø - Det Kompromissløse Bryggeri A/S
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Nøgne Ø - Det Kompromissløse Bryggeri A/S Underlig Jul
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:15°P, 30 IBU.Also sold as "Peculiar Yule".Ingredients: Maris Otter, Munich, caramel, and chocolate malt; Columbus and Cascade hops; 5 different spices, English ale yeast, and our local Grimstad water\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Lemon Tea Ale
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Mill Street Brew Pub Mill Street Lemon Tea Ale
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Sunset-coloured (orangey-amber) slightly sweet, malty palate with dry lemon-tea finish. Beer made with addition of Black tea leaves and lemon in aging tank. Very smooth and quenching; unfiltered.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Ginger Beard
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Wychwood Brewery Company Ltd Ginger Beard

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Red/White Christmas
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Mikkeller ApS Red/White Christmas
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:A combination between a British Red Ale and a Belgian Wit Bier.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: La MeuleBFM (Brasserie des Franches-Montagnes)
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: BFM Brasserie Des Franches-Montagnes La Meule
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:La Meule, blond ale with sage, frankly bitter with a subtle bouquet.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Nor'Easter Lager
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Thomas Hooker Brewing Company Thomas Hooker Nor'Easter Lager
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Brewed to celebrate winter in New England, Nor'Easter Lager possesses a hearty malt flavor delicately accented by mild winter spices.16 IBU\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Sculpin
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Ballast Point Brewing Company Ghost Pepper Sculpin
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Originally named Northstar IPA. Debuted in 2005.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: 60 Minute IPA
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Dogfish Head Brewery 60 Minute IPA
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:60 Minute IPA is continuously hopped -- more than 60 hop additions over a 60-minute boil. (Getting a vibe of where the name came from?)60 Minute is brewed with a slew of great Northwest hops. A powerful but balanced East Coast IPA with a lot of citrusy hop character, it's the session beer for hardcore enthusiasts!60 IBU\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Torpedo Extra IPA
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Sierra Nevada Brewing Co. Sierra Nevada Torpedo Extra IPA
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:From the brewery ... Sierra Nevada Torpedo Ale is a big American IPA; bold, assertive and full of flavor and aromas highlighting the complex citrus, pine and herbal character of whole-cone American hops.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Celebration Fresh Hop IPA
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Sierra Nevada Brewing Co. Sierra Nevada Celebration Ale
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Fresh Hop Ale; no spices.We first brewed Celebration IPA in the winter of 1981. Each year, we use only the first fresh hops of the growing season to create this complex and robust ale. Layered pine and citrus hop aromas balance delicately against rich, malt sweetness to shape this bold wintertime classic.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: A Little Sumpin' Sumpin' Ale
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Lagunitas Brewing Company A Little Sumpin' Sumpin' Ale
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Brewed with 50% wheat malt; Willamette, Santiam, Amarillo, Cascade, Centennial, Chinook, and Columbus hops. This special ale is something fairly new under the sun. It's got a lot of wheat, it's rich with hops, it finishes dry. We've watched with some amusement as the internet beer rating sites argues over how to 'classify' it. We're in the camp with Japhy Ryder when he declares to Ray Smith that "Comparisons are odious!" You ever notice how everything has to be today's version of yesterday's whatever. Well, whatEver. Sometimes we wonder what the world would be like if everything was perceived for what it is, and not what it reminds you of. The sun would rise everyday as if for the first time, you'd wake as if newly born, you'd see your lover next to you anew, the air would smell like flowers, work would be like the first day back in school, a beer would make your eyes roll back in your head in ecstasy... well, maybe not... but you get the idea.....Way smooth and silky with a nice wheatly-esque-ish-ness. A truly unique style featuring a strong hop finish on a silky body. A hoppy pale wheat ale that is great for IPA fans but so smooth that the hefeweizen fans dig it too.64 IBU\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Jai Alai IPA
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Cigar City Brewing Jai Alai IPA
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Jai Alai, a game native to the Basque region of Spain, is played on a court called a fronton. Jai Alai players attempt to catch a ball using a curved mitt whilst the ball travels at speeds up to 188 mph! Proving they have a sense of humor the Spanish dubbed this game, with its ball traveling at race car speeds, "the merry game." Tampa was once home to a bustling Jai Alai fronton but sadly all that remains of Jai Alai in the Tampa Bay area is this India Pale Ale that we brew in tribute to the merry game. The India Pale Ale style of beer has its roots in the ales sent from England to thirsty British troops in India during the 18th century. Pair Jai Alai India Pale Ale with beef empanadas, deviled crabs and other spicy dishes.65 IBU\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Centennial IPA
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Founders Brewing Company Founders Centennial IPA
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Get ready to bask in the glory of the frothy head’s floral bouquet. Relish the citrus accents from the abundance of dry hopping. This one’s sweet, yet balanced. Malty undertones shake hands with the hop character for a finish that never turns too bitter.65 IBU\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: All Day IPA
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Founders Brewing Company Founders All Day IPA
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:The beer you’ve been waiting for. Keeps your taste satisfied while keeping your senses sharp. An all-day IPA naturally brewed with a complex array of malts, grains and hops. Balanced for optimal aromatics and a clean finish. The perfect reward for an honest day’s work and the ultimate companion to celebrate life’s simple pleasures.Formerly Endurance - All Day IPA.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: HopDevil
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Victory Brewing Company HopDevil Ale
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Bold, spicy and menacingly delicious, this American-hopped IPA offers an aromatic punch and follows through with a lasting, full-bodied finish\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Blind Pig
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Russian River Brewing Company Blind Pig IPA
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Full-bodied, very hoppy, with citrus, pine, fruity notes and a nice dry, bitter finish!Original Gravity: 1.058Color: CopperBitterness: Medium\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Furious
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Surly Brewing Company Furious
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:A tempest on the tongue, or a moment of pure hop bliss? Brewed with a dazzling blend of American hops and Scottish malt, this crimson-hued ale delivers waves of citrus, pine and caramel-toffee. For those who favor flavor, Furious has the hop-fire your taste buds have been screaming for.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Lunch
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Maine Beer Company Lunch
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Our “East Coast” version of a West Coast-style IPA. Intense hop flavors and aromas of tropical and citrus fruits and pine dominate. A subtle malt sweetness brings the beer into balance.Lunch is a special whale that has been spotted off the Maine coast since 1982. She has what looks like a bite taken out of her fin, which adds to her unique character. We dedicate this beer to her determination and persistence.Keep on swimming!\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Fresh Squeezed IPA
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Deschutes Brewery Fresh Squeezed IPA
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:This mouthwateringly delicious IPA gets its flavor from a heavy helping of Citra and Mosaic hops. Don't worry, no fruit was harmed in the making of this beer.60 IBU\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Flower Power India Pale Ale
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Ithaca Beer Company Flower Power India Pale Ale
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Enjoy the clover honey hue and tropical nose. Simultaneously punchy and soothing with a big body and a finish that boasts pineapple and grapefruit. Flower Power is hopped and dry-hopped five different times throughout the brewing and fermentation process.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Smuttynose IPA "Finest Kind"
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Smuttynose Brewing Company Smuttynose IPA "Finest Kind"
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:You could say, then, that Smuttynose IPA is a physical salute to the glory of the American hop grower. The citrusy hop flavor coming from a mixture of Simcoe and Santiams is pleasantly balanced by a smooth bitterness from the Amarillo hops. The beer itself is light bodied and crisp with a golden color that will throw a slight haze, as we bottle it unfiltered. At 75 IBU's, this is definitely not a training-wheels IPA, but is meant for hop lovers looking to satisfy their craving in a way that's not easy to find. We think they’ll be quite pleased.75 IBU\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: ApriHop
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Dogfish Head Brewery ApriHop
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Aprihop is an American IPA brewed with Pilsner and Crystal malts. It's massively hopped -- in the continuous fashion, of course! -- and the flavor is complemented by the addition of apricots.After fermentation, the beer is dry hopped with irresponsible amounts of Amarillo hops. The beer has a hoppy aroma, with the apricots playing a supporting role.The flavor is rich with late hop flavors, and its bitterness is tempered by just the right amount of malt sweetness and fruity undertones from the apricots.50 IBU\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Harvest Ale
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Founders Brewing Company Founders Harvest Ale
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Each fall, our brewhouse looks more like a greenhouse as thousands of pounds of wet hop cones arrive within hours of being picked by some of our favorite local hop growers. Acting quickly, we then load up these wet hops into what will become Harvest Ale – an impossibly aromatic and bright IPA bursting with fresh pine, melon and citrus notes. Our ode to the beauty that is the wet, American hop.70 IBU\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Duet
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Alpine Beer Company Duet IPA
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:A soon-to-be favorite, if it's already not. This single IPA boasts pine, citrus, and cedar notes from Simcoe and Amarillo hops.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Head Hunter
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Fat Heads Brewery & Saloon Fat Head's Head Hunter IPA
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Head Hunter is an aggressively dry-hopped, West Coast-style IPA with a huge hop display of pine, grapefruit, citrus and pineapple. A punch-you-in-the-mouth brew for those who truly love their hops! Uncivilized. Aggressive. Award-Winning.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Hop Nosh IPA
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Uinta Brewing Company Hop Notch IPA
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Bold and refreshing, this IPA combines an abundance of hops with a smooth malt profile.82 IBU\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Big Eye
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Ballast Point Brewing Company Big Eye Double Ginger

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: IPA
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: AleSmith Brewing Company AleSmith IPA

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Titan IPA
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Great Divide Brewing Company Titan IPA
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Titan IPA is a big, aggressively hopped India Pale Ale brewed for hop disciples. It starts out with piney hop aromas and citrus hop flavors, and finishes with a nice rich, malty sweetness that is balanced with crisp hop bitterness.2007 European Beer Star, Nuremberg, Silver Medal, IPA2007 Australian International Beer Awards, Silver Medal, IPA2008 Australian International Beer Awards, Silver Medal, IPAFOOD PAIRINGS: Grilled lamb burger, Thai green curry, roasted zucchini & pesto, Cabot sharp cheddar, carrot cake.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Nelson
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Alpine Beer Company Nelson
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:A Golden Rye IPA - An outstanding hop from New Zealand, Nelson Sauvin, is generously used throughout the brewing and dry-hopping of this unique beer. European rye is added for a smooth, malty addition to flavor. 1.065 OG 7% AB\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Samuel Adams Latitude 48 IPABoston Beer Company (Samuel Adams)
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Boston Beer Company (Samuel Adams) Samuel Adams Latitude 48 IPA

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Hop Wallop
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Victory Brewing Company Hop Wallop
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Citra and Simcoe Hops impart fruity and earthy notes for a new twist on a flavorful friend. This IPA packs a hoppy wallop.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: 75 Minute IPA
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Dogfish Head Brewery 75 Minute IPA
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Blend two Dogfish Head favorites, add maple syrup and carbonate the mixture naturally. What do you get? 75 Minute IPA.The carbon dioxide trapped during bottle conditioning gives 75 Minute IPA a soft and velvety mouthfeel. Dry-hopped with whole-leaf Cascades, this complex IPA has been known to inspire pilgrimages to our brewpub.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Northern Hemisphere Harvest Wet Hop IPA
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Sierra Nevada Brewing Co. Northern Hemisphere Harvest Wet Hop Ale
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Formerly Northern Hemisphere Harvest Wet Hop Ale\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: IPA
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: SweetWater Brewing Company Sweetwater IPA
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:This mammoth IPA is defined by generous quantities of juicy American hops. The extensive dry hopping process contributes to its bright and flavorful character. This beer is unfiltered to leave all the natural flavors intact and bottle conditioned to stay super fresh.Malt Bill: Munich, Wheat, 2-Row, 70/80Hops: Columbus, Chinook, Cascade, Simcoe, GoldingDry Hop: Simcoe, US Golding50 IBU\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Hopsecutioner
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Terrapin Beer Company Terrapin Hopsecutioner
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:This Killer IPA earns its name by using six different types of hops while still remaining an aggressive well balanced beer.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Anchor Liberty Ale
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Anchor Brewing Company Anchor Liberty Ale
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:The champagne-like bubbles, distinctive hop bouquet, and balanced character of Liberty Ale® revives centuries-old ale brewing traditions that are now more relevant than ever.\tFirst introduced in 1975, Liberty Ale® is brewed strictly according to traditional craft brewing methods, and uses only natural ingredients — pale malted barley, fresh whole-cone Cascade hops and a special top-fermenting yeast, and water.The yeast used during fermentation produces many of Liberty Ale's subtle flavors and characteristics. A natural process called "bunging" creates gentle carbonation, and the practice of dry hopping (adding fresh hops to the brew during aging), revived by Anchor, creates its unique aroma.Liberty Ale® was first brewed to celebrate the bicentennial of Paul Revere’s historic ride. As the first modern American IPA brewed after prohibition and the first modern American single-hop ale and dry-hopped ale, Anchor’s Liberty Ale® is the original craft brewed ale and the historic beer that started a revolution.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Snake Dog
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Flying Dog Brewery Snake Dog IPA
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:A potent snakebite of Citra, Mosaic, Warrior, Simcoe, and Columbus hops (more than 2lbs per barrel) gives this beer its citrus-forward superpower. Orange and tropical fruit aromas temper slightly-piney crispness, turning Snake Dog into a more complex breed of West Coast IPA. You’ll find Snake Dog bites hardest when paired with peppery cheeses, curries, and mild Thai dishes whose names you can’t pronounce properly.60 IBU\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Deviant Dale's IPA
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Oskar Blues Grill & Brew Deviant Dale's IPA

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Brew Free Or Die IPA
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: 21st Amendment Brewery 21st Amendment IPA
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:BREW FREE! OR DIE IPA is brewed with some serious west coast attitude. This aromatic golden IPA starts with three different hops to the nose, quickly balanced by a solid malt backbone supporting the firm bitterness. Our top selling beer at the pub, this IPA starts big and finishes clean leaving you wanting more.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Crooked Tree IPA
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Dark Horse Brewing Company Dark Horse Crooked Tree IPA
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Inspired by West Coast I.P.A.'s, but brewed with Michigan style. The Crooked Tree is heavily dry hopped to give it a big aroma of pine and citrus. The flavors are big, yet very balanced between fresh hops and malt. Often described as "grapefruit" our hops give this beer an excellent fruit flavor that finishes dry.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: IPA
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Odell Brewing Company British IPA
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Pale and Vienna malts along with 9 different US hop varietiesWe took the traditional IPA, originally shipped from England to India in the 1700's, and made it bolder and more flavorful—American Style. We added new varieties of highly aromatic American hops to create a distinctive bitterness profile and an incredible hop character.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Hop Ottin' IPA
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Anderson Valley Brewing Company Hop Ottin' IPA
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Our Hop Ottin’ IPA is brewed and dry-hopped with copious amounts of Columbus and Cascade. This beer is a showcase of the bright citrusy aromas, bold grapefruit and pine-like flavors, and resiny bitterness that hop heads crave. With a brilliant, deep amber color and solid malt backbone, hints of citron, roses, and bergamot climax with a dry, herbal finish in this well-balanced interpretation of a West Coast IPA.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: India Pale Ale (IPA)
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Avery Brewing Company India Pale Ale (IPA)
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:A Colorado IPA with crisp, juicy, and resinous hops and a rich, malty finish.IBUs: 65\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Raging Bitch
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Flying Dog Brewery Raging Bitch Belgian-Style IPA
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Two inflammatory words...one wild drink. Nectar imprisoned in a bottle. An anything-but-delicate blend of sharp hoppiness and fruity aroma, this beer is a life-changing backyard knife-fight for your palate. Once you’ve had a Raging Bitch, everything else pales in comparison. Fermented with a volcano-like Belgian yeast strain called “El Diablo,” Raging Bitch earned its polarizing name from the aggressively active nature of the yeast—unleashed, untamed, unbridled...and in heat. Enjoy its golden glow and white foaming head alongside bold flavors like spicy BBQ wings, blue cheese salads, or that bag of family-sized Cool Ranch Doritos you’re going to destroy later while binge-watching Netflix.Malts: CaramelHops: Warrior, Columbus, AmarilloYeast: Belgian (El Diablo)IBU: 60\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: A Little Sumpin' Wild
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Lagunitas Brewing Company A Little Sumpin' Wild
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Fermented with the Westmalle yeast strain72.51 IBU\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Houblon Chouffe Dobbelen IPA Tripel
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Brasserie d'Achouffe Houblon Chouffe Dobbelen IPA Tripel
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:The gnomes of Fairyland may be little, but they have big, very big, personalities. HOUBLON CHOUFFE matches their impish spirits. All gnomes, with their innate good taste, are in full agreement about HOUBLON CHOUFFE, which is flavoured by three different types of hops. This India Pale Ale is appreciated for its pronounced bitterness combined with the fruity tones of traditional Achouffe beers: it softens the strongest of characters.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Green Flash Le Freak
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Green Flash Brewing Co. Green Flash Le Freak
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Le Freak® is the first-ever hybrid ale of its kind: the convergence of a Belgian-Style Trippel with an American Imperial IPA. This zesty Amarillo dry-hopped, bottle-conditioned marvel entices with fruity Belgian yeast aromatics and a firm, dry finish. Aromas of orange and passion fruit with sweet bready malts, and flavors of orange marmalade and citrus fruit pith. Experience a legendary beer.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Chainbreaker White IPA
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Deschutes Brewery Chainbreaker White IPA

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Citra Bitter Monk
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Anchorage Brewing Company Bitter Monk
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Belgian style double IPA with Brettanomyces. this ale is aged in french oak chardonnay barrels. Brewed with Apollo, Citra, and Simcoe hops. Dry hopped in the barrel with Citra hops. Triple fermented- First in the tank with a Belgian yeast, second in french oak chardonnay barrels with brett, and finally in the bottle with a third yeast for natural carbonation.100 IBU\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Hugh Malone
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Allagash Brewing Company Allagash Hugh Malone
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Hugh Malone begins with a grain bill featuring a blend of Maine grown barley, imported Pilsner, and raw wheat malt. At the beginning of run off, we add a portion of hops to the sweet wort in the kettle; a technique known as "first wort hopping". As the boil begins, a generous amount of Chinook hops are added for bittering. Later, in the whirlpool, the beer is hopped with a blend of Centennial and Amarillo, for aroma. This same blend is used, post fermentation, to lend additional hop character to the finished beer. The result is a complex brew with a malty palate, intense hop aromas, pronounced bitterness and a pleasantly dry finish.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Urthel Hop-ItDe Leyerth Brouwerijen (Urthel)
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: De Leyerth Brouwerijen (Urthel) Urthel Hop-It

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Otter Creek Fresh Slice
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Otter Creek Brewing / Wolaver's Otter Creek Solstice
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:A summer sipper built for lawn chairs, lawn games and lawn mowing, Fresh Slice features the spicy, estery flavor profile of Belgian yeast laced with the juicy hop flavors and aromas of American hops. This White IPA recipe tips the scales with a slice of clementine, a hit of coriander and an 1/8th of...wait, what? This one features a crisp, fresh citrus ripeness deriving from additions of clementine juice and sweet orange peel in the brew process. The first Otter Creek can offering, this is one slice you'll be holding all summer long!\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Bedlam
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Ale Asylum Bedlam
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Bedlam! A chaotic blend of Citra hops and Belgian yeast give this IPA aromas of summer fruits and a bright hop presence with a plush finish.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Gouden Carolus Hopsinjoor
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Brouwerij Het Anker Gouden Carolus Hopsinjoor

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Dernière Volonté
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Brasserie Dieu Du Ciel Dernière Volonté
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:The Last Will is born from a meeting between the Belgian and British brewing traditions. It has a complex nose of flowers and alcohol, supported by slightly fruity and malty flavors, all topped by a strong hop bouquet. In the mouth it is spicy and fruity hints and a discrete touch of alcohol. In the final, hops up the rear with force.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: The Audacity Of Hops
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Cambridge Brewing Company The Audacity Of Hops
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Belgian Double IPA.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Saranac White IPA
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Matt Brewing Company Saranac White IPA

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Smuttynose Homunculus (Big Beer Series)
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Smuttynose Brewing Company Smuttynose Homunculus (Big Beer Series)
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:This hoppy, Belgian-style golden ale first appeared in early 2007 as the first edition of our Short Batch Series. At that time, we called it the Gnome, an homage to Brasserie d'Achouffe.45 IBU2011 - 9.9%\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Triomphe Belgian IPA
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Brewery Vivant Triomphe Belgian IPA

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Hopus
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Brasserie Lefèbvre SA Hopus

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: HopAnomaly - Reserve Series Aged In French Oak Chardonnay Barrels
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Nebraska Brewing Company Hop God Reserve Series Aged In French Oak Chardonnay Barrels
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:An artful creation which began with our HopAnomaly Belgian-Style IPA, enhanced by a 6 month maturation in French Oak Chardonnay Barrels. This version of Hop God is a fascinating, big, bold Belgian-style Tripel hopped in very high amounts to concentrate citrus, grapefruit and floral aromatics in the nose. The addition of Chardonnay barrel aging adds further dimension and oak tannins to an already wonderfully complex Ale – bringing to mind tropical fruits and peach. We know of nothing that compares – enjoy!87 IBU\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Simcoe Silly
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Kuhnhenn Brewing Company Kuhnhenn Simcoe Silly
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:This Pale American Belgo style beer was 2010 GABF’s silver medal winner. It has notes of spicy pineapple, mango bubblegum aromas which comes from the unique marriage of a special Belgian yeast and an American Simcoe hop. This beer has an initial soft malt sweetness with orange fruitiness and finishes with a hoppy dryness.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Pan Galactic Gargle Blaster
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Short's Brewing Company Pan Galactic Gargle Blaster
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Pan Galactic Gargle Blaster is a Belgian-style Double IPA brewed with Australian Galaxy hops. The nose is an impressive dank blend of citrus aromas reminiscent of guava and lemons, very green and fresh with subtle Belgian yeast esters. An intense clean bitterness dominates the flavor profile with little malt character to compete with. A slight, fruity yeast sweetness is noticeable in the finish alongside a resounding bitterness.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: White IPA
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Blue Point Brewing Company Blue Point IPA

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Hoppy Daze IPA
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Coronado Brewing Company Hoppy Daze IPA

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Hop Wrangler
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Peace Tree Brewing Co. Hop Wrangler
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Joe’s multinational take on a classic IPA. IPA’s are known for their intense hop bitterness, flavor and aromas. First, Joe used American and English malt, then American and English hops are added during the mash, first wort, boil, and finally it’s dry hopped for aroma. Belgium gets involved with the yeast and a special candy sugar finish for smoothness and flavor.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Gaspar Ale
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Picobrouwerij Alvinne / Den Bierzolder Gaspar Ale

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: White Birch Hooksett Ale
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: White Birch Brewing White Birch Hooksett Ale
