dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Combining jet black color with incredibly smooth texture and decadent coffee flavor, BREWTALITY breaks the expectations of both rich espresso and dark beer to create a whole 'nuther beast. While brutal in alcoholic strength, this biggie beautifully showcases its roasted malt and coffee flavors without bringing on bitterness and bite. This is the first of two lagers in the series.17 IBU\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Sustenance Black Beer - Bourbon Barrel-Aged
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Short's Brewing Company Short's Bourbon Barrel Sustenance Black Beer
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Sustenance Black Beer aged it in bourbon barrels for 11 months.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Sustenance Black Bier
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Short's Brewing Company Short's Sustenance Black Bier

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Dark Helmet Imperial Schwarzbier
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Brewery: The Brew Kettle Taproom & Smokehouse / Production Works
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: The Brew Kettle Taproom & Smokehouse / Production Works Ringneck Dark Helmet Imperial Schwarzbier
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:A true TBK original, we kick this German-style black lager up a couple notches. Big clean malty flavor with just a hint of roasted malt."May the Schwartz be with you!"\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Zeitgeist
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: BrewDog Zeitgeist

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: LA-31 Bière Noire
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Bayou Teche Brewery LA-31 Bière Noire
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:We use specially roasted German malts and select American hops which provide our LA-31 Bière Noire a small bite of noble bitterness and a dry, French roasted coffee flavor.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Black Radish Dark Lager
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Weeping Radish Eco Farm & Brewery Black Radish Dark Lager

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Das Schwarze
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Dinkelacker-Schwabenbraeu AG Das Schwarze

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Monteith's Black
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Monteith's Brewing Co. Monteith's Black

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Miner Mishap
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Choc Beer Co. / Pete's Place Miner Mishap
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:28 IBU\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Saranac Black Lager
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Matt Brewing Company Saranac Black Lager

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Herold Bohemian Black Lager
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Pivovar Herold Březnice A.s. Herold Bohemian Black Lager

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Samuel Adams Boston LagerBoston Beer Company (Samuel Adams)
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Boston Beer Company (Samuel Adams) Samuel Adams Boston Lager
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Four Ingredients. Painstakingly Chosen. Every year, we travel to Bavaria to hand-select Hallertau Mittelfrüh hops, and the high American plains for the finest two-row summer barley. We cultivate our own lager yeast and I personally sample every batch. All our hard work goes into brewing this distinctly flavorful and complex beer for you. Cheers!\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Eliot Ness
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Great Lakes Brewing Company Great Lakes Eliot Ness
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:An amber lager with rich, fragrant malt flavors balanced by crisp noble hops.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Dos Equis Ambar
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Brewery: Cervecería Cuauhtémoc Moctezuma, S.A. de C.V.
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Cervecería Cuauhtémoc Moctezuma, S.A. de C.V. Dos Equis Amber Lager
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Dos Equis Ambar (Amber) is a vienna style lager that was originally brewed by the German-born Mexican brewer Wilhelm Hasse in 1897.The brand was named "Siglo XX" ("20th century") to commemorate the arrival of the new century, and the bottles were marked with the Roman numerals "XX", or "Dos Equis" (two X).\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Vienna Lager
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Devils Backbone Brewing Company Vienna Lager
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Vienna-Style Lager.This is our Ol’ Faithful. No, it’s not a geothermal phenomenon. It’s the beer everybody, including professional beer judges, just seems to dig. Maybe they like how it’s smooth, medium-bodied, and semi-sweet, while not too heavy or bitter. Maybe it’s the amber color, or the blend of four imported malts balanced by two Germanic hops, or the fact that it takes five weeks to get right. Or maybe it’s all the above.Malts: Vienna, Pilsner, Dark Munich, CaraAmberHops: Northern Brewer, SaazIBU: 18COLOR: Amber\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Vienna Style Lager
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Sierra Nevada Brewing Co. Sierra Nevada Vienna Style Lager
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Vienna-style beers are among the world’s first light-colored lagers and were on the brink of extinction until American craft brewers helped revive the style; it’s a good thing they did. These delicate and extremely balanced amber beers rely on semi-sweet and bready malt flavors but walk a fine line with both malt and hop character shouldering equal weight. Our take on the style features whole-cone European hops, which add to the dry finish.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Red Lager
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Jacob Leinenkugel Brewing Company Leinenkugel's Red

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Victoria
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Grupo Modelo S.A. de C.V. Victoria

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Schell's FireBrick
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: August Schell Brewing Company FireBrick
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:FireBrick was introduced in 1999, and is named after the bricks that line Schell's old boilers. It is the culmination of an effort to bridge the gap between the "popular-tasting" beers and the heartier, hand-crafted ones.FireBrick is a refreshing all-malt lager with an amber-red hue that reflects the feeling of the brewery itself.It has been described by Ted Marti as having a "subtle maltiness combined with a hint of hoppy taste that creates a mild, pleasantly drinkable beer." It is made with four specialty malts, along with Vanguard, Chinook and Hallertau hops.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Penn Pilsner
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Pennsylvania Brewing Company Penn Pilsner
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Our flagship brand! An amber Vienna-style lager beer that is smooth, mellow and full bodied, with delicate hop aroma. Uses two-row barley malt and caramel-roasted malt. Based on founder Tom Pastorius' favorite German bier.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Special Amber
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Sprecher Brewing Company Special Amber
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:A delicate balance of toasted malt and fresh hops give this medium-bodied German-style lager an intriguing, complex malt flavor. A creamy head, deep golden color and an impressive hop bouquet make this a very special beer.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Indio
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Brewery: Cervecería Cuauhtémoc Moctezuma, S.A. de C.V.
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Cervecería Cuauhtémoc Moctezuma, S.A. de C.V. Indio

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Schild Brau Amber
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Millstream Brewing Company Millstream Schild Brau Amber
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:The name Schild Brau means essentially 'Schild Beer' in German. This is our flagship brew, a microbrew done in the style of the special beers of Munich. This beer is brewed in the style of a Vienna Lager.Our beer uses these same malts to attain a perfect balance between malty sweetness and a firm bitterness.16 IBU\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Big Bark Amber Lager
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Live Oak Brewing Company Live Oak Big Bark Amber Lager

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Saranac Season's Best - Nut Brown Lager
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Matt Brewing Company Saranac Season's Best - Nut Brown Lager

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Dynamo Copper Lager
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Metropolitan Brewing Dynamo Copper Lager
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:If malt and hops are the two poles of brewing, this beer is the gently spinning sweet spot between them. First, you’ll notice the spicy aromas of Vanguard and Liberty hops. Then - wipe the foam off the tip of your nose - dive into the toasty flavor of Vienna malt. Dynamo starts strong and finishes crisp and smooth. The balanced flavors, aromas, and even the coppery-red tones of this beer go great with everything. Fear no pairing. The best time to enjoy Dynamo is when you’re thirsty.29 IBU\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Rusty Chain
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Flying Bison Brewing Company Rusty Chain
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:The #1 best selling local craft beer in Buffalo. Medium bodied Vienna-style amber beer with soft, nutty malt flavors and just enough German hops for balance. “Chain” goes great with chicken, pizza, grilled vegetables… pretty much everything now that we think about it.Available year round on draft, in bottles, and cans all across WNY.MALTS: Pilsner, Vienna, CaramelHOPS: Magnum, Tettnang20 IBU\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: The Raven Special Lager
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: B.W. Beer Works USA The Raven Special Lager
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:The Raven Special Lager is a perfect balanced lager beer that goes well with any kind of food, but particularly with spicy food or when you just want to sit down and enjoy a beer with friends. With a shot of Woodford Reserve chased with chilled Raven is a near perfect combination. The rich golden colored beer is an exceptionally smooth Southern German lager, somewhat malty but well balanced between the hops and malt. Experiencing the clean finish and pleasant lingering aftertaste of The Raven Special Lager, one can truly say that The Taste Is Poetic.18 IBU\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Jenny Lake Lager
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Snake River Brewing Company & Brewpub Snake River Lager
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Formerly Snake River LagerSnake River Lager is our most popular beer. This is an amber colored Vienna style lager. The rich, caramel flavor is balanced with the use of several hop varieties for a subtle hop note. An authentic German lager yeast strain adds to the true flavor of this beer. The malt forward profile of Snake River Lager makes it a fine complement to pizzas and red meat.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: 1906 Reserva Especial
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Hijos De Rivera, S.A. 1906 Reserva Especial
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Elegant, bright, amber beer. Aromas of roasted malt with soft notes of caramel and coffee. Water from the city of A Coruña, two-stroke malts (Pilsen and toast), corn, and hops Perle Hallertau. Selected yeast from Hijos of Rivera. Hops with slight floral and herbal nuances on the nose. Roasted taste predominates on the palate, with the hint of a pleasant, well-integrated warmth with each drink. Made from a specific wort in the exclusive production centre, Hijos de Rivera in A Coruña. It has one of the longest ageing periods among national lagers.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Pietra (Amber)
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Brasserie Pietra Amber
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Pietra, the chestnut beerBeer of the land and naturePIETRA is a specialty beer, of low fermentation.Using traditional methods it is brewed from selected malts and chestnut flour.The chestnuts used come from the most beautiful and highest chestnut grove in Europe, located in the Castagniccia, at an altitude of over 1,000 meters.Every autumn the fruit is hand-picked, transported down the hill on donkeys and sorted by hand. This guarantees flour of a very high quality, from a totally natural environment.Highly fermentable, chestnut flour has an excellent impact on the quality of the head and gives beer its beautiful coloring. Mixed into the malt during the mashing process, the chestnut flour is a prime ingredient and not just a flavoring.This recipe, unique in the world, gives PIETRA its conflicting taste accentuating a lingering subtle bitterness.Powerful and delicate, robust and smooth, Pietra has a 6% alcohol content. It displays a beautiful amber color, an intense chestnut head, dense and creamy, making the pleasure of tasting it all the more enjoyable.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Mac Queen's Nessie
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Brauerei Schloss Eggenberg Mac Queen's Nessie
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Note: New recipe from 2008, gravity went down from 16° to 12°, alcohol from 7.3% to 5%\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Wild Hop Organic Amber LagerGreen Valley Brewing Company (Crooked Creek)
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Green Valley Brewing Company (Crooked Creek) Wild Hop Organic Amber Lager

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Oktoberfest
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Hinterland Brewery Restaurant Oktoberfest
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Joe, our Brew Master, went to Munich for a few days of inspiration for this Vienna style beer. He came back 3 weeks later, a little cloudy but focused on nailing this now popular brew.MALT:\tVienna, 2 Row, Carafoam, Dark Wheat, MelanoidinHOPS:\tHallertau22 IBU\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Menabrea Ambrata
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Birra Menabrea SpA Menabrea Ambrata
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Also known as Menabrea 150° Anniversario Amber\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Ybor Gold Amber Lager
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Florida Beer Company Ybor Gold Amber Lager

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Bohemia Oscura
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Brewery: Cervecería Cuauhtémoc Moctezuma, S.A. de C.V.
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Cervecería Cuauhtémoc Moctezuma, S.A. de C.V. Bohemia Obscura
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Bohemia Oscura is a Vienna type beer. It offers the perfect balance of caramel and toasted malts that give off notes from walnut and coffee.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Saranac Winter Lager
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Matt Brewing Company Saranac Winter Lager

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Danish Red Lager
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Figueroa Mountain Brewing Co. Danish Red Lager
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Danish Style Red Lager (Dansk Red) is inspired by the red lagers of Denmark and the signature red color in the Danish flag. This quality beer is crafted with a blend of European base and sweet caramel malt, creating a beautiful red hue.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Shiner Bavarian Style Amber
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Spoetzl Brewery Shiner 98 Bavarian Style Amber
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Also known as Shiner 98 Bavarian Style Amber, Shiner Brew's Pride Selection Limited Edition Craft Brew, and Brewer's Pride Craft Brew No. 8.This Bavarian style Amber combines roasted Munich malts and rich German hops. 30 IBU\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Left Coast Una Mas Amber Lager
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Left Coast Brewing Company Left Coast Una Mas Amber Lager

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Vienna Red Lager
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Iron Hill Brewery & Restaurant Vienna Red Lager
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:A European amber lager, medium-bodied with a delicate malt aroma, slight sweetness and a clean, crisp finish.22 IBU\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Vienna-Style Amber Lager
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Tommyknocker Brewery Vienna-Style Amber Lager
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Brisk flavor, rich ruby color, and extra crisp finish create a sensation that will ripple the taste buds of the most discerning palate. This medium bodied lager is brewed with a blend of the finest hops and gently roasted malts.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Red Stallion
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Crescent City Brewhouse Red Stallion
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:A malty, aromatic and hoppy mixture. Copper colored, this beer is medium bodied and full of flavor. Vienna Style.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Fat Cat Lager
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: The Fat Cat Beer Company Fat Cat Lager Beer

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: P.J.W. Copper Lager
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Victory Brewing Company P.J.W. Copper Lager

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Tuborg Classic
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Tuborgs Bryggerier A/S Tuborg Classic

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Trailhead
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Wellington County Brewery Trailhead Lager
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Trailhead is a Vienna-style lager which is characterized by a careful balance of malt sweetness and clean, crisp hop bitterness.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Faro
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Brasserie Cantillon Cantillon Faro

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Chapeau Faro Lambic
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Brouwerij De Troch Chapeau Faro Lambic

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Girardin Faro 1882
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Brouwerij Girardin Girardin Faro 1882

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Faro Boon
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Brouwerij Boon Faro Boon

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Faro
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Brouwerij Timmermans-John Martin N.V. Timmermans Faro
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Formerly Tradition Faro Lambic.Timmermans Tradition Faro is a beer made by adding candy sugar and water to lambic to mellow its acidity. In the 19th century, Faro was very popular in the Brussels area. Various folk traditions were associated with it, and this ambrosial drink flowed abundantly, thanks to its relatively neutral but extremely pleasant flavour. Today, Timmermans Faro is still brewed using the methods and recipes of days gone by, and meets with unanimous approval.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Mort Subite Faro
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Brouwerij Mort Subite Mort Subite Faro

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: St. Louis Premium Faro
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Brouwerij Van Honsebrouck N.V. St. Louis Premium Faro

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Tilquin Faro
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Gueuzerie Tilquin Tilquin Faro

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: De Cam Faro
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: De Cam Geuzestekerij De Cam Faro

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Fou' Foune
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Brasserie Cantillon Cantillon Fou' Foune
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Apricot LambicBlend of lambics aged 18 to 20 months and of Bergeron apricots.Very fragrant gourmet beer which perfectly brings across the flavours of Bergeron apricots.Color: copperServing Temperature: 15°C/59 °F\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Framboise
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Brouwerij Lindemans Lindemans Framboise
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:2.5-4.0% ABVThe appearance of this exceptional beer is matched only by its taste! To make our Framboise, we add raspberry juice to our lambic. That gives it a delicate fruity aroma and a beautiful dark pink colour, just like the dress I wore to our cousin Willy's wedding. (But that's of no interest to you since you undoubtedly don't know Willy). Framboise is served as an aperitif, but I also use it in cooking. And when I don't finish the bottle in my preparations, I finish it in my glass.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Kriek 100% Lambic
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Brasserie Cantillon Cantillon Kriek 100% Lambic

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Rosé De Gambrinus
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Brasserie Cantillon Cantillon Rosé De Gambrinus
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:"It has the colour of onion skin", said a voice behind me. It was Raymond Coumans. He was admiring the colour of the raspberry lambic reflecting in the red copper of the buckets used to empty the barrels. At that time (1986), "Raspberry-Lambic" already was synonymous with a sweet, artificially flavoured beer. This is why we decided to distinguish our beer from the other raspberry beers. Raymond proposed to call it a rosé, dedicated not to Bacchus but to Gambrinus.The process to make this beer is identical to the one to make Kriek. When young, the Rosé de Gambrinus will still present its full fruity taste. Later on, the lambic taste will become dominant at the expense of the fruit taste.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Saint Lamvinus
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Brasserie Cantillon Cantillon Saint Lamvinus
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Everyone knows some of our best friends are wine growers from the Libourne region in France, more specifically those who make Saint Emillion and Pomerol. They respect the tradition and let their wine ferment in a natural way.Fermentation, origin and vintage are still kept up.Our collaboration resulted in a product uniting the best of their wine and of our beer : the Saint-Lamvinus.The grapes, of the merlot and cabernet-franc varieties, are soaked in Bordeaux barrels containing two to three years old lambic. The beer is not blended before the bottling. The foam is caused by the addition of a liquor which starts the fermentation.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Lou Pepe - Kriek
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Brasserie Cantillon Cantillon Lou Pepe - Kriek

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Vigneronne
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Brasserie Cantillon Cantillon Vigneronne
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:The name Vigneronne Cantillon was given in 1987. This name reminds us that, while it belongs to the beer patrimony, the spontaneous fermentation, the ageing in the barrels for several years and the addition of grapes make it a distant cousin of certain white wines.In spite of its success, the Vigneronne represents less than 5% of the total production of the Cantillon brewery. In order to obtain grapes which are as mature as possible, we buy them at the end of the season. Every year, 1000 kilos of white italian grapes are delivered at the Cantillon brewery in the beginning of October.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Lou Pepe - Framboise
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Brasserie Cantillon Cantillon Framboise
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Blend of raspberries with two-year-old lambic - 300 g per litre.Beer with very intense fruitiness. The natural tartness of the raspberries nicely complements the lambic’s slight acidity.This beer will keep for a long time in a good cellar but we recommend to drink it within the year to enjoy the intensity of the fruit.Color: rubyServing Temperature: 12 °C/54 °F\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Kriek
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Brouwerij Lindemans Lindemans Kriek
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Also known as Kriek FoudroyanteWe've already told you that our family never does anything the way other people do. Kriek Lindemans is a good example of that. In order to obtain a beer like no other, we have been adding whole sour cherries to our lambic for generations. Our meeting with American importer Charles Finkel in the 1970s revolutionized the fruit beer segment. Charles convinced us to export our old kriek to the United States by boat. What we had not thought of is that the movement of the waves would reactivate the fermentation process and cause the corks to pop during the trip. It was like something out of The Adventures of Tintin. To prevent that from happening, we therefore developed an alternative production method for our kriek. We use fresh, not from concentrate, unsweetened cherry filtrate which we blend with lambic that is at least one year old before fermenting & macerating for up to 3 days and pasteurizing the whole batch. So the corks don't pop. Due to the use of filtrate and pasteurization, this kriek is sweeter and fruitier than Old Kriek Cuvée René, which undergoes a second fermentation process in the bottle. Thanks to its innovative flavour, it was a resounding success both here in Belgium as well as around the world. Nowadays, it is undoubtedly the reference kriek for consumers.18 IBU\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Oude Kriek
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Brouwerij Drie Fonteinen Drie Fonteinen Oude Kriek
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:3 Fonteinen Oude Kriek is the result of macerating hand-picked whole sour cherries on young lambic for at least four months, in a proportion of one kilogram of fruit per litre of lambic. The kriek lambic is then blended again with more young lambic to obtain a minimum intensity of 35% fruit, and is bottled immediately afterwards. These bottles are then stored in our cellars for at least five months so that the kriek lambic can develop into a beautiful, traditional, and refined Oude Kriek. With a pleasant tartness and organic notes of almond and cinnamon as it warms in the glass, 3 Fonteinen Oude Kriek, will age perfectly but may lose some of the vibrant red colours and forest fruit aromas. This unfiltered and unpasteurised lambic is all-natural with no artificial juices, syrups, or sugars added. Traditional Lambic is living, cultural heritage rooted in the Zenne valley!\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Pêche
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Brouwerij Lindemans Lindemans Pêche
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Lindemans Pêche is a young lambic enriched with peach juice. And this fruit beer is a real peach! It is nice to drink at any time of day. Or on a sunny patio. Personally, I enjoy it with my girlfriends. And what we talk about is of no concern to you.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Hommage
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Brouwerij Drie Fonteinen Drie Fonteinen Hommage
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:A blend of lambic beers brewed at 3 Fonteinen, with an addition of 30% whole fresh raspberries from the fabled Payottenland and 5% sour cherries. This unfiltered beer will enjoy a spontaneous refermentation in the bottle. No artificial colors or flavor enhancers are added. Lambic is brewed only from 60% barley malt, 40% unmalted wheat, hops and water.In commemoration of the late Gaston Debelder, founder of the 3 Fonteinen blendingsBatch 1 - 2007Batch 2 - 2013Batch 3 - 2015Batch 4 - 2016 (ABV 4.5%)\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Schaarbeekse Kriek
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Brouwerij Drie Fonteinen Drie Fonteinen Schaerbeekse Kriek
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:3 Fonteinen Schaarbeekse Kriek is the result of macerating local hand-picked Schaarbeekse cherries on young traditional lambic for at least one year, in a proportion of one kilo of sour cherries per liter of lambic. The cherry lambic is then blended with young lambic and bottles, after which our famous Schaarbeekse Kriek matures for another year at least in the bottle. Refined and with evolution in the glass. Natural fruit, no juice, syrup or sugars added. Unfiltered and unpasteurised.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Mamouche
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Brasserie Cantillon Cantillon Mamouche
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Cantillon Zwanze 2009 = Elder flowers. In 2010, Cantillon re-released this beer as Mamouche (same beer), which will be brewed on a regular basis.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Blåbær Lambik
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Brasserie Cantillon Cantillon Blåbær Lambik
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Made in cooperation with Jeppe from Olbuttikken in Copenhagen. Jeppe provides the blueberries for the beer,and it is brewed at Cantillon and then shipped back to Copenhagen and only sold at Olbutikken.Since Ölbutikken closed, this is exclusive to Himmeriget in Copenhagen.2005 Vintage (batch 1) - 50 75cl bottles released. Gold foil.2007 Vintage (batch 2) - 37.5cl and 75cl bottles. Black foil.2007 Vintage (batch 3) - 75cl bottles. Gold foil.2009 Vintage (batch 4) - 37.5cl and 75cl bottles. No foil. Label reads "2009".2009 Vintage (batch 5) - 37.5cl and 75cl bottles. No foil. Label reads "2009 II".2010 Vintage (batch 6) - 37.5cl and 75cl bottles. Label reads "2010".2011 Vintage (batch 7) - 37.5cl and 75cl bottles. No foil. Label reads "11".2015 first year with the year printed on the label and not handwritten\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Pomme (Apple)
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Brouwerij Lindemans Lindemans Apple
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Making apple beer goes back to ancestral tradition. The Celts drank it in abundance during their harvest festivals. All we have done is extend the pleasure to the present day by adding the juice of several varieties of apples to our delicious lambic. The tasting experience, which is quite exceptional, combines the sweetness of cider with the sourness characteristic of lambic. The Americans are crazy about it, which is why they say, "An apple a day keeps the doctor away".12 IBU\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Oud Beersel Oude Kriek Vieille
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Brouwerij Oud Beersel Oud Beersel Oude Kriek Vieille

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Framboos
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Brouwerij Drie Fonteinen Drie Fonteinen Framboos
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Recent bottling dates:05/25/199905/31/201106/18/2014\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Oude Kriek
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Hanssens Artisanaal bvba Oude Kriek

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Coolship Red
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Allagash Brewing Company Allagash Coolship Red
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Spontaneous beer aged with raspberries.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Cassis
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Brouwerij Lindemans Lindemans Cassis
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Is it a sparkling wine or a beer? That is the question amateurs of exceptional products ask when they discover our Cassis for the first time. Cassis Lindemans is a fruity beer made from a lambic base which, thanks to its shades of dark purple and its aromas, is spontaneously reminiscent of wine. The taste of Cassis Lindemans on the palate is inimitable: intense and sparkling with a sour-sweet finish.5 IBU\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Boon Kriek
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Brouwerij Boon Boon Kriek
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Again, the basic old and young lambic are matured in oak casks. But here we add to one year-old lambic about 400 grams of real cherries per litre. This creates a second fermentation in the casks. Oude Kriek Boon then undergoes a further fermentation in the bottle and has an alcohol volume of 6.5%. After several months, the flavour has matured to the desired taste.Oude Kriek Boon is a test of your patience. It should lie about 2 years in the bottle. At first, it tastes of fruit, especially sour cherries. Oude Kriek Boon eventually evolves into a deep taste reminiscent of Port or Madeira wine. This is kriek at its best.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Boon Oude Kriek Mariage Parfait
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Brouwerij Boon Boon Oude Kriek Mariage Parfait

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Oudbeitje
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Hanssens Artisanaal bvba Oudbeitje Lambic

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Boon Framboise
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Brouwerij Boon Boon Framboise

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Peach
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Upland Brewing Company Peach Lambic
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Formerly Peach Lambic\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Blackberry
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Upland Brewing Company Blackberry Lambic
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Blackberry is fermented by wild yeast and aged in oak casks for nearly a year. We then add whole blackberries grown in Indiana. The beer is bottle conditioned. Style is Sour Ale, ABV 6%.

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Strawberry Lambic
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Upland Brewing Company Strawberry Lambic

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Persimmon Lambic
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Upland Brewing Company Persimmon Lambic

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Oud Beersel Framboise
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Brouwerij Oud Beersel Oud Beersel Framboise

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Spontanframboos
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Mikkeller ApS Spontanframboos

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Cherry
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Upland Brewing Company Cherry Lambic
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:A blended work of art. This barrel-aged sour ale combines a traditional Belgian-style sour with whole Montmorency Cherries from Michigan. We ferment our base blonde ale over many months in oak tanks to produce tart flavors, fruity notes and funky character. Then, we select individual batches for fruiting with whole cherries that add intense cherry aromas and dark fruit flavors to the beer. The final blend is bottle conditioned, resulting in a fine carbonation and spritzy mouthfeel.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Mort Subite Kriek
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Brouwerij Mort Subite Mort Subite Kriek

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: St. Louis Premium Framboise
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Brouwerij Van Honsebrouck N.V. St. Louis Premium Framboise

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Coolship Cerise
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Allagash Brewing Company Allagash Coolship Cerise
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Coolship Cerise is our spontaneous beer aged with a blend of Maine-grown cherries, including Balaton and Montmorency. Using local cherries makes our Cerise uniquely Maine, just like us.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Experimental Raspberry
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Hanssens Artisanaal bvba Hanssens Experimental Raspberry
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Ale fermented with raspberries and matured in oak barrels.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Experimental Cassis
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Hanssens Artisanaal bvba Hanssens Experimental Cassis
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Ale brewed with black currants and matured in oak barrels.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Strawberry Lambicus
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Brouwerij Timmermans-John Martin N.V. Timmermans Strawberry
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Formerly Strawberry.For anyone who finds strawberries irresistible, Timmermans Strawberry evokes the fragrance of long sunny days. Its strawberry flavour will have you wrinkling your nose in delight with each sip. Its luminous colour and its fruity freshness are a treat for taste-buds and eyes alike. A totally mouth-watering experience.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Framboise Lambicus
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Brouwerij Timmermans-John Martin N.V. Timmermans Framboise Lambic
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Formerly Framboise Lambic.Timmermans Framboise is made by adding 100% natural raspberry aromas to lambic. After maturation in oak barrels, the beer turns a delicate shade of pink that is sure to delight you. Timmermans Framboise is a beer to be savoured with finesse and elegance.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Scarenbecca Kriek
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Hanssens Artisanaal bvba Scarenbecca Kriek
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Lambic brewed with wild Belgian Schaerbeek sour cherries.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Belle Vue Kriek
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Brasserie Belle-Vue Belle Vue Kriek

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Chez Monieux
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Alpine Beer Company Chez Monieux

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Gueuze 100% Lambic
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Brasserie Cantillon Cantillon Gueuze 100% Lambic
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:This listing is for all vintages (Gueuze, Oude Gueuze, etc.).\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Oude Geuze
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Brouwerij Drie Fonteinen Drie Fonteinen Oude Geuze
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:This listing is for all vintages of the Oude Geuze, but not for bottles specifically labelled "Oude Geuze Vintage".\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Oude Gueuze Tilquin à L'Ancienne
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Gueuzerie Tilquin Oude Gueuze Tilquin à L’Ancienne
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Oude Gueuze Tilquin à l’Ancienne (6.0% alc/vol) is a spontaneous fermentation beer, produced from the blending of 1, 2 and 3 years old lambics. It is unfiltered and unpasteurized, and refermented in the bottle for at least 6 months. The lambics used were fermented and oak aged in our installations. These lambics are coming from worts brewed by Boon, Lindemans, Girardin and Cantillon breweries.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Duck Duck Gooze
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: The Lost Abbey Duck Duck Gooze
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:In Belgian brewing there are fantastic wild ales brewed with naturally occurring yeast. These beers develop over time and are ready on their own terms. Duck Duck Gooze is our homage to these effervescent and wonderfully complex sparkling beers.A blend of young and old barrel aged beers, this has been one of our most sought after beers year after year since it’s original release in 2009.Alas, it is released in very small quantities only once every three years, so it’s extremely difficult to come by beyond the day we release it. It does, however, turn up on our Tasting Room’s Vintage List from time to time, so don’t despair.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Oude Gueuze
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Hanssens Artisanaal bvba Oude Gueuze
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:This is the result of blending different lambics of different ages. The second fermentation takes place inside the bottles and therefore they are stored for minimum six months in constant temperature kept cellars.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Lou Pepe - Gueuze
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Brasserie Cantillon Cantillon Lou Pepe - Gueuze

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Girardin Gueuze 1882 (Black Label)
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Brouwerij Girardin Girardin Gueuze 1882 (Black Label)
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Unfiltered version.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Boon Oude Geuze Mariage Parfait
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Brouwerij Boon Boon Oude Geuze Mariage Parfait

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: St. Louis Gueuze Fond Tradition
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Brouwerij Van Honsebrouck N.V. St. Louis Gueuze Fond Tradition
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:St-Louis Gueuze Fond Tradition is a pure traditional gueuze aimed at connoisseurs. It has the pure taste of a true gueuze based on a blend of young and old lambics. Fruity apple aromas stand out. When tasting, the slightly sour touches, characteristic of lambic beers, make their presence felt. It is very dry in the finish.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Oud Beersel Oude Geuze Vieille
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Brouwerij Oud Beersel Oud Beersel Oude Geuze Vieille

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Coolship Resurgam
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Allagash Brewing Company Allagash Coolship Resurgam
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Coolship Resurgam is brewed with Pilsner malt, raw wheat, and aged hops. The beer is cooled overnight using outside air temperature in a traditional, large shallow pan known as a coolship. During the cooling process, naturally occurring microflora from the air inoculates the beer, and in the morning, it is transferred into French oak wine barrels where the entire fermentation and aging takes place. Coolship Resurgam is a blend of this one-, two-, and three-year old spontaneously fermented beer. The finished beer has aromas of apricot, lemon zest, and candied fruit. Notes of tropical fruit and flavors of funk lead to a clean, tart, and dry finish.Coolship Resurgam is a blend of both old and young unfruited spontaneous beer. The name comes from the motto of our fair city, Portland, Me. It means "I shall rise again". Coolship Resurgam won a Silver medal at the 2010 GABF.a blend of this one-, two-, and three-year old spontaneously fermented beer. The finished beer has aromas of apricot, lemon zest, and candied fruit. Notes of tropical fruit and flavors of funk lead to a clean, tart and dry finish.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Oude Geuze Boon
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Brouwerij Boon Boon Oude Geuze
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Brewed with 40% unmalted wheat, 60% of barleymalt, aged hops and wild yeasts collected from a coolship and is aged for up to 3 years in oak casks.

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Gueuze Tilquin (Draught Version)
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Gueuzerie Tilquin Gueuze Tilquin (Draught Version)
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:The Gueuze Tilquin - draught version (4.8% alc/vol) is a spontaneous fermented beer, produced by blending a low alcohol lambic (called Meerts) and 1 and 2 years old lambics, all fermented and aged in oak barrels. It is unfiltered and unpasteurized, and it is refermented in the keg. The lambics used were fermented and oak aged in our installations. These lambics are coming from worts brewed by Boon, Lindemans, Girardin and Cantillon breweries.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Doesjel
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Brouwerij Drie Fonteinen Drie Fonteinen Doesjel

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Sour Reserve
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Upland Brewing Company Sour Reserve
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:BLEND 1: Batch Years Blended 2006 (our original batch of lambics), 2008, 2010BLEND 2: Batch Years Blended All 2008Sour Reserve is a tart, dry, and refreshing blond sour ale, with multiple layers of flavor by selecting premium barrels of aged Basis. Expect flavors of peach, cherry, wine, cider with rich aromas of lactic sourness and multiple fruity notes. Effervescent carbonation creates an inviting and experiential sour beer session.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Gueuze
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Brouwerij Lindemans Lindemans Gueuze
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:From the brewery:There are several stories to explain the origin of the term 'gueuze'. This name dates back to the Rue de Gueuze in Brussels where, for the first time, a producer offered his delicious lambic in champagne bottles. Word about the 'lambick on Rue de Gueuze' quickly got around. According to other sources, gueuze has its roots in 'gazeux' - the French word for carbonated - since traditional gueuze is a carbonated blend of different lambics.After the Second World War, some lambic brewers devised a new production method. They filtered the beer, added sugar, saturated it (with carbon dioxide) and pasteurised it. This new gueuze, closed with a bottle cap and available in 25 cl bottles, was called capped gueuze. Developed according to this production method, Gueuze Lindemans is a slightly sweeter version of Old Gueuze Cuvée René.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Brouwerij Kerkom Reuss
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Reuss is produced for the Bink festival. Marc Limet blends the lambic with a less bitter version of Bink Blond (38 IBUs versus 52 IBUs.) Reuss was the name of the first beer brewed at Kerkom in 1878.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Chapeau Gueuze Lambic
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Brouwerij De Troch Chapeau Gueuze Lambic

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Iris
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Brasserie Cantillon Cantillon Iris
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:It is a completely original beer which, contrary to the other products of the Brewery, is not brewed with 35% of wheat. The Iris, which is only made with malt of the pale ale type (giving a more amber colour to the beer) conserves the typical flavour of the spontaneous fermentation, the complex aromas and the vinous taste.The hopping is different too. Lambic is made with 100% dried hops, for the Iris we use 50% of dried hops and 50% of fresh hops. The latter cause a superb acidity, the former, due to their tannins, enable to conserve the beer while preserving all its qualities. After two years in the barrel, the Iris undergoes a second fresh hopping two weeks before the bottling. A linen bag, filled with hops, is soaked in the beer for two weeks. This technique, called "cold hopping", gives the beer a more intense savour and makes the smell and the taste more bitter.Iris is brewed only once every season and all the beers come from the same brewing. This is why the beer is dated. The second fermentation is obtained by adding liquor. Although it is a spontaneous fermentation beer, the Iris is very different from the Lambic. The amber colour and the bitter and slightly caramelized taste make it a complex beer.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: O'Doul's
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Anheuser-Busch O'Doul's
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:O'Doul's and O'Doul's Amber are non-alcohol malt beverages.O’Doul’s has a mild, sweet taste with a slightly dry finish. O’Doul’s Amber has a rich, slightly sweet taste with flavorful hop finish. O’Doul’s and O’Doul’s Amber are brewed as traditional premium beers – fermented and aged to full maturity. The alcohol is then removed through the use of low temperature, low-pressure distillation. This extremely gentle process allows the alcohol to be removed without heating or cooking the beer, which retains the full, rich and delicate flavor and balance of our non-alcohol brews.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: O'Doul's Amber
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Anheuser-Busch O'Doul's Amber
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:O'Doul's and O'Doul's Amber are non-alcohol malt beverages.O’Doul’s has a mild, sweet taste with a slightly dry finish. O’Doul’s Amber has a rich, slightly sweet taste with flavorful hop finish. O’Doul’s and O’Doul’s Amber are brewed as traditional premium beers – fermented and aged to full maturity. The alcohol is then removed through the use of low temperature, low-pressure distillation. This extremely gentle process allows the alcohol to be removed without heating or cooking the beer, which retains the full, rich and delicate flavor and balance of our non-alcohol brews.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: BrewDog Nanny State
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:0.5% or 1.1% ABVNO ALCOHOL. NO COMPROMISE.If you think low alcohol equals low taste, think again. We made a hardcore beer and left the alcohol out. Nanny State breaks the curfew and slips under the radar. A brigade of speciality malts and North American hops sends bitterness to the brink and back. Squeezing this many hops in, and the alcohol out, is a testament to our craft.Nanny State - no compromise, no surrender, no alcohol.MALTS: Amber, Chocolate, Crystal, Dark Crystal, Munich, Rye, Wheat, CaramaltHOPS: Ahtanum, Amarillo, Cascade, Centennial, Columbus, Simcoe50 IBU\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Like its more famous cousins, Coopers Dark Ale is made with all malt, and naturally conditioned in the bottle or keg. Roasted and chocolate malts produce a deep amber brew, with a rich, full-bodied flavour. As with all of our ales, rolling the bottle before pouring makes it even better. No additives. No preservatives.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Neustadt Springs Brewery Neustadt 10w30
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:A traditional dark English Mild. The term mild meaning “not bitter” does not refer to strength. Using pure natural spring water, New Zealand hops and imported specialty malts. Giving rich malt and light nut aromas and mellow malt and good hop notes to the palate. A smooth and easy drinkable ale.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Whistler Brewing Company Original Black Tusk Ale
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:To date, we have won 2 World Awards for this dark, English-style mild ale. You can expect a mild bitterness with notes of chocolate and roasted coffee, and a very clean finish.Oh, and Black Tusk Ale is named for a famous local landmark – the jet black core of a now-extinct volcano. A must-see when you next come to Whistler.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:‘Dark Mild’ English style session beer with the ABV and color of an Irish Stout but a nuttier, softer mouthfeel from crystal and chocolate malts, and a finishing dryness from aroma hops. Brewed for drinkability to extract the maximum complexity and flavor from a relatively ‘light’ beer, warm fermented to accentuate dark fruit and roast malt notes. Conceived for cask and perfect served as a Real Ale. Hopped with Cluster and Perle.29 IBU\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: After Dark
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Nelson Brewing Company After Dark Mild
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Nelson After Dark is a dark, British-style Dark Mild Ale, lightly hopped and brewed with the finest imported dark roasted malted barley that gives the beer lovely chocolate overtones and smooth easy drinking character.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Original Sarah Hughes Dark Ruby MildBeacon Hotel (Sarah Hughes Brewery)
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Beacon Hotel (Sarah Hughes Brewery) Original Sarah Hughes Dark Ruby Mild

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Oliver's Dark Horse

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Nutty Black
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Daniel Thwaites Brewery PLC Nutty Black
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Formerly called "Dark Mild"\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: D'Artagnan Dark British Ale
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Brewery: Market Street Brewing Co. and Restaurant
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Market Street Brewing Co. and Restaurant Market Street D'Artagnan Dark British Ale
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Traditional British-style ale. Six malts: pale, crystal, victory, chocolate, black malt, and roasted barley.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Ruby Mild
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Rudgate Brewery Limited Ruby Mild

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: London Ruby Anglaise
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Brasseurs De Montréal London Ruby Anglaise

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Fat Belly Amber
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Montana Brewing Company Fat Belly Amber
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:A medium bodied ale with a complex malt profile. Flavors of bread, caramel, and hints of dark roasted malts.20 IBU\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Ossian
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Inveralmond Brewery Ltd., The Ossian
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Available throughout the year, this superb golden ale continues to win awards. A pale, golden coloured brew with a full bodied fruity flavour with distinct nutty tomes and a hoppy, zesty, orange aroma, derived from First Gold and Cascade hops. Excellent brewing resulted in Ossian being judged the Champion Beer of Scotland.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Dead Horse Amber Ale
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Moab Brewery Dead Horse Amber Ale
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Dead Horse Ale is named after the scenic overlook near Canyonlands. A traditional english mild ale with a well-balanced malt-to-hop ratio. The perfect beverage to compliment all foods\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Mild Ale
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Coopers Brewery Limited Coopers Mild Ale
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Like all of our ales, Coopers Mild Ale is naturally conditioned in the bottle or keg, without the use of any additives or preservatives. To give Mild Ale that distinctive cloudy appearance, make sure to roll the bottle before opening.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Minerva Pale Ale
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Cervecería Minerva Minerva Pale Ale

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Hop
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Greene King / Morland Brewery Hop
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Formerly marketed as "The Beer To Dine For".\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Golden Pippin Ale
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Copper Dragon Brewery Golden Pippin Ale

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Owl's Head Light Ale
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Sea Dog Brewing Company Sea Dog Owl's Head Light Ale
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Owls Head is a crisp, light ale with a light golden color and a good clean taste. Enjoy a hand crafted light beer brewed with only the freshest ingredients.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Blue Label Ale
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Simonds Farsons Cisk Plc. Blue Label Ale
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:A dark brown, top-fermented ale yeast, hopped and mixed with a special type of mild malt gives this richly coloured ale a unique, surprisingly smooth and mild taste. Contains distinctive chocolate and caramel notes. The draught version is a smooth and creamy version and is also available in cans, possible through an inbuilt widget technology that releases just the right amount of nitrogen to create the perfect surge and distinct smooth and creamy finish, which has previously only been available on draught in selected outlets across the island.

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Next Door AleRohrbach Brewing Company (Brewpub)
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Rohrbach Brewing Company (Brewpub) Next Door Ale

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Snowdonia Ale (Cwrw Eryri)
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Purple Moose Brewery Snowdonia Ale
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:A delightfully refreshing pale ale brewed with a delicate combination of aromatic hops.Our most popular session beer - the perfect thirst-quencher after a hard day's walking in the glorious mountains of Snowdonia!\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Summer Ale
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Granite Brewery & Restaurant Summer Ale
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:This ale is golden in colour, clear and crisp. This beer proves a low alcohol can have taste. generous addition of wheat malt gives it a refreshing character.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Thwaites Smooth
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Daniel Thwaites Brewery PLC Thwaites Smooth

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Thoroughbred Gold
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Daniel Thwaites Brewery PLC Thoroughbred Gold

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Colón Rubia
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Palos De Moguer - 82 Colón Rubia
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:This is an English style Golden Ale. It has a golden color from the combination of pale malts and Carmel malts. It contains hops which contribute greatly to providing its flavor and aroma. Developed with Munich malts. Developed with Saaz and Hallertauer hops.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Arran Sunset
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Brewery: Isle of Arran Brewery Company Ltd.
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Isle of Arran Brewery Company Ltd. Arran Sunset

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: England's Gold
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Badger Brewery, Hall and Woodhouse England's Gold

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Spring Mild
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: The Ship Inn Spring Mild

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Jacob Mac Mild
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Dostal Alley Brewpub Jacob Mac Mild

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Finchcocks Original
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Westerham Brewery Company Ltd Finchcocks Original

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Curmudgeon
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Founders Brewing Company Founders Kaiser Curmudgeon
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Think classic seafaring ports, local pubs and weathered old fishermen. This old ale is brewed with molasses and an insane focus on the malt bill. Then Oak-Aged. The result is a rich, malty delight that's deceptively smooth and drinkable.50 IBU\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Old Stock Ale
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: North Coast Brewing Co. Old Stock Ale
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Like a fine port, Old Stock Ale is intended to be laid down. With an original gravity of over 1.100 and a generous hopping rate, Old Stock Ale is well-designed to round out and mellow with age. It’s brewed with classic Maris Otter malt and Fuggles and East Kent Goldings hops, all imported from England.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Hibernation Ale
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Great Divide Brewing Company Hibernation Ale
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:HIBERNATION ALE has been our celebrated winter tradition since 1995. This robust, dry-hopped ale has a malty richness balanced with a complex hop profile and hearty, warming character.AWARDS:1997 Great American Beer Festival, Gold Medal, Strong Ale/ English-Style Old Ale1998 World Beer Cup, Silver Medal, Strong Ale/English-Style Old Ale2003 Great American Beer Festival, Silver Medal, Old Ale2006 Great American Beer Festival, Silver Medal, Aged Beer\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Adam
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Brewery: Hair of the Dog Brewing Company / Brewery and Tasting Room
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Hair of the Dog Brewing Company / Brewery and Tasting Room Adam
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:A re-creation of an historic beer style originally made in Dortmund, Germany. Adam was the first beer produced by Hair of the Dog. 10% alcohol by volume50 IBUs.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Fourth Dementia - Bourbon Barrel-Aged
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Kuhnhenn Brewing Company Kuhnhenn Bourbon Barrel Fourth Dementia
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:This is our 4th Dementia Olde Ale that has been bourbon barrel-aged. This ale has an intense sweet caramel malt flavor and aroma that develops into a toffee and toasted marshmallow-like character.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Old Jubilation
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Avery Brewing Company Old Jubilation

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Fuller's Vintage Ale
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Fuller Smith & Turner PLC Fuller's Vintage Ale
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:First released in 1997, Fuller's Vintage Ale is brewed in limited batches with each bottle being numbered. It can be enjoyed immediately, or Fuller's recommends laying the beer down to enjoy when it peaks in 3 to 4 years and consume at cellar temperature. And though it's released each year as a separate vintage, BA has been informed that the recipe is only slightly tweaked from year to year, while the ABV remains at 8.5%.As the new Head Brewer, this 2017 edition of Vintage Ale champions a new American hop variety Denali, used to give the beer a citrusy, pine-like flavour and a new British malt variety Laureate. Combined with trusty British hops Target and Goldings, our 21st Vintage Ale is a well-rounded and balanced beer wilh Fuller's yeast adding the orange, marmalade characters to it. Vinlage ale is an exceptional beer, only available from Fuller's as a limited release of individually packaged and numbered bottles and will improve for many years to come, like a fine wine or whisky. As the beer is bottle conditioned it will form a natural sediment, so pour carefully, sit back and enjoy the very finest of Fuller's ales.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Old Stock Cellar Reserve (Aged In Bourbon Barrels)
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: North Coast Brewing Co. Old Stock Cellar Reserve (Aged In Bourbon Barrels)
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Vintages: 2005, 2009, 2013\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Fourth Dementia (4D)
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Kuhnhenn Brewing Company Kuhnhenn Fourth Dementia (4D)
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Previously Fourth Dementia2009 11.8%2010 13.5%2011 13.5%\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Old Peculier
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: T & R Theakston Ltd. Theakston Old Peculier
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Old Peculier is possibly one of the country’s most well-known and loved ales. This unique, beautiful brew is often imitated but never matched and is sold literally all over the world. With countless awards to its credit, it is something of which every Briton can be very proud and is the epitome of the greatest of British brewing tradition.In the early years of the modern brewing era, about two hundred years ago, many brewers produced a dark, strong ‘stock’ beer in the winter months, to provide a base amount of fermented beer to add to beers brewed in the rather more volatile months of the summer.Old Peculier probably owes its origins to this. The name pays tribute to the unique ecclesiastical status of Masham as a ‘Court of the Peculier’ and is also reference to the strong characteristic of the beer! For many years it was affectionately referred to as Yorkshire’s ‘Lunatic’s Broth’.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Adam From The Wood
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Brewery: Hair of the Dog Brewing Company / Brewery and Tasting Room
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Hair of the Dog Brewing Company / Brewery and Tasting Room Adam From The Wood
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Our Adam aged in American Oak barrels. First released in 2000, and released again in November 2011 in 12oz bottles. This 12% beer has lots of the typical HOTD aromas: Caramel, brown sugar, tons of raisin and tobacco. Fig, date, and plum fruitiness in that order. This has a fairly strong earthy vinousness as well as oak vanilla.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Ola Dubh Special Reserve 12
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Harviestoun Brewery Ltd. Ola Dubh Special Reserve 12
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Ola Dubh (or "Black Oil") is so named because it is gloopy and viscous. This limited release has been matured in casks from Orkney's award-winning Highland Park distillery to add complementary whisky notes to what is already an amazing brew. It is chocolatey with a roasty, bittersweet aftertaste.Highland Park 12 Year Old Single Malt Scotch Whisky was awarded a Double Gold medal at San Francisco World Spirits Competition 2007; it lends balance, smoothness and subtle smoke.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Cherry Adam From The Wood
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Brewery: Hair of the Dog Brewing Company / Brewery and Tasting Room
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Hair of the Dog Brewing Company / Brewery and Tasting Room Cherry Adam From The Wood
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Cherry Adam from the Wood is aged with locally grown black cherries in Bourbon and Sherry casks for 15 months.First release - November 2008Second release - November 2009Third release - March 2011Fourth release - November 2012\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Winter Ale
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Alaskan Brewing Co. Alaskan Winter Ale
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:English Olde Ale. Traditionally malty with the warming sensation of alcohol, Olde Ales are brewed in the fall as winter warmers.Brewed in the style of an English Olde Ale, this ale balances the sweet heady aroma of spruce tips with the clean crisp finish of noble hops. Its malty richness is complemented by the warming sensation of alcohol.Alaskan Winter is made from glacier-fed water, Sitka spruce tips and a generous blend of the finest quality European and Pacific Northwest hop varieties and specialty malts. Our water originates in the 1,500-square-mile Juneau Ice Field and from the more than 90 inches of rainfall we receive each year. 22 IBU\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Christmas Ale
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Saint Arnold Brewing Company Saint Arnold Christmas Ale
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:A rich, copper colored, hearty ale perfect for the holiday season with a malty sweetness and spicy hop character. The generous use of five different malts is responsible for the full flavor and high alcohol level of this beer.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Ola Dubh Special Reserve 16
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Harviestoun Brewery Ltd. Ola Dubh Special Reserve 16

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Autumn Ale
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Breckenridge Brewery Autumn Ale
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Our fall seasonal combines the malty goodness of a German lager with the clean crispness of an American ale. Brewed with Munich malts and a delicate blend of Bavarian hops, it's a full-bodied treat with a nutty-sweet middle, a warming alcohol level and notes of toasted grains. A pre-winter winner.21 IBU\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Ola Dubh Special Reserve 18
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Harviestoun Brewery Ltd. Ola Dubh Special Reserve 18

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Olde Suffolk English (Strong Suffolk Vintage) Ale
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Greene King / Morland Brewery Olde Suffolk English (Strong Suffolk Vintage) Ale

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Ola Dubh Special Reserve 30
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Harviestoun Brewery Ltd. Ola Dubh Special Reserve 30
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Every bottle of this extremely limited Ola Dubh 30th Anniversary Ale has been individually numbered. Our ale has been aged for up to six months in first fill sherry butts, formerly used to mature Highland Park's award-winning 30 Year Old Single Malt Scotch Whisky. These hand selected butts add subtle whisky notes to what is already a complex ale with its chocolatey mouthfeel and distinctive bittersweet finish. The high ABV has been deliberately created to stand up to, and blend with, the intensity of flavor created by the infused wood.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Gale's Prize Old Ale
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: George Gale & Company Ltd Gale's Prize Old Ale

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Winter Warmer
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Lancaster Brewing Company Winter Warmer
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Our classic Olde Ale delivers a complex malt flavor and blend of British and American hops. True to its name, this beer finishes with a nice warming alcohol flavor.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Hibernation Ale - Barrel-Aged
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Great Divide Brewing Company Barrel Aged Hibernation Ale
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Over 12 months in whiskey barrels has completely transformed our prized winter seasonal, producing a Hibernation that starts with big whiskey flavors before mellowing out into luscious chocolate, dark fruit and vanilla. If you can only take one beer into your cave this winter, we suggest this one.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Triple Exultation
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Eel River Brewing Co. Triple Exultation

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Big Dick's Olde Ale
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Arcadia Brewing Company Arcadia Big Dick's Olde Ale

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Unobtanium Barrel-Aged Old Ale
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Straight To Ale Barrel-Aged Unobtanium Old Ale
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Unobtanium is a barrel-aged English-style Old Ale that ages for six months in a bourbon barrel, soaking up all sorts of amazing whiskey character as well as hints of oak and vanilla. The name was taken from an old aerospace/engineering term for a specific material or object (often imaginary, impossible or highly improbable to obtain) needed to complete any given project.And, before you ask, we did not take the name from the elusive metal in Avatar. James Cameron reportedly named the substance as an inside joke to his fellow techie/gear-heads. Our version is much tastier, though.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Thanksgiving Ale
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Mayflower Brewing Company Mayflower Thanksgiving Ale
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:The first and only perennial offering in our Cooper’s Series of limited batch beers. Mayflower Thanksgiving Ale is an inspired blend of two brewing styles: American Strong Ale and English Old Ale. Aged on American white oak, this full-bodied brew warms the soul with hints of caramel, vanilla and spicy nuts. The perfect beverage for our favorite holiday.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Figgy Pudding
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Block 15 Brewery & Restaurant Figgy Pudding
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:"Inspired by a 16th century English Christmas cake our Figgy Pudding is brewed with English Pale & Specialty malts & molasses and fermented with London ale yeast. After fermentation we matured Figgy Pudding in brandy barrels before conditioning with mission figs, Ceylon cinnamon and nutmeg."64 cases of 750ml bottles produced in November 2010.Re-released in November 2011.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Ola Dubh Special Reserve 40
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Harviestoun Brewery Ltd. Ola Dubh Special Reserve 40

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Old Woody
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Fish Brewing Company / Fishbowl Brewpub Old Woody

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Billy The Mountain
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Upright Brewing Company Billy The Mountain
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Inspired by the great Prize Old Ale once brewed by Gales in England, this beer is deeply malty and full of ripe fruit, leather, wine and oak flavors. The Billy is partially barrel aged with brettanomyces yeast, lending a distinct twang and developing unique aromas over time. Bottled still and best served at about 55F to be finished at room temperature. Cellar for up to five years."Billy the Mountain - A traditional English-style Old Ale, having undergone over five months of oak barrel aging and another several months in the bottle."Malts: organic pale, ashburne mild, caramelUnmalted: black barleyAlso: molassesYeasts: London ESB and brettanomyces clausennii First Release - January 2010Second Release - January 2011Third Release - December 2011\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Lights Out Holiday Ale
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Blue Mountain Brewery Lights Out Holiday Ale

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Old Flame
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: DuClaw Brewing Company Old Flame

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Dark & Handsome
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Box Steam Brewery Dark & Handsome

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Pale Ale
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Sierra Nevada Brewing Co. Chico Special Pale Ale
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Our most popular beer, Sierra Nevada Pale Ale is a delightful interpretation of a classic style. It has a deep amber color and an exceptionally full-bodied, complex character. Generous quantities of premium Cascade hops give the Pale Ale its fragrant bouquet and spicy flavor.38 IBU\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Zombie Dust
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Three Floyds Brewing Co. & Brewpub Zombie Dust
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:This intensely hopped and gushing undead Pale Ale will be one’s only respite after the zombie apocalypse. Created with our marvelous friends in the comic industry.60 IBUFormerly known as Cenotaph: A medium bodied single hop beer showcasing Citra hops from the Yakima Valley, USA.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Dale's Pale Ale
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Oskar Blues Grill & Brew Dale's Pale Ale

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Alpha King
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Three Floyds Brewing Co. & Brewpub Alpha King Pale Ale
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: error entering this description

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Pseudo Sue
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Toppling Goliath Brewing Company PseudoSue
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:This single hop ale showcases the Citra hop. Named for the largest T-rex fossil ever discovered, she roars with ferocious aromas of grapefruit, citrus, mango and evergreen. Delicate in body with a mild bite in the finish.50 IBU\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Daisy Cutter Pale Ale
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Half Acre Beer Company Daisy Cutter Pale Ale
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Daisy Cutter Pale Ale is one of the first beers we brewed at our brewery on Lincoln Ave. It began as a special release bomber beer, but caught fire both in and outside the brewery.At the time, 2009, there were some local pale ales that hit with natural power, but not many. Daisy Cutter’s lush and dank characteristics steadily carved out a place within the Chicago brewing landscape.Today, Daisy Cutter is a call brand that we continue to keep raw and relevant.Blended pine, citrus, papaya and mango. Dank. Apparent biscuit, lingering, obscenely dry.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: 420 Extra Pale Ale
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: SweetWater Brewing Company Sweetwater 420 Extra Pale Ale

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Mirror Pond Pale Ale
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Deschutes Brewery Mirror Pond Pale Ale
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Alc. by Vol.: 5.0%IBUs: 40170 calories per 12 oz serving\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Peeper
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Maine Beer Company Peeper Ale
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Our original hoppy American ale. Dry, clean, well-balanced with generous dose of American hops.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Edward
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Hill Farmstead Brewery Edward Pale Ale
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Edward (1917-2002) is our grandfather; Hill Farmstead Brewery rests upon the land that was once home to him and his five children. In his honor, this American Pale Ale is dutifully crafted from American malted barley, a plethora of American hops, our ale yeast and water from Edward’s well. It is unfiltered, naturally carbonated, and dry hopped. Aromatic and flowery, with impressions of citrus and pine, this is the ale that I dream to have shared with Edward. 85 IBUPale and Caramel malt; Centennial, Chinook, Columbus, Simcoe, and Warrior hops; House Ale Yeast, and our Well Water.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Moon Man No Coast Pale Ale
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: New Glarus Brewing Company Moon Man
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:You hold a session beer with a bright bold blend of five hops that flirt obligingly with the smooth malty backside. Don't let this one lay around it is brewed to be enjoyed today. Bold and engaging without pretense, because in Wisconsin you do not have to be extreme to be real.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Red Chair NWPA
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Deschutes Brewery Red Chair NWPA
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Available: January to MayAlc. by Vol.: 6.2%IBUs: 60192 calories per 12 oz serving\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Headwaters Pale Ale
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Victory Brewing Company Headwaters Pale Ale
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Crisp and aromatic, this boldly-hopped American ale balances notes of citrus and tea-like earthiness from American hops with a subtle German malt base.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Fire Rock Pale Ale
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Kona Brewing Co. Fire Rock Pale Ale
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Fire Rock Pale Ale is crisp, refreshing “Hawaiian-style” pale ale. Its signature copper color results from the unique blend of specialty roasted malts. The pronounced citrus-floral hop aroma comes from the liberal amounts of Galena, Cascade & Mt.Hood hops added to each brew.35 IBU\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Doggie Style
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Flying Dog Brewery Doggie Style Classic Pale Ale
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Trends may come and go, but classics transcend time and space. And Doggie Style is certainly a classic. The standard in pale ales, this beautiful amber liquid perfectly balances Northern Brewer, Cascade, Simcoe, and Citra hops, then melds them together with Carastan malts to create an incredibly satisfying beer-flavored beer that tastes like beer. Next time you’re in the mood to get down and dirty with some sauce-heavy Chinese or BBQ, crack one open and make it a Doggie Style kind of night.Malts: CaramelHops: Northern Brewer, Cascade, Citra, SimcoeYeast: American AleIBU: 35\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Pride & Joy Mild Ale
