Five different malts, select hop varieties, and our own specially cultivated yeast create an ale which leads with hop flavors and a subtle impression of fruit (our yeast's contribution), followed by a palate pleasing malty finish. Our own special process uses the yeast to naturally carbonate the beer, and we leave it unfiltered. The result is a satisfying brew full of flavor with a remarkably clean and smooth finish.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Fixed Gear
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Lakefront Brewery, Inc. Fixed Gear
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:The energy and audacity of the fixed gear courier inspired us to create Fixed Gear, a big, bold American Red IPA. It pours a glaring crimson tone with a rocky white head and a brilliant floral-citrus aroma, thanks to an aggressive Centennial, Cascade, and Chinook dry hopping. Gratuitous amounts of dark caramel malts lend Fixed Gear its immodest, malty spine, while Chinook and Cascade hops impart its balanced citrus bite. This one’s got an attitude!The hop flavor in Fixed Gear mingles well with Indian spices like tamarind, coriander, and cardamom; try it with tandoori chicken or pork vindaloo with rice on the side. Also goes great with grilled burgers, steaks, or baby back ribs.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: 5AM Saint
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: BrewDog 5 A.M. Saint
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Formerly 5 A.M. Saint + Five AMStart the car. The lights are about to turn amber. Buy the ticket, take the ride. Past the alley where thieves and pimps sell corporate brews and good men soak it up like vermin, blissful in their ignorance. Past the jackhammers who want their three and a half percent. Keep going. Towards that golden orb, the size of Zeus’s ass, that hovers over this crazy town. Sleep late, have fun, get wild, drink amber, and drive like a bastard towards that saintly light.25 IBU\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Captain Sig's Northwestern Ale
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Rogue Ales Captain Sig's Northwestern Ale
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Label of 22oz bottle:10 Ingredients: Pale 2-row, Munich, Carastan, & Chocolate Malts; Horizon, Amarillo, Cascade & Rogue Farm Willamette Hops; Pacman Yeast & Free Range Coastal Water.No Chemicals, No Preservatives, No Additives.Dedicated to the Hansen brothers - Sig, Edgar, and Norman - the Rogues of the Bering Sea.Portions of proceeds of Northwestern Ale will support the Fisherman's Fund.14.5º PLATO80 IBU75 AA36º L\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: My Bloody Valentine
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: AleSmith Brewing Company AleSmith My Bloody Valentine
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Don’t spend this Single Awareness Day alone – grab a beer! This red-blooded cousin of Evil Dead Red Ale, our Halloween Brew, is a beautiful crimson color. Notes of caramel, toast, and bittersweet chocolate balance an intense bouquet of floral hop aromas that we know you’ll fall in love with. The finish leaves a pleasant, full-bodied sweetness on the palate that won’t spread angry rumors about you to all your friends like that one time when I was…ohh…uhh…Happy Valentine’s Day!\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Ambergeddon
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Ale Asylum Ambergeddon
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:With a fury of hop flavor and a strong malt backbone, this West-Coast style amber is part ale, part sensory eruption, and All-American. Ambergeddon is brewed with passion and is best enjoyed that way.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Evil Dead Red
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: AleSmith Brewing Company AleSmith Evil Dead Red
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Each Halloween we release this special concoction to celebrate one of our favorite holidays. Deep blood-red in color, an intense aroma of pine and citrus from an abundance of American hops balances the sweetness and rich, bready flavors of this beer's caramel malts. The result is a fiendishly smooth brew that will make your taste buds scream with delight.This beer pairs excellently with toffee, caramel apples, or your favorite horror flick.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Mermaid's Red Ale
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Coronado Brewing Company Mermaid's Red Ale
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Also known as Red Roost Al" at the Clam Catcher restaurant in La Jolla, CA.Mermaid’s Red The Siren's Calling.Inspired by the siren song, Mermaid’s Red lures you in with sweet toffee malts and seductive red hue. But don’t be fooled, this hoppy red is dry-hopped with a blend of Pacific Northwest hops for big citrus and pine aroma and a lingering dry finish.IBU: 46Food Pairings: BBQ Chicken Pizza\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Loakal Red
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: The Bruery Loakal Red

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Amber Ale
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: The Duck-Rabbit Craft Brewery Duck-Rabbit Amber Ale
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:The Duck-Rabbit Amber Ale is a medium bodied beer with a lovely tawny copper / bronze color. The lightest of all our dark ales, this is a great introduction to full flavored beers. This brew emphasizes malt complexity with layered caramel malt flavors. We put a lot of effort into getting The Duck-Rabbit Amber Ale just right and we're extremely proud of the result. Enjoy!\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Believer
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Ninkasi Brewing Company Believer
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:An Imperial American Red Ale.Ninkasi website:"6.9 % alc./vol. 60ibus. Always available in 22 oz bottles, and on draft."\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Amber Ale
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Saint Arnold Brewing Company Saint Arnold Amber Ale
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Saint Arnold Amber Ale is the brewery's flagship product and first official brew. A well balanced, full flavored, amber ale, it has a rich, malty body with a pleasant caramel character derived from a specialty Caravienne malt. A complex hop aroma, with a hint of floral and citrus comes from a combination of Cascades and Liberty hops. It has a rich, creamy head with a fine lace. The light fruitiness, characteristic of ales, is derived from a proprietary yeast strain.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Jamaica Red Ale
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Mad River Brewing Company Jamaica Red Ale
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Our legendary red ale. This mahogany hued ale brings an intense spectrum of spicy aromatic hop character balanced by a full-bodied caramel richness. 2011 Silver Medal winner at the Great American Beer Festival in the American Style Amber/Red Ale category.IBU: 45.3Malts: 2-Row Pale, Crystal 70/80, Wheat, Black PatentHops: Columbus, Chinook, Cascade, Willamette, Summit\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Mourning Wood
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Local Option Morning Wood
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Formerly Morning WoodMourning Wood is an oak-aged coffee amber ale. Fresh American oak used during the aging process and Dark Matter’s El Salvador San Jose pulp-natural coffee aromatically drive the beer yet they remain subtle components of the beers’ overall flavor profile. This amber colored, medium-bodied, and extraordinarily well-balanced ale has a delicate taste that is appreciated by beer drinkers of all palates.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Samuel Adams Mighty Oak AleBoston Beer Company (Samuel Adams)
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Boston Beer Company (Samuel Adams) Samuel Adams Mighty Oak Ale

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Snowshoe Red Ale
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: New Glarus Brewing Company Snowshoe Red Ale
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Settle in with Wisconsin's Snowshoe Ale. This beer is brewed with a blend of American and German malts. We also infuse generous amounts of hops from Slovenia and the Great Pacific Northwest to add a special note of warmth for your winter evening's enjoyment. Expect this beer to be a beautiful copper-red, with a fruity ale body and a spiced hop finish. Then sit back and rejoice in the season because it's these Wisconsin winters that keep the whiners out.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Big Red Coq
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Brewery Vivant Big Red Coq

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Nugget Nectar
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Tröegs Brewing Company Tröegs Nugget Nectar
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Squeeze those hops for all they're worth! Nugget Nectar will take hopheads to nirvana with a heady collection of American hops. Our Imperial Amber Ale is further intensified with whole flower Nugget hops added to our hopback vessel, resulting in an explosion of citrus, resin and pine.93 IBU\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: G'Knight
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Oskar Blues Grill & Brew G'Knight Imperial Red Ale
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Classified by the brewery as an "Imperial Red/Double IPA" 8.7% ABV, 60 IBUs\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Hop Head Red Ale
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Green Flash Brewing Co. Green Flash Hop Head Red Ale
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:In 2011 the recipe was altered to bump the IBU’s from 55 to 70; ABV also increased from 6.4% to 7.0%. In 2014 the ABV increased to 8.1%.A luscious beauty, Hop Head Red® exudes resinous hoppy qualities from Amarillo, Warrior and Nugget to overtake the full-bodied depths of a caramel malt base. Captivating and seductive floral aromas and alluring hop flavors are the result of dry hopping with mountains of Amarillo. The blissful union of Double India Pale and Red Ale make Hop Head Red an unforgettable obsession. Experience love at first sip. Every time.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Lucky 13 Mondo Large Red Ale
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Lagunitas Brewing Company Lagunitas Lucky 13 Mondo Large Red Ale
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Our 13th Anniversary Beer in was a Staff Favorite, So We Make it Each Year. BIG on the Amarillo Hops and Rich Dark Malts for a Round and Huge, Smoky Flavor.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Nosferatu
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Great Lakes Brewing Company Great Lakes Nosferatu
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Don’t be afraid of things that go hop in the night! Rich roasted malt flavors haunt the shadows of our Imperial Red Ale’s bitter teeth.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Tongue Buckler - Imperial Red Ale
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Ballast Point Brewing Company Tongue Buckler - Imperial Red Ale

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Pursuit Of Hoppiness
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Grand Teton Brewing Co. Pursuit Of Hoppiness
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Pursuit of Hoppiness Imperial Red Ale is brewed to showcase the brash beauty of American hops: Chinook, Centennial and Columbus at 100 International Bitterness Units (IBU). The hops grown in the United States are considered to be some of the best in the world. Compared to their more traditionally subdued, elegant European counterparts, American hops are bold, bright, piney and zesty. This ale is brewed with Idaho 2-Row malted barley and German specialty malts to provide a rich, slightly caramel flavor and bold reddish color. At 22 degrees Plato starting gravity and about 8.5% alcohol by volume, this thick and warming beer is to be shared and savored.100 IBU\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Aorta Ale (Double Red Ale)
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Short's Brewing Company Aorta Ale (Double Red Ale)
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:A double red ale that seems to indicate an intensity of flavor simply by it’s dark reddish brown appearance. Subtle aromas of candy, brown sugar, and toasted malt seem reluctantly released from the depths of this full bodied beast. Raisins, figs, and burnt caramel are among some of the sweeter flavors up front, before giving way to a roasted cocoa like bitterness that becomes magnified by high alpha hops. Considering the initial overall sweetness, it’s a heightened bitterness that dominates the finish.82 IBU\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Double Dread Imperial Red Ale
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Mad River Brewing Company Double Dread Imperial Red Ale

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: King Crimson
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Peak Organic Brewing Company King Crimson
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:King Crimson is an Imperial Red Ale that delivers a royal bounty of luscious, fruity American hops on top of a sturdy, deep red malt backbone. This beer is lavishly dry-hopped with Simcoe, adding a citrusy and piney flavor and aroma to the toasty, sweet malt notes. This special treat is a very limited Winter release, so enjoy it while you can!90 IBU\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Ard Ri
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Upland Brewing Company Ard Ri

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Elector Imperial Red Ale
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Brewery: New Albanian Brewing Company - Pizzeria and Public House
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: New Albanian Brewing Company - Pizzeria and Public House Elector Imperial Red Ale

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Extra Special Red
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Odell Brewing Company Odell Extra Special Red Ale
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Extra Special Red is our imperial red ale, a crimson-hued brew full of juicy hop flavors and aromas of pine and stone fruit. After 6 months of aging in rye whiskey casks, it was roused from its oak cradle to the bottle in your hands. The barrels impart notes of sweet vanilla and soft tannins, while the hops settle into the background in favor of the strong malt foundation. Slainte!\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Double Rainbow
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Iron Horse Brewery Double Rainbow Ale

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Imperial Red Ale
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Marble Brewery Imperial Red Ale
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Brewed with royalty in mind, no expense was spared in crafting our Imperial Red. Generous additions of our favorite hop varieties blend harmoniously with long layers of dark caramel malts.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Bone Warmer Imperial Amber Ale
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Grand Teton Brewing Co. Bone Warmer Amber Ale
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Our Bone Warmer is brewed the same way, using only the first runnings from an extraordinarily thick, strong mash of Idaho 2-Row Metcalfe and Harrington barley malt, along with dark German Munich and caramel malts. We subtly spiced it with Idaho Chinook hops, fermented it at cool temperatures and cold-conditioned it for smoothness and drinkability.The resulting ale is the color of roasting chestnuts. It is voluptuously malty and only slightly sweet- with a hint of toffee and a warming dry finish. It’s an ideal accompaniment to rich meaty stews, wild game, roasted fowl or root vegetables, and aged cheddars.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Lavery Imperial Red Ale
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Lavery Brewing Company Lavery Imperial Red Ale
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:BIG. HOPPY. RED. Irish beer gone incognito! Our IRA has a beautiful burnt orange/red color with the unmistakable aroma and flavor of American hops. This beer is brewed to be dry with full flavor of Nugget, Apollo & Cascade dry hopping. With over two pounds of hops per barrel (that's a lot) its like no beer ever brewed in Erie.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Uncle Rusty
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Columbus Brewing Company Columbus Uncle Rusty
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Part of the hop odyssey.Gold medal in Category 90: Imperial Red Ale at the 2014 World Beer Cup.This bold Imperial Red Ale is brewed with a blend of our favorite English crystal malts, providing a sturdy balance to the firm bitterness and citrusy, floral hop aroma. Brewed with Simcoe, Centennial, and Amarillo hops.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Battle Axe
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Austin Beerworks Battle Axe
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:80 IBU\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Smithwick's Imported Premium Irish Ale
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Guinness Ltd. Smithwick's
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Smithwick's is a clear beer with a rich ruby color and creamy head. Clean and delicate aroma with different individual notes: from the top fermentation by the Smithwick yeast come aromatic esters creating a fruity aroma. The Aroma Hops added late in the boil contribute clean fresh floral notes. Ale Malt contributes aroma hints of biscuit and caramel. Refreshing and clean taste with a gentle balance of bitterness from the hops added early in the boil, sweet/malty notes from the ale malt, and hints of roast/coffee from the roasted barley.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Samuel Adams Irish RedBoston Beer Company (Samuel Adams)
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Boston Beer Company (Samuel Adams) Samuel Adams Irish Red
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Pale and Caramel malts, and East Kent Goldings hops.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Conway's Irish Ale
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Great Lakes Brewing Company Great Lakes Conway's Irish Ale
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:A pint for Pa Conway! Our co-owners' grandfather who'd likely uphold that an Irish Ale with full-bodied caramel malt flavors is just the ticket.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Smithwick's Ale
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Brewery: Smithwick's Brewery / Irish Ale Breweries Ltd
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Smithwick's Brewery / Irish Ale Breweries Ltd Smithwick's Ale

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Kilkenny Irish Cream Ale
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Guinness Ltd. Kilkenny Irish Cream Ale
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:An "Irish Cream Ale", though this style does not exist on BeerAdvocate.com, and the closest style is Irish Red Ale.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Murphy's Irish Red
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Murphy Brewery Ireland Limited Murphy's Irish Red Beer

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Irish Ale
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Boulevard Brewing Co. Irish Ale
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Irish Ale, Boulevard’s early spring seasonal beer, is our Midwestern tribute to the legendary red ales of old Ireland. Our recipe combines six kinds of pale and roasted barley malts to provide a rich, toasty flavor and tawny reddish hue.30 IBU\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Red Trolley Ale
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Karl Strauss Brewing Company Red Trolley Ale

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: O'Hara's Irish Red
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Carlow Brewing Company O'Hara's Irish Red

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Samuel Adams Brick RedBoston Beer Company (Samuel Adams)
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Boston Beer Company (Samuel Adams) Samuel Adams Brick Red
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:A traditional European style ale handcrafted by the Samuel Adams brewers. Only available on-tap in select locations in and around Boston. See http://www.samueladams.com for a list of participating locations.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: The Magician
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Short's Brewing Company Short's The Magician
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:The Magician is a lustrous, dark-red, London style Red Ale with a rich grain bill. The grain combination lends complex notes of toasted caramel, raisins, chocolate, and roasted toffee. Very light hop additions let the true malt characters show throughout this beer.20 IBU\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Saranac Irish Red Ale
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Matt Brewing Company Saranac Irish Red Ale

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: McSorley's Irish Pale Ale
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Pabst Brewing Company McSorley's Irish Pale Ale

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: McIlhenney's Irish Red
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Alpine Beer Company McIlhenney's Irish Red
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Our most versatile beer. Good to drink as well as cook with. Light enough to quench a thirst and complex enough to accompany fine dining. Caramel malty sweet fades to a chocolate roasty finish and dry from a touch of rye. 1.057 OG 13 IBU\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: River Falls Red Ale
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Thomas Creek Brewery River Falls Red Ale
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:21 IBU\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Irish Red Ale
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Thomas Hooker Brewing Company Thomas Hooker Irish Style Red Ale
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:A rich, malty brew that uses red wheat and a variety of crystal malts, giving this beer its ruby red hue. Traditional English hops give this easy drinking brew a flavor that's perfect year round.21 IBU\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Casco Bay Riptide Red Ale
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Casco Bay Brewing Co. Casco Bay RipTide Red Ale
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Our flagship, this Irish-Style Red Ale proudly won a gold medal at the 2000 World Beer Cup. A combination of 5 different malts and 3 hop varietals, carefully blended, results in a perfect balance. Full-flavored and medium-bodied, the Riptide Red provides surprising complexity for such an easy-drinking brew.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Jeremiah Red Ale
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: BJ's Chicago Pizza & Brewery Inc. BJ's Jeremiah Red Ale
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:A Silver Medal winner in Strong Ales at the 1996 Great American Beer Festival. This Irish-style strong ale is brewed with a secret blend of five imported specialty malts. Not too hoppy in order to emphasize the complex malt flavor and fruity aroma.25 IBU\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Danny's Irish Style Red Ale
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Moylan's Brewery Danny's Irish Style Red Ale

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Hot Rod Red
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Aviator Brewing Company HotRod Red

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Amber Ale
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Starr Hill Brewery Starr Hill Amber Ale
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Brewed in the tradition of the great English ales, its rich honey color hints at its smooth, caramel flavoring. With a medium body and slightly sweet finish, this is an extremely drinkable brew that is characterized by rich malt taste and low bitterness. Medaled at the 2001 and 2005 Great American Beer Festivals and award winner at the 2002 World Beer Cup.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Porterhouse Red
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: The Porterhouse Brewing Company Porterhouse Red

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Station 33 Firehouse Red
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: North Country Brewing Station 33 Firehouse Red

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Aviator Red
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Flying Bison Brewing Company Aviator Red

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Caffrey's Irish Ale
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Thomas Caffrey Brewing Co. Caffrey's Irish Ale

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Scarlet Fire
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Tighthead Brewing Company Scarlet Fire
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Scarlet Fire is an Irish/American style Red Ale. The name is a reference to the playful, improvisational transitions between Grateful Dead songs Scarlet Begonias and Fire on the Mountain. Great balance of malt sweetness from caramel malt and subtle toasty notes from roasted barley. Brewed withj American Ale yeast, and East Kent Golding hops, it pays tribute to it's heritage as an Irish Red Ale.2018 GABF Gold Medal Winner30.2 IBU\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Cherokee Red Ale
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Smoky Mountain Brewery & Restaurant Cherokee Red Ale

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Irish Setter Red
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Thirsty Dog Brewing Company Irish Setter Red

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Jeremiah Red Ale
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: BJ's Restaurant & Brewhouse Jeremiah Red Ale
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:A Silver Medal winner in Strong Ales at the 1996 Great American Beer Festival. This Irish-style strong ale is brewed with a secret blend of five imported specialty malts. Not too hoppy in order to emphasize the complex malt flavor and fruity aroma.25 IBU\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Erik The Red
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Dragonmead Microbrewery Dragonmead Erik The Red
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:An Irish style red (amber) beer. Light in finish but bold in taste. Melanoidin malt is added for the red color and the spicy finish comes through from the Chinook hops.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Celtic Ale
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Long Ireland Beer Company Celtic Ale

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Fire Chief Ale
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Rock Bottom Restaurant & Brewery Fire Chief Ale
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:"Our fresh-brewed Fire Chief Ale* is a medium-bodied,auburn-colored Ale that gets its pleasant sweetness and lightly toasted character from select caramel and crystal malts. Hand-selected hops from the Pacific Northwest lend a crisp and satisfying citrus finish."\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Quinn's Amber Ale
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Wachusett Brewing Company Quinn's Amber Ale
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:An easy drinking Amber Ale with low bitterness, a subtle malt profile and a balanced finish.Availability: Jan-Mar\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Red Head Red Ale
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Dunedin Brewery Red Head Red Ale
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Celtic Red Ale\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Rebel Red
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Franciscan Well Micro Brewery Rebel Red
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:A malt driven Irish style red ale balance by the hop varieties Fuggles and East Kent Golding.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Irish Red Ale
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Garrison Brewing Company Irish Red Ale
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:This classic beer style was inspired by centuries of Celtic brewing history. Specialty kilned malts such as dark caramel and munich dominate the Irish Red resulting in a ruby red colour and smooth malty taste.20 IBU\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Seamus' Irish Red Ale
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Sly Fox Brewing Company Seamus' Irish Red Ale

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Johnny Blood Red
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Titletown Brewing Company Johnny "Blood" McNally Red Ale

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Roggenbier
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Live Oak Brewing Company Live Oak Roggenbier

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Schleimhammer Roggenbier
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Mill Street Brew Pub Mill Street Schleimhammer Roggenbier
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Roggenbier is an ancient style of beer from Germany that actually became extinct for 500 years it is unfiltered like the Wit beer because the style predates filtration. A lot of bad language was used during the first brew, to earn the name Schleimhammer meaning “Slime Hammer” in German, after the mess it caused. We learned a lot and the second brew went better. Producing a delicious beer with a hint of dryness from the Nugget hops and some rich fruitiness and aroma from the German Hefeweizen yeast.12 IBU\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Schlägl Bio-Roggen
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Stiftsbrauerei Schlägl Schlägl Bio-Roggen
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Also sold as "Schlägl Roggen Gold" in the United States.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Thurn Und Taxis Roggen
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Brewery: Thurn Und Taxis Regensburg Gmbh Fürstliche Brauerei
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Thurn Und Taxis Regensburg Gmbh Fürstliche Brauerei Thurn Und Taxis Roggen

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Schremser Roggen Bier
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Brauerei Schrems Schremser Roggen Bier

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Roggenbier
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Beaver Brewing Company Roggenator

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Roggenbier
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Real Ale Brewing Company Roggenbier

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Tippy Toboggan
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Vintage Brewing Company Tippy Toboggon
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Brewed with rye, European specialty malts and Czech Saaz hops, Tippy Toboggan is an old-world ‘Roggen Bier’, a distant cousin to our Weiss bier. With a fresh fruity aroma and a complex nutty/spicy malt character,it’s chock full of flavor yet relatively light and easy drinking.20 IBU\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Roggenbier
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Iron Hill Brewery & Restaurant Roggenbier
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Traditional German dark, rye beer with a huge fruity nose from Bavarian ale yeast. Hints of unsweetened chocolate and caramel from the specialty malts mix with a touch of spiciness from the rye.22 IBU\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Crazy Jackass Ale
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Sweetwater Tavern & Brewery Crazy Jackass Ale

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Roggenschnizzle
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: The Bier Brewery Roggenschnizzle

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Dunkelroggen
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Real Ale Brewing Company Dunkelroggen

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Barbarossa
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Brasserie Dieu Du Ciel Barbarossa

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Orkiszowe
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Browar Kormoran Orkiszowe

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Roggen
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Taps Fish House & Brewery Roggen

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Rye Halladay
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Iron Hill Brewery & Restaurant Rye Halladay

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Red's Rye IPA
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Founders Brewing Company Founders Red's Rye PA
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Brewed with four varieties of Belgian caramel malts and 100% Amarillo hops.70 IBUFormerly called "Founders Red's Rye PA"\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Ruthless Rye IPA
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Sierra Nevada Brewing Co. Sierra Nevada Ruthless Rye IPA
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Rugged and resilient, rye has been a staple grain for ages and its spicy black pepper-like flavor has been prized by distillers and brewers for centuries. Rye thrives in the harshest conditions and comes to life in Ruthless, a rugged IPA with fruity, citrus and herbal hop notes countered by the dry spiciness of the rye. Holding a steadfast balance between contrasting malt and hop character, Ruthless is bold enough to inspire even the most brazen hop head to bear down and embrace the flavor.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Hop Rod Rye
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Bear Republic Brewing Co. Hop Rod Rye
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:A high gravity IPA brewed with 18% rye malt. Hop Rod Rye has a floral hop aroma and subtle caramel notes with a slightly earthy and spicy rye character.2009 California State Fair – GOLD2003 California State Fair – GOLD2002 Real Ale Festival (Chicago) – GOLD\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Rye-on-Rye
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Boulevard Brewing Co. Rye-on-Rye
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Why Rye? This assertively flavorful grain is more often associated with whiskey than with ales. Even in that arena, it has largely been eclipsed by corn and barley, the sources of bourbon and scotch. But when we procured some seasoned barrels from our friends at Templeton Rye, we asked ourselves, “Why not?” Why not brew a rich, tawny rye ale, then mellow it in the warmth of charred oak rye whiskey casks? Two kinds of malted rye provide spicy sweetness, giving way to notes of caramelized wood and the citrusy tang of Perle, Magnum, and Saphir hops before easing into a dry, lingering finish.47 IBU\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Cane And Ebel
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Two Brothers Brewing Company Cane & Ebel
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Dry, but with a creamy touch of Thai Palm Sugar and the spicy tang of Rye, all balanced by loads of the wackiest new Hops we could lay our hands on. Yep, it’s an Orignal. And that’s no Sin.IBU: 68\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Route Des Épices
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Brasserie Dieu Du Ciel Route Des Épices (Ale Rousse Au Poivre)
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:The Routes des Épices is a rye beer in which pepper has been added during the brewing process, lending it wonderful peppery flavours and aromas. The beer also reveals flavours of malt, fresh cereal, chocolate, caramel and a hint of fruit. In the aftertaste, the pepper flavour is once again revealed in full strength and it leaves a pleasing spicy tingling sensation on the tongue. A nice balance is attained between its spiciness and its multitude of other flavours.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Full Moon Pale Rye Ale
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Real Ale Brewing Company Full Moon Pale Rye Ale

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Sky High Rye
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Arcadia Brewing Company Arcadia Sky High Rye
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:This West Coast-style pale ale is brewed with 80% English barley malts and 20% rye malt. It boasts a massive floral aroma of resinous hops, contributing notes of lemons, peaches and pine needles and is anchored by the sweet malty flavors of toffee and freshly baked pumpernickel bread.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: RastafaRye Ale
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Blue Point Brewing Company Blue Point Rastafa Rye Ale
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:No children, no cry! In true Rastafarian spirit – drinking our RastafaRye Ale directly benefits underprivileged kids. Everything is Irie with our award-winning RastafaRye Ale, a hearty rye malt, blended with fresh West Coast hops resulting in a delicious, deep copper ale with just the right amount of rye flavor to offset the spicy, floral characteristics of the hops. The Blue Point Brewing Company donates a portion of all RastafaRye Ale sales to They Often Cry Outreach (TOCO) a Taj Weekes charity foundation that helps orphaned and underprivileged children in the Caribbean and around the world.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Samuel Adams Revolutionary Rye AleBoston Beer Company (Samuel Adams)
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Boston Beer Company (Samuel Adams) Samuel Adams Revolutionary Rye Ale

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Six (#6)
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Upright Brewing Company Six (#6)
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:"Six is a dark rye beer with layered flavors including chocolate, caramel, pepper, wood, cherry and tropical fruit. It starts semi-dry and smooth and finishes fully dry and tart with a small bite from the hops. The overall balance of the Six makes it easy to pair with richly prepared meats along with many harder cheeses."Malts: organic pale, caramel, rye, blackUnmalted: rolled ryeHops: magnum, tettnanger\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Rye P.A. Hatter
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: New Holland Brewing Company Rye P.A. Hatter

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Daymark
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Rising Tide Brewing Company Daymark
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Chart a new course with Daymark as your guide. We start with a classic, clean and crisp American pale ale brewed with spicy Columbus and Centennial hops. Then we accent the grain bill with rye grown on small local family farms right here in Maine and malted to our specifications at Valley Malts, an artisanal malt house. Finally we dry hop the finished beer for a bright floral aroma.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Permagrin
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Lawson's Finest Liquids Permagrin Rye Pale Ale
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:This special brew incorporates malted rye in the grain bill lending a spicy character and complex flavors. Generously hopped with Amarillo, Simcoe, Cascade and Centennial. This hoppy pale ale has a sneaky bite that will creep up and leave you smiling!\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Westside Rye
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Boulevard Brewing Co. Westside Rye

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Summer Rye
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Mayflower Brewing Company Summer Rye

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Dock Street Rye IPA
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Dock Street Brewery & Restaurant Rye IPA
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:An aggressively hopped American Style India Pale Ale brewed with Columbus, Simcoe and Amarillo hops. The use of 20% rye gives this ale it's trademark dry and spicy character.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Salmon Fly Honey Rye
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Madison River Brewing Company Salmon Fly Honey Rye
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Madison River Brewing Company presents Salmon Fly Honey Rye. The malted barley used in this unique brew is complimented by the subtle spiciness of rye. Bittering and flavor hop additions help keep this brew extremely balanced. In addition, there is a mild sweetness that dulls any overwhelming rye or hop flavor derived from the pure local Montana honey. These ingredients blend together to create a lighter bodied drinking experience for all kinds of beer drinkers.23 IBU\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Rye IPA
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Black Market Brewing Co. Rye IPA

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Rye Pale Ale
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: The Bronx Brewery Pale Ale

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Bridal Veil Rye Pale Ale
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Telluride Brewing Co. Bridal Veil Rye Pale Ale

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Backwoods Bastard
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Founders Brewing Company Founders Backwoods Bastard
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Expect lovely, warm smells of single malt scotch, oaky bourbon barrels, smoke, sweet caramel and roasted malts, a bit of earthy spice and a scintilla of dark fruit. It’s a kick-back sipper made to excite the palate.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Dirty Bastard
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Founders Brewing Company Founders Dirty Bastard
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:So good it’s almost wrong. Dark ruby in color and brewed with seven varieties of imported malts. Complex in finish, with hints of smoke and peat, paired with a malty richness and a right hook of hop power to give it the bad attitude that a beer named Dirty Bastard has to live up to. Ain’t for the wee lads. Brewed with 7 varieties of malt (varies over the years).50 IBU\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Old Chub - Scottish Style Ale
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Oskar Blues Grill & Brew Old Chub - Scottish Style Ale
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:From the Oskar Blues website: "This jaw-dropping Scottish strong ale (8% ABV) is brewed with bodacious amounts of malted barley and specialty grains, and a dash of beechwood-smoked malt."\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Skull Splitter
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Orkney Brewery SkullSplitter

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Scotty Karate Scotch Ale
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Dark Horse Brewing Company Dark Horse Scotty Karate Scotch Ale
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:For those of you who don’t know who “Scotty Karate” is… He is a local one man band who plays an amazing slurry of honky-tonk influenced, punk-country songs. (Check him out at www.scottykaratetime.com) A big bold musician deserves a big bold beer, that's why Scotty and our Scotch Ale are a perfect tribute to one another. Scotty Karate is brewed with cherry wood smoked malt instead of the traditional peat smoked malt offering up warming notes of coffee, caramel and sweet caramelized brown sugar. Scotty finishes earthy giving this beer a character all it's own, just like the man himself.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Claymore
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Great Divide Brewing Company Claymore Scotch Ale
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Named for a medieval Scottish sword, Claymore Scotch Ale is our tribute to the legendary “Wee Heavy” beers of Scotland. This malty, deep-ruby beauty features lots of caramel sweetness, a reserved hop profile, and a subtle warming character. Unlike its namesake, this beer only requires one hand, but it’ll still make you feel like nobility.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Rum Cask Oak Aged Beer
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Innis & Gunn Rum Cask Oak Aged Beer

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Wee Heavy
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: AleSmith Brewing Company AleSmith Wee Heavy
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:A classic Scotch Ale. Scotch ales are typically sweet and malty, with a very subdued dose of hops– just enough to provide balance. AleSmith Wee Heavy is a wonderful interpretation of this traditional Scotch style.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Traquair House Ale
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Traquair House Brewery Lld Traquair House Ale

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Samuel Adams Scotch AleBoston Beer Company (Samuel Adams)
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Boston Beer Company (Samuel Adams) Samuel Adams Scotch Ale

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Wee Heavy
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Belhaven Brewery Company Ltd. Wee Heavy

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Traquair Jacobite
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Traquair House Brewery Lld Traquair Jacobite
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Traquair Jacobite Ale is a Scotch ale with an ancient ingredient, coriander: rich, deep flavors are accented by exotic coriander aroma. Traquair House Brewery, located within Scotland's oldest inhabited house, uses a 1738 copper kettle and oak fermenters to produce this fine ale, first brewed in 1995 to commemorate the Jacobite Revolution.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Kilt Lifter Scotch Ale
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Moylan's Brewery Kilt Lifter Scotch Ale

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Big Sound
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Cigar City Brewing Big Sound Scotch Ale
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Big Sound Scotch Ale is dedicated to our good buddy Gino, the most Punk Rock Bagpiper you will ever meet, and the rest of the men and women of the Tampa Bay Pipes and Drums. Brown in color, Big Sound has huge notes of dark sweet toffee with underlying mild notes of coffee in the aroma. The flavor starts with a slight note of cherry and then opens into a goliath of malt character with notes of dark sweet toffee, coffee and mild notes of toasted bread in the finish. Big Sound Scotch Ale pairs well with Haggis, Highland Games, Huge Heads, Enormous pillows and of course Bagpipe Music.40 IBU\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Samuel Adams Wee Heavy (Imperial Series)Boston Beer Company (Samuel Adams)
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Boston Beer Company (Samuel Adams) Samuel Adams Wee Heavy (Imperial Series)

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Jinx
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Magic Hat Brewing Company Jinx
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:It’s OK to be a Wee Heavy. Much has been made of the ills of smoking. Jinx thinks there’s nothing wrong with it. For years, he stood strong with his peat-smoked whiskey malt mash. He held his head high when others made fun of his wee heavy physique, becoming a mainstay in Magic Hat’s Night of the Living Dead Variety 12-Pak. People said he’d never attain an Original Gravity above 15.1 degrees Plato or an ABV above 6%. He proved them wrong. Take Magic Hat into the next alellenium. Vote Jinx.23 IBU\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Équinoxe Du Printemps
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Brasserie Dieu Du Ciel Équinoxe Du Printemps
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Équinoxe du Printemps (French for "spring equinox") is the quintessential marriage of two great traditions: beer brewing in Scotland, and maple syrup production in Quebec. At the first draught, the mouth is overcome by woody, malty flavours, sustained by a discrete touch of sweetness. The aftertaste brings about the flavours of maple, which are sufficiently present to be appreciated, but never overwhelming the typical flavours of a Scotch Ale. Equinoxe du printemps is brewed only once a year in January. It is aged for two months in order to attain a perfect balance in taste. Then, it is sold starting March 21st, until stocks last.The Equinoxe du printemps was born in our Montreal brewpub in February 1999.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Smuttynose Scotch Style Ale (Big Beer Series)
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Smuttynose Brewing Company Smuttynose Scotch Style Ale (Big Beer Series)
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Our Scotch Ale is a bold amber beer that balances smooth rich sweetness with a hint of peat smoked malt. The infusion of this subtle smokiness invites images of heather fields, platters of haggis, & the poetry of William McGonagall. Enjoy one with your mates!2007 - 8.2%2008 - 7.1%2013 - 8.0%\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Wee Heavy Scotch Style Ale
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: The Duck-Rabbit Craft Brewery Duck-Rabbit Wee Heavy Scotch Style Ale
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:The Duck-Rabbit’s Scotch Ale is a full-bodied, deep copper-colored treasure. Bold and malty, this beer’s sweetness comes from a massive quantity of grain complemented by some serious kettle carmelization. The flavor is rounded out by a warming alcohol sensation.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Scotch De Silly
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Brasserie de Silly S.A. Scotch Silly

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Wee Heavy - Barrel-Aged
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: AleSmith Brewing Company AleSmith Wee Heavy - Barrel Aged

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Warped Speed Scotch Ale
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Lake Louie Brewery Company Lake Louie Warped Speed Scotch Ale

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Drafty Kilt Scotch Ale
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Monday Night Brewing Drafty Kilt Scotch Ale
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:A roasty scotch ale with a hint of smoke. Full-bodied, but not overpowering. Smokey, but not in a creepy bar kind of way. Sweet, but not obnoxiously so. Sound like your ideal mother-in-law? Fair enough, but it also is a pretty dead-on description of our Scotch Ale. In a difficult hop-growing climate, Scottish brewers relied on other ingredients to impart flavor and bitterness – one such ingredient was smoked malt. Drafty Kilt is a dark, malty bombshell of a beer.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Iron Thistle
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Rahr & Sons Brewing Company Iron Thistle
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:SCOTTISH STYLE ALEAvailable : February ReleaseBreak out the bagpipes with your lederhosen! We’re proud to present our Iron Thistle Scotch Ale – Rahr’s first National Grand Champion winner. This dark, Scottish ale has a bold taste dominated by a smooth, sweet maltiness balanced with a low, hoppy bitterness. So don your kilts and enjoy. Here’s to your health – Slàinte! Prosit!IBU35HOP VARIETIESWarriorMALTS2 Row, Vienna, Crystal, Chocolate, Carafa Special II

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Wet Willy Scotch Ale
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: New England Brewing Co. Wet Willy Scotch Ale

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Sheep Shagger Scotch Ale
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Tyranena Brewing Company Sheep Shagger Scotch Ale

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Wee Heavy-er Scotch Style Ale
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: French Broad Brewing Co. Wee Heavy-er Scotch Style Ale

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Ol' Red Cease & Desist Wee Heavy Ale
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Erie Brewing Co. Ol' Red Cease And Desist

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Shaggin' In The Wood
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Tyranena Brewing Company Shaggin' In The Wood

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Maple Scotch-Style Ale
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Sierra Nevada Brewing Co. Sierra Nevada Scotch Ale

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Heavy Horse Scotch Ale
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Big Sky Brewing Company Heavy Horse Scotch Ale

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Scotch Ale
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Sprecher Brewing Company Pipers Scotch-Style Ale
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:A hearty red-brown “Wee Heavy,” Scotch Ale has all the smokey sweet complex malt goodness you could wish for. Peated, caramel and lightly toasted malts brewed just right give you a smooth beer with a delicate hop finish and creamy head.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Bancreagie Peated Scotch Ale
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Brau Brothers Brewing Co. LLC Bancreagie Peated Scotch Ale

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Louie's Reserve Scotch Ale
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Lake Louie Brewery Company Louie's Reserve Scotch Ale
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Released annually in August\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Outta Kilter
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Hoppin' Frog Brewery Outta Kilter

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Robert The Bruce
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Three Floyds Brewing Co. & Brewpub Robert The Bruce Scottish Ale
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:A full-bodied Scottish-style Ale with a well-rounded malty profile and roasted biscuit-like notes.24 IBU\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Scottish Ale
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Belhaven Brewery Company Ltd. Belhaven Scottish Ale
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Our signature Scottish Ale is the beer we've brewed the longest and is our best-selling bottle world-wide. We brew it from 100% Scottish Optic and Crystal barley malts for a nutty, biscuit character, balanced with a subtle spiciness from Challenger and Goldings hops for an all-around satisfying beer. George Howell - Master Brewer, Belhaven\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: 90 Shilling
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Odell Brewing Company Oak Aged 90 Shilling
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:We introduced 90 Shilling, our flagship beer, at our opening party in 1989. For a while, we'd been wondering what would happen if we lightened up the traditional Scottish ale? The result is an irresistibly smooth and delicious medium-bodied amber ale.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Original Oak Aged Beer
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Innis & Gunn Innis And Gunn Oak Aged Beer
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:This is our firstborn brew, whose accidental discovery started our story in 2003. Its originality also lies in its singular taste – notes of biscuity malt and vanilla swirling within a creamy, mellow character. A pioneering beer, its flavour finds favour with brewing juries, blind tasting panels and barflies alike.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Winter Ale
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Brooklyn Brewery Brooklyn Winter Ale
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Brooklyn completely changed the recipe in 2006. It?s now a Scottish-style ale. Brewmaster Garrett Oliver explained to us that: ?There are no spices at all. Good British floor malts and hops along with our yeast strain account for all the flavors. It has a Scottish-style cooler fermentation, which pushes malt to the forefront rather than fruitiness.? It was brewed with Scottish Floor-malted Maris Otter, English crystal malts, Belgian Aromatic malt, American roasted malts, American oats and hopped with Willamette.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Kilt Lifter Scottish Style Ale
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Four Peaks Brewing Company Kilt Lifter Scottish Style Ale
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Kilt Lifter is our award-winning flagship brew, crafted in the tradition and honor of the great strong ales of Scotland. Take one sip and you’ll swear it had been brewed by men in kilts—and maybe it was. It’s a full-bodied ale with pronounced flavors of caramel and roasted barley. Notice its amber color, malty sweetness and a hint of smokiness with a clean dry finish? That’s a true Scottish-style ale.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Railbender Ale
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Erie Brewing Co. Railbender Ale
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Erie Brewing Company flagship beer features a deep malt flavor, caramel sweetness lingering in a soft hop flavor. Dark Amber.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Hibernator
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Long Trail Brewing Co. Hibernator
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:A Vermont classic returns in 2017! Built to take the bite from a cold winter night, Hibernator features a rich malt base highlighted by warming notes of caramel and toffee. Don't sleep on this rich, robust winter brew. Last year we awoke the bears with a limited run of cans offered at our brewery in Bridgewater Corners. In 2017, we're culminating a year of throwing it back to our roots, by sending Hibernator out for a full run of distribution in 6pks and 12pks of 12 ounce bottles and on draught. Keep your eyes out for it as the weather cools down!32 IBU\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Wee Mac
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Sun King Brewing Company Wee Mac Brown
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Wee Mac Scottish-style Ale is an enticing and malty brown ale with caramel, cocoa, and hazelnut character balanced with toffee undertones.23 IBU\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Dark Island
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Orkney Brewery Dark Island

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Piper Down
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Ballast Point Brewing Company Pepper Piper Down (Habanero)

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: St. Andrew's Ale
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Belhaven Brewery Company Ltd. St. Andrew's Ale

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Jolly Scot Scottish Ale
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Appalachian Brewing Company Jolly Scot Scottish Ale

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Laughing Lab Scottish-Style Ale
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Bristol Brewing Company Laughing Lab Scottish-Style Ale
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Laughing Lab is our most popular brew among beer drinkers and beer judges alike, with nine medals to its name since 1994 at the Great American Beer Festival alone. The Lab has a complex maltiness that comes from a careful blend of specialty malts. Its nutty, roasted flavor is mildly sweet, but not too rich. Smooth and luscious!\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Red MacGregor
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Orkney Brewery The Red MacGregor
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Red MacGregor is a mighty beer indeed, it has a wonderfully complex aroma of fruity hop zest and spiciness with rich malts. Initial toasted and caramel malt, then mouth-watering citrus hop fruits, giving way to a clean dry refreshing robust hop bitterness.One of the first beers in the UK that expressively used the citrusy American hop Cascade and as a result became a forerunner to Britain’s new wave of craft beers and was also the first Scottish beer to win the BIIA World Cask Beer Gold Medal.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Twisted Kilt Scotch Ale
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Thirsty Dog Brewing Company Twisted Kilt Scotch Ale

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Burning Skye Scottish Style Ale
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Empyrean Brewing Company Burning Skye Scottish Ale
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Brewed in the tradition of Scotland's malty-sweet beers. Sweet and smooth with a wee hint of smoked character. Brewed with American, English & German grown barley and American hops.13 IBU\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Blackfriar
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Inveralmond Brewery Ltd., The Blackfriar

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Stone's Throw Scottish Ale
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Fargo Brewing Company Stone's Throw Scottish Ale
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Stone’s Throw is dark, complex, and smooth. It is very approachable for those new to craft beer, satisfy serious veterans. The aroma hints of toasted breadcrumbs, caramel, and dried fruits. The flavor is dominated by caramel toffee, toasty malt, hints of cocoa, honey sweetness.19 IBU\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Dark Island Reserve
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Orkney Brewery Dark Island Reserve

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Caledonian 80/-
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: The Caledonian Brewing Company Caledonian 80/-

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: MacPelican's Scottish Style Ale
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Pelican Pub & Brewery MacPelican's Scottish Style Ale
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:13 degrees PlatoAlcohol: 5.0% by volumeBitterness: 17 IBUColor: Copper\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Lia Fail
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Inveralmond Brewery Ltd., The Lia Fail

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Scottish Ale
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Gritty McDuff's Brewing Company Gritty McDuff's Scottish Ale
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:It takes a brave beer to stand up to a Maine winter. Gritty McDuff 's Scottish Ale is returns every January to help you weather the season. Scottish Style Ale is our interpretation of the robust brews native to Scotland. Generous quantities of Pale malt along with Munich and Caramalts give this ale a deep and complex profile. Scottish Style Ale is just a shade darker than our Bitter, with a rich, slightly sweet first impression on the palate that rounds out to a satisfying maltiness and a medium-dry hop finish. At 6.3% ABV it's hearty but not overwhelming. Sure to please the Braveheart in all of us.25 IBU\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Black Douglas Ale
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Broughton Ales Ltd Black Douglas Ale

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Olde Ore Dock Scottish Ale
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Keweenaw Brewing Company Olde Ore Dock Scottish Ale

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Piper Down - Bourbon Barrel-Aged
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Ballast Point Brewing Company Piper Down Scottish Ale (Bourbon Barrel Aged)

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: 80/- (Eighty Shilling)
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Williams Brothers Brewing Company 80/- (Eighty Shilling)

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Scottish Ale
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Fearless Brewing Company Scottish Ale

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Hog's Head Brew (Harry Potter)
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Florida Beer Company Hog's Head Brew (Harry Potter)

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Java Mac
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Sun King Brewing Company Java Mac
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Java Mac is the coffee infused version of our Wee Mac Scottish-Style Ale. Locally roasted coffee from Bee Roasters harmonizes with the base beer's hazelnut character and toffee undertones to create a vibrant symphony of rich coffee flavor.Java Mac was the winner of the Gold Medal in the Coffee Beer category at the 2011 Great American Beer Festival.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Bold Coast Pemaquid Ale
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Sheepscot Valley Brewing Company Pemaquid Ale
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:A full-bodied Scottish Ale with a hoppy finish.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Beltaine Scottish Ale
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Shoreline Brewery And Restaurant Beltaine Scottish Ale

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Skye Black
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Isle Of Skye Brewery Black Cuillin
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Brewed with oats and heather honey.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Fore Smoked Stout
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Dark Horse Brewing Company Dark Horse Fore Smoked Stout
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Number four in our stout series, this beer is brewed with all malted barley and hardwood smoked malt. Aromas of smoked chocolate and coffee leave way to a full-bodied stout with a smokey finish. Fore is a house favorite among our brewers.22 IBU\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Sue
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Yazoo Brewing Company Sue
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:The south is famous for smoking everything. Why not beer? Sue is a big, rich, smoky malt bomb of a beer, with mellow smokiness coming from barley malts smoked with cherry wood, and assertive bitterness from Galena and Perle hops to cleanse the finish.Original tap version was 7.5% ABV, bottled version is up to 9%.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Smoking Wood - Bourbon Barrel-Aged
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: The Bruery Smoking Wood Rye Barrel Aged
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:2014 Vintage is 14% ABV\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Ashtray Heart
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Evil Twin Brewing Evil Twin Ashtray Heart
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Brewed at De Molen, the Netherlands..\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Norwegian Wood
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: HaandBryggeriet Norwegian Wood
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Brewed with smoked malt, munich malt, crystal and chocolate malt, and spiced with juniper twigs and berries.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Sunturnbrew
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Brewery: Nøgne Ø - Det Kompromissløse Bryggeri A/S
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Nøgne Ø - Det Kompromissløse Bryggeri A/S Sunturnbrew
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Brewed at the solstice each year since 2008.This smoked barely wine is brewed with 30% smoked malt and 20% rye.26° Plato, 50 IBU,\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Charkoota Rye
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: New Holland Brewing Company Charkoota Rye
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Charkoota Rye - Smoked Doppelbock LagerCharkoota Rye is a Smoked Rye Dopplebock. Charkoota Rye's malty backbone is derived from a blend of rye and four other malts, including malted barley smoked over cherry wood by our very own brewers, John and Jeff.Its smoke-forward body is balanced with tones of deep mollasses and caramel, with a crisp, clean lager finish. 19° Plato, Alc. 7.75% by Vol.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Holger Danske (with Kissmeyer)
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Hill Farmstead Brewery Holger Danske
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Smoked Brown Ale\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Hemel & Aarde
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Brouwerij De Molen Hemel & Aarde
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Hemel & Aarde is brewed with the most heavily peated malts we could find. Not for the fainthearted. This powerful brew overwhelms you with smoke, chocolate and coffee. Flavour indication: smoke, chocolate, coffee Translates as Heaven & Earth\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Bar Fly
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Midnight Sun Brewing Co. Bar Fly
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Smoked Imperial Stout brewed with smoked malt, molasses, brown sugar and aged in Bourbon barrels.Somber and smoky, BARFLY saunters into the room slowly. Thick smoke. Cool swagger. Good wood. Too much brass. Sticky leather. Slow glances. Lingering looks. The only thing that didn’t make the glass was maraschino cherry. Bring your own and wear out your welcome.Malt: Smoked maltOther: Molasses and brown sugarIBU: 45\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Hank On Rye
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Three Floyds Brewing Co. & Brewpub Ham On Rye
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:This beer, created in honor of Henry Chinaski, was a collaboration between Three Floyds and Jonathan Cutler of Piece Brewery. Its delicate, spicy, smoked character is derived from a portion of smoked and rye malts. Formerly known as Ham On Rye.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Grodziskie
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Professor Fritz Briem Professor Fritz Briem Grodziskie
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Grodziskie or Grätzer is a Sour Smoked Wheat Ale that was brewed in the 1900s in East Prussia and dates back to as early as the 15th century. It was named after the Polish town of Grodzisk Wielkopolski or Grätz in German.Our historic version is brewed according to the German Purity Law with air-dried barley & beech smoked wheat malt and hopped with Perle & Saaz.A sour mash is created using the old and forgotten technique called "Digerieren." Finally, a three month aging & maturation process creates a complex sour, smoky & heavily hoppy wheat ale.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Bloed, Zweet & Tranen
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Brouwerij De Molen Bloed, Zweet & Tranen
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Smoked Stout. A combination of English peat smoked malts and another smoked malt from Bamberg, Germany.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: LA-31 Boucanèe
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Bayou Teche Brewery LA-31 Boucanèe
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:LA-31 Boucanèe is our acknowledgment of the importance of the wild cherry tree to south Louisiana. Using cherry-wood smoked wheat we craft a surprisingly delicious and unique ale.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Rook & Vuur
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Brouwerij De Molen Rook & Vuur
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Premiant hop & Saaz as late hop.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Charbonniere
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Brasserie Dieu Du Ciel Charbonniere
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Inspired by the German Rauchbier – smoked beers from the Bamberg region – Charbonnière is a dark amber beer with a distinctly smokey aroma, obtained by the use of wood-smoked malt during the brewing process. It is sustained by a slightly sweet malt backbone, permitting the smoked malt to express itself freely with every sip.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: White Birch Tavern Ale
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: White Birch Brewing White Birch Tavern Ale
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Butter’s Tavern was a fixture of Concord, NH in the eighteenth century. Inspired by their loggerhead ale, we’ve created a Smoked Imperial Brown Ale. Hearty malts, with a nuanced smokiness and smooth finish create our interpretation of this historic ale. We hope you enjoy this slice of New Hampshire history.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Simple Malt Double Porter
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Brasseurs Illimités Simple Malt Double Porter

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Adelscott
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Brewery: Brasserie Fischer / Fischer Biere d' Alsace
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Brasserie Fischer / Fischer Biere d' Alsace Adelscott

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Rökporter
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: the Nils Oscar Company Nils Oscar Rökporter
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Hopped with Fuggles and Amarillo. 14.8° Plato.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Rex Attitude
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Yeastie Boys Rex Attitude

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Hogwash!
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Fullsteam Brewery Hogwash!
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Hickory Smoked Brown Porter brewed to be paired with North Carolina Barbecue.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Bravoure
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Brewery: Brouwerij De Dochter van de Korenaar
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Brouwerij De Dochter van de Korenaar Bravoure

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Hogwash
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Jackie O's Pub & Brewery Hogwash
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:The Jackie O's take on a breakfast beer, Hogwash was designed to taste like breakfast sausage. German smoked malt, local maple syrup, and lavender was used to evoke the thought of breakfast sausage.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Backyard Ale
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Flying Dog Brewery Backyard Ale

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Black Cabin Smoked Ale
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Crown Valley Brewing & Distilling Co. Black Cabin Smoked Ale
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:The flavorful, smoky undertones of our smoked ale are enhanced by the chocolate, black and smoked malt.25 IBU\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Wild Fire Wheat
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Bootlegger's Brewery Wild Fire Wheat

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Smoaktoberfest
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Live Oak Brewing Company Live Oak Oaktoberfest

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Festina Pêche
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Dogfish Head Brewery Festina Pêche
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:In Festina Peche, since the natural peach sugars are eaten by the yeast, the fruit complexity is woven into both the aroma and the taste of the beer so there is no need to doctor it with woodruff or raspberry syrup. Just open and enjoy!8 IBU\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Professor Fritz Briem Professor Fritz Briem 1809 Berliner Weisse
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Already in the 1600s the Berliner Weisse Style Beer was mentioned in documents by the French reformers "Huguenots" as they crossed Berlin on their way to Flanders. In 1809, the Emperor Napoleon and his troops celebrated their Prussian victory with it.This Berliner Weisse Style Beer is brewed with traditional mash hoping [sic] and without wort boiling. This along with a traditional strain of lactic acid bacteria provide a fruity and dry but palateful character. A character that Napoleon and his troops characterized as "lively" and "elegant".Historic Signature Series:Forgotten styles brewed according to their historic recipes by Dr. Fritz Briem, of the Doemens Institute.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Deesko!
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Three Floyds Brewing Co. & Brewpub Deesko
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:A Munster-style Berliner Weiss. Tart, refreshing, and perfect for summer.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Tartare
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Bear Republic Brewing Co. Tartare
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:One of the world's classic sour beer styles, Tartare is Bear Republic's interpretation of Berliner Weisse, the tart, low-alcohol beer style dubbed as "The Champagne of the North." Bronze medal at the 2011 Festival of Wood and Barrel Aged Beer in the Wild Beer/Acidic Category Winner at 2013 Good Food Awards, Adventurous, Barreled, Big, Bawdy, & Belgian Beer Category\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Berliner Weisse
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: White Birch Brewing White Birch Berliner Weisse
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Our approach was to brew this beer with Lactobacilius for a refreshing and authentic interpretation of a classic summer refresher.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Berliner Style Weisse
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Gasthaus & Gosebrauerei Bayerischer Bahnhof Berliner Style Weisse
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Huguenots may have originated the style as they traveled through France to Flanders, having first mentioned it in the 1600s. Later, in 1809, Napoleon and his troops identified Berliner Weisse as the "Champagne of the North". He requested the beer be served with syrup to cut its extreme level of acidity. Our interpretation is a slightly softer, more mellow version of the "Berliner Weisse" style with a beautiful balance of tartness, fruitness, and sweetness.

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Sour Wench
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Ballast Point Brewing Company Sour Wench Blackberry Ale
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Our Sour Wench Blackberry Ale is a fruity Berliner Weisse-style beer bursting with Oregon blackberry flavor and aroma. The fruit addition adds a beautiful violet hue, and the taste has an approachable soft tartness from kettle souring. This artful gypsy will surely lure you into the world of sour beers.10 IBU\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Berliner Kindl Weisse
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Berliner Kindl Brauerei Berliner Kindl Weisse

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Berliner Weisse
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Jackie O's Pub & Brewery Berliner Weiss
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Sour wheat ale fermented with Jackie O’s house lactobacillus and brettanomyces cultures. Produced via a unique Solera method ensuring consistency and variation over time. This is not a kettle sour.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Ching Ching
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Bend Brewing Company Ching Ching

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: La Folie
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: New Belgium Brewing La Folie
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Flemish Sour Brown Ale fermented in stainless then transferred to barrels for 1-4 years of aging then blended to taste.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Monk's Café Flemish Sour Ale
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Brouwerij Van Steenberge N.V. Monk's Café Flemish Sour Ale
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Brewed for Monk's Café in Philadelphia, but also available for retail purchase elsewhere. Oud Bruin in style; a traditional blend of young and old beers.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: The Dissident
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Deschutes Brewery The Dissident
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Flanders style sour brown brewed with dark candi sugar and Oregon Montmorency cherries, aged in Pinot Noir barrels.30 IBUFirst release (9.0% ABV) - August 2008Second release (10.5% ABV) - November 2010 (~118bbl)Third release (11.4% ABV) - October 2012Fourth release (10.7% ABV) - December 2014\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Goudenband
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Brouwerij Liefmans Goudenband

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Madame Rose
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Goose Island Beer Co. Madame Rose
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Belgian-style wild ale aged in French oak Cabernet Sauvignon barrels with the addition of Michigan cherries and heavily inoculated with Brettanomyces.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Rosso E Marrone
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Captain Lawrence Brewing Co. Rosso E Marrone
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Red wine grapes mixed with sour brown ale to create this truly unique sensory experience. Aged in oak barrels with Brettanomyces to help marry the flavors and impart a distinct sour character found nowhere else. Rich, vinous, tart and tangy are the flavors of this classic American Sour Ale.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Bacchus
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Brouwerij Van Honsebrouck N.V. Bacchus

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Haandbakk
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: HaandBryggeriet Haandbakk
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:This is a recreation of a Norwegian style naturally soured ale, aged in oak wine barrels for 18 months for the authentic sour flavour. The first wild yeast-fermented beer brewed in Norway for over 100 years.15 IBU\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Cuvee Freddy
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Picobrouwerij Alvinne / Den Bierzolder Cuvee Freddy

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Cherry Oud Bruin
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Kuhnhenn Brewing Company Kuhnhenn Cherry Olde Brune
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:This is a Flanders Sour Brown Ale which has the characteristics of sherry with a sweet fruity aroma. It is dark reddish brown in color and is high in acidity, sweetness and sourness. This is a complex beer that should be imbibed with notice to it’s high alcohol content.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Aardmonnik - Earthmonk
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: De Struise Brouwers Aardmonnik - Earthmonk
