dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: La Sang-d'encre
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Le Trou Du Diable La Sang-d'encre

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Celebration Stout
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: The Porterhouse Brewing Company Celebration Stout
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Originally 10.0% ABV but brought back at 7.0% and then 6.5%.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Black Magic Stout
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Empire Brewing Company Black Magic Stout
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:A traditional dry Irish stout, carbonated with nitrogen (it pours very much like a Guinness). Dry roasted flavors are prominent, with hints of chocolate and coffee on the finish.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Patio Tools
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Cigar City Brewing Hillsborough River Dry Stout (Patio Tools)

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Friend Of An Irishman Stout
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Christian Moerlein Brewing Company Friend Of An Irishman Stout

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Guinness Original
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Guinness Ltd. Guinness Original

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Ring Of Dingle
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Sun King Brewing Company Ring Of Dingle Irish Stout
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Named for a road in Ireland, Ring Of Dingle is dark in color, light of body, rich and roasty with a creamy head.34 IBU\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Revelation Stout
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Public House Brewing Company Revalations Stout
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Mmmmm....Revelations indeed. Black as midnight. Heavy on the soul. Think you don't like Stout? Try this one.Think you don't like any kind of beer? Try this one.We can't tell you how many times we've heard both declarations from the mouths of our customers and low and behold....they try this beer and are saved from a life of bad beer or no beer at all. Can I get a witness?Lift a glass of this dry stout up to your nose and breathe in the decadent aroma of dark chocolate emanating from the creamy off-white to tan-colored head. Take a sip and feel the familiar warmth of roasted coffee that goes down smooth. A lighter body than your average stout makes this one a house favorite--our best-selling beer, in fact. So throw off your shackles! Come to the House of the PourAnd you just might find salvationIn a glass of Revelations!\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Breakfast Stout
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Founders Brewing Company Founders Breakfast Stout
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:The coffee lover’s consummate beer. Brewed with an abundance of flaked oats, bitter and imported chocolates, and Sumatra and Kona coffee, this stout has an intense fresh-roasted java nose topped with a frothy, cinnamon-colored head that goes forever.60 IBU\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Oatmeal StoutSamuel Smith Old Brewery (Tadcaster)
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Samuel Smith Old Brewery (Tadcaster) Samuel Smith's Oatmeal Stout

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Wake-n-Bake Coffee Oatmeal Imperial Stout
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Terrapin Beer Company Terrapin Coffee Oatmeal Imperial Stout
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Formerly known as Terrapin Coffee Oatmeal Imperial Stout.Two Athens, GA companies, Terrapin and Jittery Joes, have teamed up to create a unique blend of coffee: Wake-n-Bake. We then use the blend in our W-n-B Coffee Oatmeal Imperial Stout.HOPS: Nugget; MALTS: 2-Row, Crystal 85, Flaked Barley, Flaked Oats, Chocolate, Black, Roasted Barley; OTHER INGREDIENTS: Jittery Joe's Coffee.IBU: 50; OG: 21.5\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Shakespeare Oatmeal Stout
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Rogue Ales Shakespeare Oatmeal Stout
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:9 Ingredients:Malts: Northwest Harrington & Klages, Crystal 135-165 & Beeston Chocolate, Rolled Oats & Roasted Barley.Hops: Cascade.Yeast & Water: Rogue's Pacman Yeast & Free Range Coastal Water. 15º PLATO69 IBU77 AA135º Lovibond\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Velvet Merkin
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Firestone Walker Brewing Co. Velvet Merlin (Merkin)
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Our decadent Oatmeal Stout lovingly aged in Bourbon barrels. Beautiful chocolate, espresso and vanilla-bourbon aromas hold your nose hostage. Rich dark chocolate truffle, bourbon and espresso create a dangerously smooth and incredibly drinkable barrel aged Oatmeal Stout. Hoarding tendencies may occur.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Beer Geek Breakfast
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Mikkeller ApS Beer Geek Breakfast
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Brewed at Nøgne Ø.Ingredients : Water, malt (pils, oat, smoked, caramunich, brown, pale chocolate and chocolate), roasted barley, flaked oats, hops (centennial and cascade), ale yeast and gourmet coffee.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Barney Flats Oatmeal Stout
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Anderson Valley Brewing Company Barney Flats Oatmeal Stout
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:The deep ebony color, voluptuous mahogany head and bold, roasty flavors in our Barney Flats Oatmeal Stout are what serious beer drinkers expect from this style. Aromas of freshly baked bread, espresso, and dried cherries meld seamlessly with rich toffee flavors and a creamy mouth feel to create an unparalleled drinking experience.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: The Poet
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: New Holland Brewing Company New Holland The Poet
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:IBU's: 40\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Java Head Stout
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Tröegs Brewing Company Tröegs Java Head Stout
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:JavaHead is like a day at Tröegs; it’s hard to tell where the coffee ends and the beer begins. This creamy oatmeal stout is infused with locally roasted, cold steeped coffee through our HopBack vessel, releasing subtle hints of cocoa, roasted nuts and dark mocha.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: B.O.R.I.S. Oatmeal Imperial Stout - Barrel-Aged
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Hoppin' Frog Brewery Barrel Aged B.O.R.I.S. Oatmeal Imperial Stout
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:English-style Imperial Stout aged in Kentucky bourbon barrels.Batch 1- 2009(April) GOLD capBatch 2- 2009(July) GOLD Batch 3- 2009(Oct) GREEN Batch 4- 2010 BLACKBatch 5- 2011 REDBatch 6- 2012 WHITE\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Oatmeal Stout
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Breckenridge Brewery Oatmeal Stout
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:It's a bold, smooth-bodied concoction that oozes dark-roasted coffee aromas and flavors of espresso and semi-sweet chocolate. We round out these heady pleasures with a dose of flaked oatmeal for a creamy body and a semi-dry finish. Unforgettable.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: St-Ambroise Oatmeal Stout
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: McAuslan Brewing St-Ambroise Oatmeal Stout
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Brewed from 40 percent dark malts and roasted barley, this intensely black ale carries strong hints of espresso and chocolate. Oatmeal contributes body and a long-lasting mocha-colored head to this well-hopped beer.• Dense mocha-coloured head• Chocolate/espresso flavour, medium sweet with a distinct floral aroma• Ideal accompaniment to chocolate desserts\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Oatmeal Stout
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Founders Brewing Company Founders Oatmeal Stout
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:A Founders take on a classic style, brewed with a generous amount of flaked oats, chocolate malt, roasted barley and a healthy helping of Nugget hops, Founders Oatmeal Stout is nitrogen-infused to give it an extra smooth and creamy mouthfeel. An attractive cascade effect gives this beer its forthright visual appeal—and the body and clean flavor deliver on that initial promise.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: 8 Ball Stout
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Lost Coast Brewery and Cafe 8 Ball Stout
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Our Eight Ball Stout is not for the faint of heart. It’s bold as hell and robust as can be, but it’ll reward your palate like no other stout. Roasted malts and heavy hops give it a flavor that will have you pouring another before you’re even finished with the first.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: One Oatmeal Stout
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Dark Horse Brewing Company Dark Horse One Oatmeal Stout Ale
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Number one in a series of five stouts produced to help ease you through the cold and grey Midwestern winters. This beer is full bodied with hints of chocolate, roasted barley, coffee flavors and a nice creamy head.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Dragonstooth Stout
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Elysian Brewing Company Dragon's Tooth Oatmeal Stout
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Rich, Complex, Full-bodied.Style: Imperial Oatmeal Stout.Tasting Notes: Pours a deep, midnight black with a light tan head. Smells of coffee and dark chocolate and the mouthfeel is velvety smooth with flavors of roasted malts, oatmeal and warm bread. Dragonstooth is a very drinkable stout-satisfying but not heavy.Malts: Pale, Munich, C-77, Chocolate, Roasted Barley and Rolled Oats.Hops: Bittered with Magnum, finished with Cascade and Centennial.Body: Substantial.IBU: 56\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Ipswich Oatmeal Stout
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Ipswich Ale Brewery Ipswich Oatmeal Stout
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Deep, rich and malty with hints of chocolate and coffee. It's what espresso would be if it had the gumption to be beer. We use two different hop additions, specially selected crystal malts, roasted barley and oatmeal to give it a soft and silky mouth feel. Makes a great dessert or meal.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Trader Joe's Stockyard Oatmeal Stout
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Trader Joe's Brewing Company Trader Joe's Stockyard Oatmeal Stout

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Oatis
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Ninkasi Brewing Company Oatis
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Ninkasi website:"7.5% alc/vol. 45 ibus. Always available on draft."Recent bottles spotted with "7.2% alc/vol." listed\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Earl Coffee Oatmeal Stout
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Hill Farmstead Brewery Earl Oatmeal Coffee Stout
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Earl (1911-1985) was our grandfather’s brother; Hill Farmstead Brewery rests upon the land that was once home to him and his 13 siblings. In his honor, this Stout is crafted from American malted barley, Flaked Oats, English roasted malts, American hops, Organic Guatemalan Coffee, our ale yeast, and water from our well. It is unfiltered and naturally carbonated. A silhouette of coffee and malt - an embodiment of complexity and drinkability, this is the ale that I dream to have shared with Earl. Pale, Caramel, and Chocolate Malt, Roasted Barley, Columbus hops; Ale Yeast, and our Well Water.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Vanilla Oatis
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Ninkasi Brewing Company Vanilla Oatis
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:A delicious oatmeal stout with just enough hops to balance the copious quantities of dark roasted malts, oatmeal for a creamy smooth drinkability, and whole vanilla beans for a rich complexity. To achieve this higher level of decadence, we added in whole vanilla beans to the final stage of fermentation - the same process we use to dry hop a beer.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Beer Geek Bacon
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Mikkeller ApS Beer Geek Bacon
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:A smoked version of the Beer Geek Breakfast.Brewed at Nøgne Ø.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Oatmeal Stout
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Goose Island Beer Co. Oatmeal Stout

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Buffalo Bill's Blueberry Oatmeal Stout
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Buffalo Bill's Brewery Buffalo Bill's Blueberry Oatmeal Stout
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Oatmeal stout brewed with blueberries with natural flavor added.At 7.5% alcohol, this award-winning brew is a true winter warmer. Blueberry Oatmeal Stout has hints of chocolate, oatmeal and fresh blueberries. A wonderful pairing of flavors! Great for the holidays and for those who enjoy discovering new beers.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Obovoid
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Boulder Beer / Wilderness Pub Bourbon Barrel Obovoid

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Convict Hill Oatmeal Stout
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Independence Brewing Co. Convict Hill Oatmeal Stout

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Ohio City Oatmeal Stout
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Great Lakes Brewing Company Great Lakes Ohio City Oatmeal Stout

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Coffee Oatmeal Stout
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Good People Brewing Company Coffee Oatmeal Stout
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Big coffee flavors dominate early only to be wiped out by an enormous about of Willamette hop flavors. One of GPBC’s most requested beers. Complex and full of flavor yet amazingly sessionable. Brewed with coffee from Octane Coffee Roasters here in Birmingham, AL.54 IBU\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Stout
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Alaskan Brewing Co. Alaskan Stout
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:The unique blend of the oats and malts in Alaskan Stout produce a balanced, smooth beer with hints of coffee and caramel.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Oatmeal Stout
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Summit Brewing Company Summit Oatmeal Stout

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Overcast Espresso Stout
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Oakshire Brewing Overcast Espresso Stout
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Overcast skies inspired a dark and smooth oatmeal stout blended with cold brewed coffee, offering a full palate of roasted malts, chocolate and espresso.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Dark Star
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Fremont Brewing Company Dark Star Oatmeal Stout
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Dark Star is inspired by the wandering tribes scattered through the terrible journey of time and space and adrift in the dark matter between the spaces of then and now. Dark Star is a dark, mysterious yet silky oatmeal stout of grand proportions balanced by a firm hop handshake … go ahead, enjoy the journey … Because Beer Journeys Matter!Down & Dirty: 2-Row Pale, Roast Barley, C-60, Carafa 2, and Chocolate malts with Flaked Oats and Magnum and Willamette hops.IBU: 50Color: BlackAroma: Dark chocolate, caramel, coffeeFlavor: Espresso, cocoa, roastyAvailability: January 1 – February 29\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Down 'N Dirty Chocolate Oatmeal Stout
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Tyranena Brewing Company Down 'N Dirty Chocolate Oatmeal Stout
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Oatmeal Stout brewed with cocoa nibs. Available: February-March.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Old Rasputin
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: North Coast Brewing Co. Old Rasputin XI
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Produced in the tradition of 18th Century English brewers who supplied the court of Russia’s Catherine the Great, Old Rasputin seems to develop a cult following wherever it goes. It’s a rich, intense brew with big complex flavors and a warming finish.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Parabola
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Firestone Walker Brewing Co. Parabola
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:This Russian imperial oatmeal stout is aged for a full year in a blend of bourbon barrels from Elijah Craig, Four Roses, Pappy Van Winkle, Woodford Reserve, and Bu?alo Trace.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Black Chocolate Stout
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Brooklyn Brewery Brooklyn Black Chocolate Stout
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:This is the famous Brooklyn Black Chocolate Stout. In the 18th century, Catherine the Great, Empress of Russia, ordered a stout to be sent to her from England. This beer was brewed strong and hoppy to survive the sea voyage, and it arrived in perfect condition. Soon "Russian Imperial Stout" became the toast of the Russian aristocracy. Brewed since 1994, our Black Chocolate Stout has itself become a modern classic, heralded the world over. It achieves its dark chocolate aroma and flavor through the artful blending of six malts and three distinct mashes. Properly kept, it will improve in the bottle for many years. This stout is the toast of the winter season in many countries, and there is nothing better to enjoy with chocolate desserts, cheesecake, ice cream, fine cheeses and roaring fireplaces.Given this beer’s higher ABV and sturdy character, we think it’s a prime candidate for cellaring. Find a cool, dry spot away from light sources, and see how it changes in the years to come. You never quite know what will happen when you age a beer: perhaps the body will smooth out, notes of vanilla, oak, and tannins will come to the front, or hints of leather and soy sauce will make themselves known. No matter what, remember that beer is meant for drinking, so don’t keep it to yourself for too long.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Narwhal Imperial Stout
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Sierra Nevada Brewing Co. Sierra Nevada Imperial Stout
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:A malt-forward monster, highlighting the depths of malt flavor.Narwhal Imperial Stout is inspired by the mysterious creature that thrives in the deepest fathoms of the frigid Arctic Ocean. Featuring incredible depth of malt flavor, rich with notes of espresso, baker’s cocoa, roasted grain and a light hint of smoke, Narwhal is a massive malt-forward monster. Aggressive but refined with a velvety smooth body and decadent finish, Narwhal will age in the bottle for years to come.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Dark Lord Imperial Stout
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Three Floyds Brewing Co. & Brewpub Dark Lord Imperial Stout
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:A demonic Russian-Style Imperial Stout brewed with coffee, Mexican vanilla, and Indian sugar, this beer defies description. Available one day a year, in April at the brewery: Dark Lord Day.Vintage guide:Red wax = 2004Orange wax = 2005Gold wax = 2006Silver wax = 2007Black wax = 2008White wax = 2009Green wax = 2010 - 15% ABVYellow wax = 2011 - 15% ABVRed wax = 2012 - 15% ABVOrange wax = 2013 - New Label 15% ABVBlue wax = 2014 - 15% ABVMaroon wax = 2015 15% ABVBlack with glitter flecks wax = 2016Green with silver glitter = 2017 - New LabelSilver wax = 2018Magenta with glitter = 2019\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Darkness
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Surly Brewing Company Darkness
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:This listing is ONLY for Darkness that is NOT barrel-aged, which excludes all of the 2014 bottles, all of which were aged in whiskey barrels. 2014 has a separate entry (http://www.beeradvocate.com/beer/profile/13014/141724/). Any subsequent years that have barrel aged variants, indicated by gold wax and lettering, also have their own separate entries.This massive Russian Imperial Stout brings waves of flavors; chocolate, cherries, raisins, coffee, and toffee. We add a touch of hops to make this delicious brew even tastier.85 IBUMALT: 2-Row, Golden Promise, Aromatic, Chocolate, Black, Special B, Roasted Barley, Oats, Brewers Crystals, DME 50/60.HOPS: Warrior, Amarillo, Simcoe.Labels:2007 - Grim Reaper2008 - Devil2009 - Mummy2010 - Vampire2011 - Zombie2012 - Werewolf2013 - Brewcifer2014 - Harpy2015 - Bat2016 - Cerberus2017 - Forest Witch2018 - Minotaur2019 - Tree Monster\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Plead The 5th Imperial Stout
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Dark Horse Brewing Company Plead The 5th Imperial Stout
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:2010 and pre: white label2011: white label OR black label with black no logo cap2012: black label with logo cap2013: black label with logo cap, ABV of 11% in the top right corner and new government warning2014 - white label with black logo cap, ABV of 11% in the top right corner, government warning on bottom right side of label\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Imperial StoutSamuel Smith Old Brewery (Tadcaster)
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Samuel Smith Old Brewery (Tadcaster) Samuel Smith's Imperial Stout

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Blackout Stout
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Great Lakes Brewing Company Great Lakes Blackout Stout
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Turn off the lights and turn on the flavor, because Blackout Stout is back and as dark as ever. Inspired by the infamous 2003 blackout that briefly left some 55 million people without power, the bold flavors of our Imperial Stout will light up even the darkest nights. Black malt and roasted barley cast notes of chocolate, dark fruit, and coffee, while earthy hops put the lights out on this shadowy brew with a pleasantly bitter finish.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Bourbon Barrel Aged Plead The 5th
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Dark Horse Brewing Company Dark Horse Bourbon Barrel Aged Plead The 5th
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:This beer is a big and full bodied Imperial Stout aged in bourbon barrels with lots of roasted malts, but very balanced with heavy hops. Brewed with a top secret root, this beer has an amazingly complex flavor that you must wait for.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Marshal Zhukov's Imperial Stout
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Cigar City Brewing Marshal Zhukov's Imperial Stout
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:This Russian Imperial Stout is dedicated to Georgy Zhukov, arguably one of the finest generals of World War II. Opaque black in color, with notes of espresso, chocolate, dark toffee and hints of backstrap molasses. The English hop varietals provide a subtle herbal dryness, and finishes with a hearty slap of roasty espresso. Pair Marshal Zhukov’s with Mushroom Solyanka, dark chocolate, cherries and ground wars in Russia.We brew and release Zhukov's in the summer knowing that a beer of this heft reaches its full potential a few months after release. So save a bottle for the cold winter!80 IBU\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: B.O.R.I.S. The Crusher
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Hoppin' Frog Brewery B.O.R.I.S. The Crusher Oatmeal-Imperial Stout
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:This Bodacious Oatmeal Russian Imperial Stout will crush you like no other! This is the grand-daddy of all stout styles, with an intensely deep roasted and full bodied flavor. A robust hop character adds a refreshing balance.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Black OPS
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Brooklyn Brewery Brooklyn Black OPS
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Brooklyn Black Ops (2008 commercially available version) was aged for four months in bourbon barrels, bottled flat, and re-fermented in the bottle with Champagne yeast. 940 cases produced.10.7%-200811.6%-200911.3%-201010.7%-201110.5%-201211.5%-201311.6%-2014\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Imperial Stout
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Lagunitas Brewing Company Black Rain Imperial Stout
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Having downed his fourth Imperial Stout of the day, the wild eyed charlatan from Voldvrostronglaky belched and hollered for the Czarina to enter his chamber and bend herself to his will. The economy was a wreck and revolt was just around the corner. Nicky the Czar dude was off playing soldier like any pale nobleman with a hemorrhagic skin condition would. Such were the final days of the old empire. Reactionary, decadent, sputnik, stroganoff, weird, and drunk. But even as the proletariat countryside labored under inhuman conditions and the threat of being sent to a futile war in the east, they wisely took the time to slam back an Imperial Stout or two. After all, life can be a real 'suka' as they said in the old country. Big, black, bourgeois, Bolshoi, belligerent, buxom, and scary. This is our version of the end of an era in a bottle.2010 8.2% abv\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Siberian Night Imperial Stout
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Thirsty Dog Brewing Company Siberian Night Imperial Stout

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Blackout Stout - Barrel-Aged
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Great Lakes Brewing Company Great Lakes Barrel-Aged Blackout Stout

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Black Albert
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: De Struise Brouwers Black Albert
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Originally brewed exclusively for Ebenezer's Pub in Lovell, ME.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Blaecorn Unidragon
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Clown Shoes Blaecorn Unidragon
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Brewed with a monstrous amount of malt and combined with aggressive American hops, this beer is powerful and complex and designed to age. Smokiness is subtle but present and blends nicely with the rich, dark flavors.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Samuel Adams Imperial StoutBoston Beer Company (Samuel Adams)
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Boston Beer Company (Samuel Adams) Samuel Adams Imperial Stout
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Imperial in stature and bigger than your average stout. This colossal stout was inspired by those created by 18th century English brewers for the Russian Imperial Court of Catherine II. The special malts in this intense and massive brew delivers rich flavors of dark chocolate, coffee, and anise.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Peg Leg Imperial Stout
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Heavy Seas Beer Heavy Seas - Peg Leg (Imperial Stout)
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Deep mahogany in color with aromas of roasted coffee, molasses and dark chocolate. Subtly hopped, making it astonishingly smooth and easy drinking for such a big beer.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Sexual Chocolate
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Foothills Brewing Company Sexual Chocolate

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: D.O.R.I.S. The Destroyer
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Hoppin' Frog Brewery D.O.R.I.S. The Destroyer Double Imperial Stout

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Imperial Stout Trooper
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: New England Brewing Co. Imperial Stout Trooper
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:2006 - 12oz bottle2007 - not released 2008 - 12oz bottle 2009 - 750mL bottle 2010 - 750mL bottle and Groucho glasses label change2011 - bottle date added to label 2012 - 500mL bottle2013 - 500mL bottle labeled 12/20132014 - 500mL bottle2015 - 12oz can\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Imperial Stout
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Rogue Ales Imperial Stout
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Also known as XS Imperial Stout12 Ingredients:Malts: Great Western, Harrington & Klages, Hugh Baird XLT-80, Black, Munich, Chocolate and rolled oats.Hops: Willamette, Cascade and Chinook. Specialty: Two Secret ingredients.Yeast & Water: Rogue's Pacman Yeast & Free Range Coastal Water.26º PLATO88 IBU73 AA256º Lovibond\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Sexual Chocolate - Barrel-Aged
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Foothills Brewing Company Barrel Aged Sexual Chocolate
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Barrel-aged Russian imperial stout brewed with organic cocoa nibs.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Smuttynose Imperial Stout (Big Beer Series)
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Smuttynose Brewing Company Smuttynose Imperial Stout (Big Beer Series)

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Bourbon Barrel Aged Siberian Night Imperial Stout
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Thirsty Dog Brewing Company Bourbon Barrel Aged Siberian Night
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:We took our award winning Siberian Night Russian Imperial Stout and aged it for 11 months in fresh bourbon barrels. The result blew us away. The dark chocolate malt yields a milk chocolate flavor that blends perfectly with the vanilla flavor from the barrel. The bourbon aroma adds the finishing touch.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Dark Apparition
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Jackie O's Pub & Brewery Dark Apparition
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Russian Imperial Stouts are one of brewmaster Brad Clark’s favorite styles of beer and Dark Apparition is without a doubt his favorite beer to brew. We stuff 2200 pounds of malt into our 20bbl mash tun and by the end of the mash, dark malts are spilling onto the brew house floor! Brad includes great flavors he admires in his favorite Russian Imperial Stouts like chocolate, coffee, roast, dark fruit, caramel, and some nice earthy/spicy hop character. With a midnight black color and chewy, dextrinous body, Dark Apparition is a huge beer with tons of character.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Wake Up Dead
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Left Hand Brewing Company Wake Up Dead

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Northwind
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Two Brothers Brewing Company Northwind Imperial Stout
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Dark delights like this were once shipped to the imperial court of Russia. With a firm, roasty maltiness balanced against a generous helping of hops, Northwind can stand up to the worst its namesake can dish out! Enjoy it by a roaring fire.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: BBADL (Bourbon Barrel Aged Dark Lord Imperial Stout)
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Three Floyds Brewing Co. & Brewpub Oak Aged Dark Lord Imperial Stout
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Dark Lord aged in bourbon barrels for one year. Recently has used a blend of barrels from Heaven Hill, but has also been Woodford Reserve and others in the pastFormerly known as Oak Aged Dark Lord.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Black Metal Farmhouse Imperial Stout
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Jester King Craft Brewery Black Metal Imperial Stout
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:First batch of Black Metal fermented with our house mixed culture. Naturally, because of its unique fermentation with native microorganisms, the beer is different than previous versions. We’re quite happy with how it turned out, and we’re excited to release it. However, for fans of the original Black Metal, or “O.G. Black Metal” as its known, we feel as though we need to borrow the famous line from Stone Brewing Co.‘s Arrogant Bastard Ale: “You probably won’t like it.” Like all our beer, the flavors and aromas of the current batch of Black Metal are very much fermentation derived and rely far less on copious amounts of malt and hops. This is what we like to drink. We like dry, balanced, drinkable, tart beers with some interesting yeast complexity. We feel we’ve achieved this with Black Metal, and hope others enjoy it as well. There will be those that don’t, however, and wish we’d return to the days of fermenting this beer with English ale yeast, and that’s OK.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Imperial Stout
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Brewery: Nøgne Ø - Det Kompromissløse Bryggeri A/S
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Nøgne Ø - Det Kompromissløse Bryggeri A/S Imperial Stout
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:23°P,75 IBU.Ingredients: Maris Otter, Munich, roasted barley, oat, black, and chocolate malt; Columbus and Crystal hops; English ale yeast, and our local Grimstad water.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Rabid Duck
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: The Duck-Rabbit Craft Brewery Duck-Rabbit Rabid Duck
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:The Duck-Rabbit's Imperial Stout is extremely big and robust. This special beer is thick, jet black and oily in texture. Complex flavors of roast malts dominate: bitter chocolate and espresso coffee especially. There is also a very big hop presence both for bittering and for aroma. At 10% alcohol by volume, this brew is made to be sipped and savored!\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Ivan The Terrible Imperial Stout - Barrel-Aged
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Big Sky Brewing Company Ivan The Terrible
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:2006 - 8.75% (draft only)2007 - 8.75% (500ml flip top bottles ~ very limited)2008 - 9.5% (750ml - capped - 1152 bottles)2009 - 10% (750ml cork and cage)2010 - 10% (750ml - cork and cage)2011 - not brewed2012 - 12.2% (750ml cork and cage)2013 - 13.8%2014 - 11.5% (750ml cork and cage)2015 - 11.9% (750ml cork and cage - 3000 bottles)2017 - 11.6%Imperial stout aged 4 months in freshly dumped American oak Buffalo Trace bourbon barrels.65 IBU\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Milk Stout
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Left Hand Brewing Company Left Hand Milk Stout
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:ROASTED MALT AND COFFEE FLAVORS BUILD THE FOUNDATION OF THIS CREAMY SWEET STOUT.Milk sugar in your stout is like cream in your coffee. Dark and delicious, America’s great milk stout will change your perception about what a stout can be. “Preconceived notions are the blinders on the road to enlightenment.” Udderly delightful.Collection: PerennialStyle: Sweet StoutColor: Black, 47 SRMBody: fullABV: 6%IBU's: 25PLATO: 15.5°PKG: 6-Pack, KegMalt: Pale 2-row, Crystal, Munich, Roasted Barley, Flaked Oats, Flaked Barley and ChocolateHops: Magnum and US GoldingsOther: Lactose\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Samuel Adams Cream StoutBoston Beer Company (Samuel Adams)
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Boston Beer Company (Samuel Adams) Samuel Adams Cream Stout

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Moo-Hoo Chocolate Milk Stout
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Terrapin Beer Company Terrapin Moo-Hoo Chocolate Milk Stout

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: 2XSTOUT
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Southern Tier Brewing Company 2X Stout

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Milk Stout
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: The Duck-Rabbit Craft Brewery Duck-Rabbit Milk Stout
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:The Duck-Rabbit Milk Stout is a traditional full-bodied stout brewed with lactose (milk sugar). Because lactose is unfermentable by brewer's yeast, it remains in the beer. The subtle sweetness and fullness of flavor imparted by this sugar balances the sharpness of the highly roasted grains that give this delicious beer its black color. All year long, Milk Stout is our number one selling beer!\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Moloko
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Three Floyds Brewing Co. & Brewpub Moloko
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:8.0% ABV, 30 IBUs - This Milk Stout is brewed with a portion of golden naked oats and lactose milk sugar to give it a rounded and full-bodied mouth feel. With a deep roasted and slightly sweet maltiness. August release.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Gingerbread Stout
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Hardywood Park Craft Brewery Gingerbread Stout
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Brewed with baby ginger from Casselmonte Farm and wildflower honey from Bearer Farms, Hardywood Gingerbread Stout captures the terroir of central Virginia in a rich, creamy libation with a velvety mouthfeel and an intriguing evolution of flavors from milk chocolate and vanilla to honeycomb and cinnamon to a snap of ginger in the finish.Deep, dark chocolate in color with a mahogany tint and a frothy, caramel colored head, Hardywood Gingerbread Stout offers aromatics of holiday spice originating from the ginger, and balanced with a generous dose of whole Madagascar bourbon vanilla beans and Vietnamese cinnamon. Milk sugar (lactose) contributes to the full body of this stout and tames its roasty character, while oats lend a silky quality. Enjoy fresh, or cellar for a special occasion. We hope Hardywood Gingerbread Stout contributes to your merriment this season.55 IBU\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Milk Stout
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Lancaster Brewing Company Milk Stout
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Brewed in Lancaster since 1994, we’re proud to present America’s original craft Milk Stout. Notes of milk chocolate, coffee and roasted malt goodness play counterpoint to a mild sweetness from the addition of milk sugar… You can’t go wrong with award winning Lancaster Milk Stout.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Too Cream Stout
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Dark Horse Brewing Company Dark Horse Too Cream Stout
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:This beer is made with milk sugar (lactose) which gives this beer a nice creamy mouth feel which mingles with hints of chocolate and roasty flavors.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Cream Stout
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: St. Peter's Brewery Co Ltd St. Peter's Cream Stout
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:'Fuggles' and 'Challenger' hops plus a blend of 4 local barley malts create an aromatic, robust, dark chocolate cream stout with a satisfying bittersweet aftertaste. Brewed with skill and patience in one of Britain's finest small breweries.St. Peter's Brewery is located in a medieval hall in a remote and beautiful corner of Suffolk. There our beers begin their lives deep below the brewery with water drawn from a pure source - as it has been for over 700 years, essential for the full flavour and pure character of all St. Peter's beers.Our beautiful flask-shaped oval bottle is a faithful copy of one produced c. 1770 for Thomas Gerrard of Gibbstown, just across the Delaware River from Philadelphia. The original is now kept at St. Peters Hall and is a rare example of an oval Eighteenth Century beer bottle.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Neapolitan Milk Stout
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Saugatuck Brewing Company Neapolitan Milk Stout
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:A creamy Milk Stout with all the brilliant flavors of Neapolitan Ice Cream in one glass. Taste the rich flavors of chocolate, vanilla and strawberry in this unique beer.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: 72 Imperial Chocolate Cream Stout
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Breckenridge Brewery 72 Imperial Chocolate Cream Stout
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Just sit back and enjoy the ride.Like its namesake automobile, this small batch beer is meticulously engineered for luxury and enjoyment. We start with a great, hearty stout recipe and add loads of dark chocolate – 200 pounds per 100-barrel brew. This Imperial Chocolate Cream Stout is the color of molasses and is full of rich, toasted cocoa notes with hints of dark fruit. 72 Imperial will delight the taste buds.11 IBU\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Moo Thunder Stout Farmhouse Ale
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Butternuts Beer & Ale Moo Thunder Stout

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Mother's Milk Stout
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Keegan Ales Mothers Milk Stout
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:As the name implies, Mother’s Milk is a dark and creamy milk stout. Hints of oatmeal, chocolate and of course, milk make this brew have a remarkably smooth and silky finish, a classic example of the style.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Mackeson Triple XXX Stout
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Whitbread PLC Mackeson Triple XXX Stout
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:XXX version is for the export market.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Oatmeal Milk Stout
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: River Horse Brewing Co. Oatmeal Milk Stout Ale Redux
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:A velvety smooth Stout brewed with oats and milk sugar that create a creamy finish over a dark malt base.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Moo Joos
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Brau Brothers Brewing Co. LLC Moo Joos
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Oatmeal Milk Stout.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Brown Shugga'
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Lagunitas Brewing Company Brown Shugga'
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:IBU 51.1\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Undercover Investigation Shut-down Ale
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Lagunitas Brewing Company Undercover Investigation Shut-down Ale
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Our malty and rich beer with a snappy hop finish truly defies style…Imperial Mild?...Uber ESB?... We do know for sure that it is Unforgiven and Unrepentant.In remembrance of the 2005 St. Patrick's Day massacre and in commemoration of the 20-day suspension that followed, Lagunitas brewed this especially bitter ale. See, the ABC conducted an undercover investigation of our brewery, finding us guilty of operating a “Disorderly House.” We did the crime. We did the time. We got the bragging rights.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: The Hairy Eyeball
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Lagunitas Brewing Company Hairy Eyeball Ale

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Samuel Adams UtopiasBoston Beer Company (Samuel Adams)
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Boston Beer Company (Samuel Adams) Samuel Adams Utopias
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Truly the epitome of brewing's two thousand year evolution, Samuel Adams Utopias® offers a flavor not just unlike any other beer but unlike any other beverage in the world. Each release is a blend of batches, some having been aged up to 16 years in the barrel room of our Boston Brewery, in a variety of woods. We aged a portion of the beer in hand-selected, single-use bourbon casks from the award-winning Buffalo Trace Distillery. Some of the latest batches also spent time in Portuguese muscatel finishing casks, as well as sherry, brandy and Cognac casks. This flavorful, slightly fruity brew has a sweet, malty flavor that is reminiscent of a deep, rich vintage port, fine cognac or aged sherry.2019 Vintage aged in Buffalo Trace barrels and finished in Aquavit, Caracavelos, Ruby Port, Cognac, and Medeira Barrels.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Mélange No. 3
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: The Bruery Melange No. 3
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:A blend of Black Tuesday, anniversary ale, and White Oak Sap.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Deliverance
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: The Lost Abbey Deliverance
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Cue the banjos...A blend of Bourbon Barrel Aged Imperial Stout and Brandy Barrel Aged Barleywine. One of our highest and most sought after non sour aged releases.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: The Angel's Share - Bourbon Barrel-Aged
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: The Lost Abbey The Angel's Share - Bourbon Barrel-Aged
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Down in Kentucky and across the pond in Scotland, distillers who age their whiskeys for many years refer to the evaporation of the spirits from their barrels as “The Angel’s Share.” We couldn’t agree more. Each time a barrel is filled, a measure of liquid seeps into the oak and is lost for good.This striking Strong Ale is brewed with copious amounts of Caramel malt to emphasize the vanilla and oak flavors found in freshly emptied bourbon or brandy barrels. The beer spends a year in oak before it is packaged for release.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Fred
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Brewery: Hair of the Dog Brewing Company / Brewery and Tasting Room
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Hair of the Dog Brewing Company / Brewery and Tasting Room Fred
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Fred was created to honor beer writer and historian Fred Eckhardt. It is made with aromatic and rye malts and includes 10 different hop varieties. 10% alcohol by volume65 IBUs.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Life and Limb
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Sierra Nevada Brewing Co. Life & Limb
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Brewed in collaboration with Dogfish Head Craft Brewery.Eight years after it was last seen, a blast from Sierra Nevada Brewing Co.’s past is set to return.That creation is Life and Limb 2019, a 10.2 percent ABV strong ale brewed with birch and maple syrup that is a collaboration between Sierra Nevada’s founder Ken Grossman and brewer Brian Grossman and Dogfish Head Brewery’s founder and president Sam Calagione and vice president Mariah Calagione. This will be the third time that the ale has been released after it debuted in 2009 and it was rereleased in 2011.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: B-Bomb (Bourbon Abominable Winter Ale)
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Fremont Brewing Company Bourbon Barrel Abominable
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Lovingly referred to by Fremonters as the B-BOMB, this bourbon barrel-aged edition of our winter ale has a warming spicy aroma and rich carmelly notes of bourbon, wood and vanilla added to dark roasty chocolatey malt flavors and subtle hopping.Down & Dirty: 2-Row, Crystal-120, Munich, Roast Barley, Carafa-2 & Chocolate malts with Columbus, Willamette & US Goldings hops.Aged in 15 year-old American oak whiskey barrels. Blend of 24 and 12 month-old bourbon aged Abominable Ale.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Double Dead Guy Ale
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Rogue Ales Double Dead Guy Ale
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:7 Ingredients:Malts: 2-Row, Munich and C15.Hops: Cascade.Yeast & Water: Rogue's Pacman Yeast and Free Range Coastal Water.20º PLATO60 IBU78 AA25º Lovibond\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Chocolate Ale
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Boulevard Brewing Co. Chocolate Ale
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:One of the brightest stars in a city filled with culinary treasures, Christopher Elbow has been handcrafting masterpieces in chocolate for more than ten years. In that time the reputation of his artistic delicacies has spread around the globe. Elbow’s sweets are distinguished by their use of unusual and sometimes surprising flavors and ingredients; in that adventurous spirit we joined forces to bring you a very special Chocolate Ale.In developing this beer, Elbow and Boulevard brewmaster Steven Pauwels sought to harmonize the interplay of chocolate and malt, with each supporting and enhancing, but not overwhelming, the other. Just the right chocolate was essential. Elbow recommended a rare variety from the Dominican Republic, prized for its robust flavor and aroma, and a personal favorite. More than a mere flavoring, the chocolate — in the form of nibs, or crushed, roasted beans – was incorporated into the brewing process itself.24 IBU\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Eye of the Hawk
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Mendocino Brewing Company Eye of the Hawk

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Matt
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Brewery: Hair of the Dog Brewing Company / Brewery and Tasting Room
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Hair of the Dog Brewing Company / Brewery and Tasting Room Matt
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Brewed using two Munich malts, two Smoked malts and two types of Belgian candy sugar. It was aged in 33 year old Bourbon barrels and Apple Eau de Vie barrels for about one year.First release: February 2009 (a.k.a. 'Bottleworks X')Second release: November 2010Third release: October 2013\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: The Angel's Share - Brandy Barrel-Aged
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: The Lost Abbey The Angel's Share - Brandy Barrel-Aged
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Down in Kentucky and across the pond in Scotland, distillers who age their whiskeys for many years refer to the evaporation of the spirits from their barrels as “The Angel’s Share.” We couldn’t agree more. Each time a barrel is filled, a measure of liquid seeps into the oak and is lost for good.This striking Strong Ale is brewed with copious amounts of Caramel malt to emphasize the vanilla and oak flavors found in freshly emptied bourbon or brandy barrels. The beer spends a year in oak before it is packaged for release.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Ale To The Chief
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Avery Brewing Company Ale To The Chief
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Originally brewed to celebrate Inauguration Day, January 20, 2009, we elected to give Ale to the Chief a second term to commemorate the 2012 election!? ?Not an “Imperial” pale ale, this is a democracy. It’s Presidential! Take the all-American pale ale, a bipartisan blend of malt and hops, increase both to Avery Brewing standards, and then, of c??ourse, dry hop the result with that most quintessential of American hops, Cascades, and you get this…a brew worthy of the Oval Office!\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Fred From The Wood
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Brewery: Hair of the Dog Brewing Company / Brewery and Tasting Room
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Hair of the Dog Brewing Company / Brewery and Tasting Room Fred From The Wood
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Aged in new, medium toast American oak barrels for at least 6 months\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Bell Ringer
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: RJ Rockers Brewing Company Bell Ringer
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Our high gravity offering weighs in at 8.5% ABV and is delightfully loaded with malt and hops. This is an ale worthy of your sturdiest goblet or most treasured stein. Ring it!\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Bourbon Fred From The Wood
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Brewery: Hair of the Dog Brewing Company / Brewery and Tasting Room
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Hair of the Dog Brewing Company / Brewery and Tasting Room Bourbon Fred From The Wood
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Bottles (12 oz) released November 2011Batch 2 bottles (12oz) released July 2012.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Maple Tripple Ale
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Lawson's Finest Liquids Maple Tripple Ale
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Enticing, rich and complex, this creation defies easy description. Our 'once-a-year beer' is brewed only during sugaring season with 100% maple sap from our friend Paul Marble in Fayston, VT. No water added! Just barley, hops, and ale yeast.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Wailing Wench
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Middle Ages Brewing Co., Ltd. Wailing Wench

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Quilter's Irish Death
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Iron Horse Brewery Quilter's Irish Death

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Triple Bag
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Long Trail Brewing Co. Triple Bag
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Triple Bag is brewed in a small batch from single infusion that uses only the first runnings of the mash. The result is a brew made from only the purest part of the grains, providing a uniquely rich and dense flavor, with an aroma reminiscent of the finest dessert wines. This brew is naturally carbonated and is an example of brewing purity that is rarely experienced by those other than brewers themselves.53 IBU\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: He'Brew Origin Pomegranate Ale
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Shmaltz Brewing Company He'Brew Origin Pomegranate Ale
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Celebrating our second decade of brewing, ShmaltzBrewing presents ORIGIN Pomegranate Ale. Arenewal of our original HE'BREW Beer covenant,brewed once again after 10 years with the juiceof over 10,000 luscious Pomegranates. ORIGIN is acomplex, rich and balanced Imperial Amber Alewith a truly unique character. The onlyPomegranate Strong Ale in the country!\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: John Henry 3 Lick Spiker Ale
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Cold Spring Brewing Co. John Henry 3 Lick Spiker Ale
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Three Lick Spiker Ale is brewed with three different roasted malts creating chocolate flavors and full body taste. After fermentation has been completed with our top fermenting ale yeast we infuse our brew with bourbon oak aged chips and let the extended aging process take over. Hints of bourbon and vanilla from the oak come through the aroma and flavor.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Barmy
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Ballast Point Brewing Company Barmy Ale
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Made with 2-row malt, Galena hops, house yeast, apricots and carmelized honey. On old sailing ships, barm was the foam on top of fermenting fruit and Barmy was the adjective used to describe it.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Boatswain H.L.V. Ale (Heavy Lift Vessel)
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Minhas Craft Brewery Boatswain H.L.V. Ale (Heavy Lift Vessel)

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Raspberry Strong Ale
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Berkshire Brewing Company Inc. Raspberry Strong Ale

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Pray For Snow
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: 10 Barrel Brewing Co. Pray For Snow

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Colossus
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: DuClaw Brewing Company Colossus
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Brewed to push the limits of our own skills and imagination, Colossus is dark amber in color and full-bodied with a perceptively sweet flavor profile accented by notes of apple, and a surprisingly tame alcohol presence. This astounding alcohol content is achieved through fermentation alone; no alcohol is introduced at packaging nor it distilled. Multiple grains are used in conjunction with three different yeast strains to produce a beer that simply defies classification… and most laws of nature. One sip of this behemoth brew and you’ll agree: Sometimes size does matter!2006 Batch - 20.0% ABV2011 Batch - 21.92% ABV2014 Batch - 17.3% ABV2015 Batch - 21.0% ABV2018 Batch - 20.0% ABV\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: BART
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: FiftyFifty Brewing Co. BART
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Ale brewed with honey.Barrel Aged Really Tasty. it's pretty simple actually - a delicious blend of our Imperial Honey Stout and Barleywine Ale, aged to perfection in oak bourbon barrels. Delightful aromas of caramel, vanilla and dark fruits, followed by brown sugar, dark molasses, espresso and chocolate on the palette. The complexity evolves as BART warms up, and it's the perfect beer to sip with a friend and celebrate all that is good in the world.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Super Kitty
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Keegan Ales Super Kitty
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Brewed using the excess from their Hurricane Kitty recipe, this beer is combined with 1000 pounds of local Hudson Valley honey, oak chips, and several additions of hops during the 6 month conditioning period.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Grande Réserve (Blue)
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Bières de Chimay S.A. Chimay Grande Réserve (Blue)
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Originally brewed as a Christmas beer in 1948, this dark ale has rich flavors of mulling spices and caramel, with a smooth palate and warming finish.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Trappistes Rochefort 8
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Brasserie de Rochefort Trappistes Rochefort 8

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Trois Pistoles
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Unibroue Trois Pistoles
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Drawing on Quebec folklore, Unibroue chose the name Trois Pistoles to honour the city’s historic importance and pay homage to the legend of the Black Horse. Conjured up by a priest to help build a new church, this incarnation of the devil ran off when its bridle was removed. Because construction was still underway when the horse vanished, a stone remains missing from the church to this day.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Raison D'Être
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Dogfish Head Brewery Raison D'etre
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:A deep mahogany, Belgian-style brown ale brewed with beet sugar, raisins and Belgian-style yeast.We began brewing this one at our pub in 1996 (we began packaging and selling it sometime in 1998) as the answer to the question, "What beer should I enjoy with a wood-grilled steak?" Raison D'Etre fits the bill. It's as tasty and complex as a fine red wine.In the Quick Sip Clip video, Sam talks about Raison D'Etre inside the new cellars for our 600-bbl fermentation tanks. The cellars were designed specifically to allow sterile yeast management. The system also allows us to automatically dose the yeast into the fermentation tanks. At Dogfish, we use multiple strains of yeast for our different beers, so we are acutely aware of all that can go wrong when you don't love and protect the yeast.25 IBU\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Gulden Draak
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Brouwerij Van Steenberge N.V. Gulden Draak (Dark Triple)
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Dark Triple Ale brewed with caramel malt and re-fermented with Bordeaux wine yeast\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: The Mad Elf
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Tröegs Brewing Company Tröegs Mad Elf
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Hop Bitterness (IBU's) : 15Color (SRM) : Ruby RedAvailability: Seasonal, 12 oz. & 3L bottles, 1/2 and 1/6 kegs (contact your local retailer to pre-order)Malts: Pilsner, Munich, ChocolateHops: Saaz, HallertauYeast: Spicy YeastPennsylvania Honey West Coast Cherries\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Brother Thelonious
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: North Coast Brewing Co. Brother Thelonious
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:"Vital StatisticsStyle: Belgian Style Strong DarkColor: Dark mahoganyABV: 9.4%Bitterness: 32 IBU's"\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Delirium Nocturnum
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Brouwerij Huyghe Delirium Nocturnum

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Black
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Allagash Brewing Company Allagash Black
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Allagash Black is a Belgian style stout brewed with 2 Row barley, torrified wheat, oats, both roasted and chocolate malt and a generous portion of dark caramelized candi sugar. The silky mouth feel is a great balance to the roasted character, coffee and dark chocolate notes expressed throughout this beer.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Delirium Noël (Christmas)
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Brouwerij Huyghe Delirium Noël
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Brewed only for the Christmas and New Year, Noël complete the "Delirium" trilogy. Its appearance is a superb warm copper to red color, recalling "Nocturnum" except in its taste. It hides its subtlety by multiple levels of flavor and should be approached with confidence, with a tinge typical Christmas, sauced with a sweet touch, then bitterness.20 IBU\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Collaboration Not Litigation Ale
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Avery Brewing Company Collaboration Not Litigation Ale
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Collaboration with Russian River Brewing Company\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Raison D'Extra
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Dogfish Head Brewery Raison D'extra
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Our Raison D'Etre, with a little extra. This immodest brew, made with an obscene amount of malt, brown sugar & raisins, takes Belgian-style browns to new heights.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Monk's Blood
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: 21st Amendment Brewery Monk's Blood
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Belgian Strong Dark ale brewed with cinnamon, on oak chips with figs.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Local 2
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Brooklyn Brewery Brooklyn Local 2
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Here in Brooklyn we’ve combined European malt and hops, Belgian dark sugar, and raw wildflower honey from a New York family farm to create Brooklyn Local 2. Our special Belgian yeast adds hints of spice to the dark fruit, caramel, and chocolate flavors. After 100% bottle re-fermentation, the beer reveals a marvelous dry complexity, enjoyable by itself or at the dinner table.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: N'Ice Chouffe
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Brasserie d'Achouffe N'Ice Chouffe
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:When the little animals in Fairyland hibernate, the Achouffe gnomes love to gather in their cottage. By the gentle firelight, they spend long evenings telling the best Ardennes stories while enjoying a delicious N’Ice CHOUFFE. Smooth and strong, with spicy notes of thyme and Curacao, this dark beer warms both hearts and atmospheres, making even the coldest winters joyful.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Corsendonk Christmas Ale
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Brouwerij Corsendonk Corsendonk Christmas Ale

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Salvation
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Russian River Brewing Company Salvation

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: McChouffe
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Brasserie d'Achouffe McChouffe
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Among the mythical characters living in Fairyland, some are more unusual than others. Malcolm, for example, is different because of his accent and his kilt: when it comes to beer, his favourite is Mc CHOUFFE. The delicious flavours of aniseed, liquorice and toffee tickle his taste buds. If you listen to him, he will boast of its ruby sparkle, its smooth bitterness and its strong character, worthy of his native Scotland. Although robust, Mc CHOUFFE goes down as easily as LA CHOUFFE.ABV varies from time to time.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: 17 Grande Réserve
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Unibroue 17 Grande Réserve
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:This French oak aged, bottle refermented dark ale has a remarkable and complex flavor profile. Its Grande Réserve appellation is a fitting endorsement of its exceptional aging qualities.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Oerbier
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Brouwerij De Dolle Brouwers De Dolle Oerbier

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Noel De Calabaza
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Jolly Pumpkin Artisan Ales Noel De Calabaza
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:"Belgian Christmas Ale aged in oak barrels."\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Grand Cru
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: AleSmith Brewing Company AleSmith Grand Cru Ale
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Bottle conditioned.AleSmith Grand Cru really needs to be tasted to be truly appreciated. Toasty, caramelly flavors, as well as flavors imparted by the Belgian yeast strain, predominate over a tapestry of subtle nuances. Winner of the blue ribbon at the 1999 California State Fair, it is a thing of beauty. It is available in 750 ml. champagne bottles.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: 10 Commandments
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: The Lost Abbey 10 Commandments
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:A stronger version of our Lost and Found Abbey Ale brewed to a more contemplative alcohol content. Massive in every stretch of the brewing way possible this is the sort of beer that will remind a beer drinker who considers themselves a saint that even saints stray as sinners from time to time.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Nostradamus
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Brasserie Caracole Nostradamus

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Gouden Carolus Classic
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Brouwerij Het Anker Gouden Carolus Classic

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Gouden Carolus Noël / Christmas
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Brouwerij Het Anker Gouden Carolus Noël / Christmas
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:For more than 35 years we had to miss the Christmas beer but in 2002 the tradition was restored with Gouden Carolus Christmas. It’s a strong, dark ruby red beer with character and contains an alcohol percentage of 10.5 % alc.vol. Brewed in August, the beer rests a few months to reach an optimal balance. Three kinds of hops and 6 different kinds of herbs and spices define the rich taste of this Christmas beer. Top-class!\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Abbaye Des Rocs Grand Cru Belgian Special Brown
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Brewery: Brasserie de l'Abbaye des Rocs s.a.
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Brasserie de l'Abbaye des Rocs s.a. Abbaye Des Rocs Grand Cru Belgian Special Brown

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Hitachino Nest Extra High (XH)
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Kiuchi Brewery Hitachino Nest Extra High (XH)
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:From Japan's most prestigious brewery, Hitachino Nest XH (Extra High) is a strong Belgian Brown Ale, matured in shochu (distilled sake) barrels. Chinook & Styrian Goldings hops are use\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Grand Cru
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Allagash Brewing Company Allagash Grand Cru
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Grand Cru is brewed with a touch of peated malt and spiced with coriander, sweet orange peel and a hint of anise. It is deep golden in color, full bodied and has hints of smoke and licorice in the taste and aroma. The malty, warming finish is perfect for colder weather.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Affligem Noël
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Brouwerij De Smedt / Brouwerij Affligem Affligem Noël

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Abbaye Des Rocs [Brasserie Des Rocs Brune]
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Brewery: Brasserie de l'Abbaye des Rocs s.a.
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Brasserie de l'Abbaye des Rocs s.a. Abbaye Des Rocs [Brasserie Des Rocs Brune]

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Achel Trappist Extra
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Brewery: Brouwerij der St. Benedictusabdij de Achelse
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Brouwerij der St. Benedictusabdij de Achelse Achel Trappist Extra

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Brasserie Des Rocs Triple Impériale
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Brewery: Brasserie de l'Abbaye des Rocs s.a.
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Brasserie de l'Abbaye des Rocs s.a. Brasserie Des Rocs Triple Impériale

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Brouwerij Het Anker Gouden Carolus Ambrio

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: St. Feuillien Cuvée De Noël
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Brasserie St. Feuillien St. Feuillien Cuvée De Noël

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Leute Bok
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Brouwerij Van Steenberge N.V. Leute Bok

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Moinette Brune
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Brasserie Dupont sprl Moinette Brune

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Leffe Radieuse
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Abbaye de Leffe S.A. Leffe Radieuse

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Monk's Mistress
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Midnight Sun Brewing Co. Monk's Mistress
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:The inspiration for this beer’s name—previously, La Maitresse du Moine—is the beer itself. Its deep, intense flavors inspired the concept of a monk that seeks solace and satisfaction from the sensory pleasure and mind-provoking effects of this liquid temptress.Mesmerizing Monk’s Mistress seduces your senses at first sip. Its daunting beauty and intriguing flavor fully captivate your attention. Belgian yeast adds character and complexity. We invite you to give in to this little bit of “heaven on earth”.13 IBU\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Nor' Easter Winter Warmer
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Captain Lawrence Brewing Co. Nor' Easter
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:This is a truly unique brew, combining some unusual elements to create a powerful, yet flavorful brew. I brewed a similar beer to this one back in 1998, while I was home brewing out in California. Only this time around, I decided to age it in bourbon barrels to add a new element to the already rich sensory profile. The combination of dark malt, elderberries and bourbon barrels makes for an interesting tasting experience. This is a sippin’ beer, so sit back by the fire and enjoy.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Duvel
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Brouwerij Duvel Moortgat NV Duvel
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:A Duvel is still seen as the reference among strong golden ales. Its bouquet is lively and tickles the nose with an element of citrus which even tends towards grapefruit thanks to the use of only the highest-quality hop varieties. This is also reflected in the flavour, which is beautifully balanced with a hint of spiciness. Thanks to its high CO2 content, this beer has a wonderful roundness in the mouth. A Duvel is both the perfect thirst quencher and the ideal aperitif.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Delirium Tremens
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Brouwerij Huyghe Delirium Tremens
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Colour and sight: pale blond, the fine and regular effervesce ensures a fine and stable head.Scent: Slightly malty, a nice touch of alcohol, spicy.Flavour: Feels like the sound shot of alcohol is igniting the mouth. In reality the tongue and palate are warmed. The taste is characterized by its roundness. The aftertaste is strong, long-lasting and dry bitter.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Matilda
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Goose Island Beer Co. Matilda
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Golden sunrise color, baking spice aroma, fruity biscuity malt flavor, dry body.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Damnation
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Russian River Brewing Company Damnation
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Inspired pretty much by Duvel and other strong golden ales of Belgium. It is medium-bodied, has a fruity/banana bouquet, and a dry, spicy finish.AvailabilityPub draft and bottles, local distribution draft and bottles, some draft to some distributors, bottles to all distributors, year-roundOriginal Gravity: 1.056Alcohol by Volume: 7.5%Color: GoldenBitterness: Mild\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Pranqster
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: North Coast Brewing Co. Pranqster
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Belgian Ales represent the height of the brewers’ art. Sophisticated brewing techniques, yeast blends, and unique flavoring elements have elevated the beers of Belgium to the status enjoyed by wine in other countries.PranQster follows in this tradition using a mixed culture of antique yeast strains that produce a floral nose, a full fruity flavor, and a clean finish.IBU: 20\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: La Chouffe (Blonde)
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Brasserie d'Achouffe La Chouffe
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:The gnomes of Fairyland are particularly fond of this golden beer. LA CHOUFFE, with its slight hoppy taste, combining notes of fresh coriander and fruity tones, is the drink which gives them their zest for life. At least, that's what these imps say when they are thirsty. Their secret used to be jealously guarded from one generation to the next until the day they shared the recipe with humans to seal their friendship. Of all the legends from the wonderful region of the Belgian Ardennes, the tale of LA CHOUFFE is the one which most merits re-telling.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Piraat
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Brouwerij Van Steenberge N.V. Piraat 9
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Belgian Strong Pale Ale, re-fermented with Bordeaux wine yeast\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Local 1
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Brooklyn Brewery Brooklyn Local 1
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Brewed with German malts and hops, first-pressing Demerara cane sugar from Mauritius, and a Belgian yeast strain. 100% bottle re-fermentation; OG=18.5; AE=1.7. Classified as a "strong saison" by Garrett Oliver.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Mischief
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: The Bruery Mischief
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:formerly known at Mischief #3Mischief is a hoppy Belgian-style golden ale. This wickedly good golden ale is fiendishly dry-hopped with American hops to add a layer of complexity and mystery to its fruity, dry Belgian-style character. Citrus and resin diabolically combine with ripe melon, pear and slight peppery spice in a precariously effervescent mixture. Enjoy it, but you’ll want to keep an eye out. Gold Medal – 2016 Great American Beer Festival, American-Belgo-Style Ale.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Kwak
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Brouwerij Bosteels Pauwel Kwak
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Belgian Specialty Ale\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Gnomegang
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Brewery Ommegang Gnomegang
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Malts: Pilsner, Carapils, Flaked Oats, flaked Red Wheat, Special BHops: two Saaz varieties, 3 additionsSpices: noneSugar: yesYeast: Chouffe yeast in primary fermentation, Ommegang yeast in bottle conditioningOG: 19.9 o PlatoFG: 2.9 o PlatoIBU: 26\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Stille Nacht
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Brouwerij De Dolle Brouwers De Dolle Stille Nacht
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Stille Nacht (Silent Night) is a prestige beer from De Dolle Brouwers, brewed for Christmas. It has a very potent beer (12% alc/vol). It has been boiling for many hours, brewed with pale malt with white candy sugar in the kettle. The Nugget hops gives an extra bitterness to balance the extreme sweetness due to the density. The taste triangle is completed with some acidity of the fermentation. It is a very interesting beer to age. We have samples of every bottling we have done so far and aging hasn't decreased the quality of this beer. Keep some samples at 10°C and mark the year on the cap with an alcohol marker. Cheers!!\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Horny Devil
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: AleSmith Brewing Company AleSmith Horny Devil

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Confluence Ale
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Allagash Brewing Company Allagash Confluence Ale
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Allagash Confluence Ale is created with a mixed fermentation; utilizing our house primary Belgian style yeast in combination with our proprietary Brettanomyces strain. The two yeast strains work in tandem creating a marriage between spice and fruit flavors that ultimately leave a lingering silky mouth feel. Confluence is brewed with a blend of both imported pilsner and domestic pale malts as well as a portion of caramel malt, resulting in a complex malty profile. Tettnang and East Kent Golding hops are added in the brew process to balance the intricate malty profile while adding a sweet and spicy citrus aroma. After fermentation, Confluence undergoes a lengthy aging process in stainless steel tanks to enhance the flavors. Prior to bottling, it is dry hopped with a Glacier hops, providing a pleasant balance of aromas.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: 668 Neighbor Of The Beast
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: New England Brewing Co. 668 The Neighbor Of The Beast

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: La Trappe Isid'or
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Bierbrouwerij De Koningshoeven B.V. La Trappe Isid'or
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Named after brother Isidorus, Koningshoeven Abbey’s first brewer. Brewed to mark the occasion of the Trappist brewery’s 125th anniversary in 2009, Isid’or was so well received that it earned itself a permanent place in La Trappe’s line-up. Unfiltered, slightly sweet amber ale with a hint of caramel, which continues to ferment after bottling and has a rich, slightly bitter flavour, and a fruity aftertaste.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Inferno Ale
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: The Lost Abbey Inferno Ale
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Corruption, Greed and Lust, they’re all represented on he books today. Tomorrow they’ll be stringing Gluttony, Desire and Sloth. Go ahead, tell yourself you’re better than all of them. But you can’t. Hell can be funny like that. Down here it’s all just sin. Everyone here is screwed just like you. They don’t care who you sliced, diced or cheated. No one is escaping this heinous place.Your roommate is an axe murderer. Eerily, he’s not threatening. How can he be? The Fallen Angel owns your body, mind and soul. As such, no one can take your life. It’s already been taken. Or was it given? Neither matters. Did you seriously think you were living a virtuous life? At least Satan serves beer in Hell. He brews it himself right there in that flame stoked cauldron. Rumor has it the beer is straw yellow, bone dry and simply labeled Inferno.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Hitachino Nest Red Rice Ale
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Kiuchi Brewery Hitachino Nest Red Rice Ale

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Faithfull Ale
