dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Literally "crystal wheat." A Kristall Weizen is a filtered pale Weissbier. It pours "crystal"-clear rather than yeast-hazey. Propeller Kristall Weizen is made with special Weizen yeast, German Noble hops and equal amounts of barley and wheat malts. Like its Hefeweizen counterpart, Kristall Weizen develops a richly-textured, firm, white head in the glass. Very light, spritzy-effervescent and refreshing on the palate, with creamy texture and gentle, lightly fruity character, it finishes with a touch of dryness. Propeller Kristall Weizen pairs well with summer heat and good times... Prost.12 IBU\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Monterey Bay Wheat
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: English Ales Brewery Monterey Bay Wheat

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: White Oak
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: The Bruery White Oak
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:White Oak is a blended beer-- 50% wheatwine aged in Bourbon barrels (we call it "White Oak Sap"), and 50% Mischief (our Golden Strong Ale). Vivid caramel, coconut and vanilla flavors blanketed in a crisp yet robust wheat ale, White Oak is an exercise of balance.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Pilgrim's Dole
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: New Holland Brewing Company Bourbon Barrel Aged Pilgrim's Dole
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:A barleywine-style ale made with 50% wheat malt (a wheatwine) aged in bourbon barrels.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Anniversary Ale
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Short's Brewing Company Anniversary Ale
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:2009 Tap only2010 Tap and bottle2013 Tap and bottleSame recipe every year, according to the brewer, though ABV varies slightly."Anniversary Ale~ A high gravity wheat wine made with blood oranges that render an alluring dark purple hue to the color. Flavor abounds from the spice of green peppercorns and tang from blood orange zest. Aggressive dry hop additions amplify the citrus overtones and spiciness found throughout. ‘Anni’ Ale typifies the full magnitude of Short’s Brewing Company by embodying all the complexities and fulfillment necessary to pay tribute to another year of brewing. 10% ABV 63 IBU's"\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Gamma Ray
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Terrapin Beer Company Terrapin Gamma Ray
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Gamma Ray is a wheat beer brewed with a massive amount of honey from Savannah Bee Company. This super powered blast from the past will make you believe time travel is possible.IBU: 40OG: 22.6HOPS: Pearle, Mt. HoodMALTS: 2 Row Pale Malt, Munich Wheat, Carapils, Acidulated Malt.AVAILABILITY: July / Side Project\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Wood Ya Honey
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Jackie O's Pub & Brewery Wood Ya Honey

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Star Brew-Triple Wheat Ale
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Marin Brewing Company Marin Star Brew-Triple Wheat Ale

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Wheat Wine
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Portsmouth Brewery Portsmouth Wheat Wine
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:A toffee-like flavor predominates this bold & assertive wheat ale.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Misery
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: DuClaw Brewing Company Misery

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Devil's Heart Of Gold
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Perennial Artisan Ales Heart Of Gold
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:The name "Devil’s Heart of Gold" comes from what they call the "Devil’s Cut". When a bourbon ages in a barrel, a portion of the bourbon evaporates - this is called the "Angel’s share". Another portion of the bourbon gets absorbed into the new oak barrel - this is called the "Devil’s cut". Therefore, the Heart of Gold beer aging in the barrel starts to absorb back some of the Devil’s Cut and hence the name "Devil’s Heart of Gold". We took our Heart of Gold and aged it in a Knob Creek 9-year old barrel from our friends at The Wine and Cheese Place in October 2011. The beer rested in these barrels for 7 months. 204 bottles will be released exclusively at The Wine and Cheese Place.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Vernal
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Element Brewing Company Vernal
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Dunkel Wheatwine.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Illegal Ale-Ien
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Brewery: Marshall Wharf Brewing Company / Three Tides Restaurant
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Marshall Wharf Brewing Company / Three Tides Restaurant Illegal Ale-ien
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:A hybrid kolsch/wheat beer brewed with organic blue agave nectar. Light in color and finish.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Old Sol Wheatwine Ale
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Big Time Brewery & Alehouse Old Sol Wheatwine Ale

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: West Coast Wheat Wine
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Baird Brewing Company / Fishmarket Taproom West Coast Wheat Wine
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Brewer's Notes: Wheat Wine is a beer style born on the U.S. West Coast in the 1980s (legend has it that the style was conceived and first crafted at a small brewery-pub in Sacramento, California). It has as its progenitor the English Barley Wine beer style. Wheat Wine, as a beer style, is characterized by a massively rich complexity imbued with a tenaciously strong-willed sense of balance. It is a style indicative of the irreverent creativity and unrelenting passion for beer that form the hallmarks of craft brewing in the West Coast of the United States. Baird West Coast Wheat Wine is crafted in homage to the skilled brewing artisans and fearless beer entrepreneurs that have pioneered craft brewing on America?s great West Coast.Baird West Coast Wheat Wine is a heavyweight ? this year (2005) tipping the scales at approximately 9.5% alcohol by volume. 50 percent of the fermentable extract is derived from malted wheat, and this lends a quenching drinkability rare to beers of this strength. This drinkability is buttressed further by a 10 percent addition of Japanese candy sugar which lends to the beer a character reminiscent of a Belgian-style Tripel. The hops once again are 100% American West Coast types; this year, though, large additions of Vanguard and Sterling render the hop character softer and spicier than last year?s boldly citrus performance.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: 1100 Wheat Wine
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Fitger's Brewhouse 1100 Wheat Wine
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Aged in first use Woodford bourbon barrels for a year.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Umami
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: The Livery Umae Umami

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Blue Moon Belgian WhiteCoors Brewing Company (Molson-Coors)
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Coors Brewing Company Blue Moon Belgian White
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Also know as Belgian Moon in Alberta & British Columbia\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: White
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Allagash Brewing Company Allagash White
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Our interpretation of a traditional Belgian wheat beer. Brewed with a generous portion of wheat and spiced with coriander and Curacao orange peel, this beer is fruity, refreshing and slightly cloudy in appearance.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Hoegaarden Original White Ale
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Brouwerij van Hoegaarden Hoegaarden Original White Ale
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:The Original Belgian Wheat Beer. Almost 600 years ago in the Belgian village of Hoegaarden, a band of monks experimented by adding oddball botanicals from halfway around the world to their traditional wheat beer. Our recipe, inspired by their creation, is a beer with a refreshing flavor and captivating aroma, unlike any in the world. Let the refreshing citrus and earthy coriander alleviate the stresses of modern living and whisk you to another place entirely. You might call it divine inspiration... we call it Hoegaarden.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Shock Top Belgian White
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Anheuser-Busch Shock Top Belgian White
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Originally known as Spring Heat Spiced WheatWe’ve shaken up traditional tastes by brewing a spiced Belgian-style wheat ale with real orange, lemon and lime peels,and then added a little coriander spice to the mix. This uniquely-crafted and award-winning ale is unfiltered to create a brew that is naturally cloudy with a light golden color and a smooth, refreshing finish.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Namaste White Belgian-Style Witbier
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Dogfish Head Brewery Namaste
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:A witbier bursting with good karma. Made with dried organic orange slices, fresh-cut lemongrass and a bit of coriander, this Belgian-style white beer is a great thirst quencher.20 IBU\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: White Rascal
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Avery Brewing Company White Rascal
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:22 IBU\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Blanche De Chambly
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Unibroue Blanche De Chambly
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:The Blanche de Chambly label features the icon of the city where it is brewed: Fort Chambly. It was converted from a wooden barricade used for fighting against the Iroquois in the middle of the XVII century into a stone fortress to combat the British army at the beginning of the XVIII century. With notes of dried orange peel and coriander seeds, this brew is a worthy representative of classic Belgian-style white wheat beers. To date, it has won more than 34 international medals, including being named “The World’s Best White Beer" on numerous occasions. Unibroue is proud to brew the most popular white beer in Quebec.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Witte Wheat Ale
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Brewery Ommegang Ommegang Witte
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Witte is our version of the classic Belgian wit or "white" ale. Witte, which is actually Flemish for white, is brewed with malted and unmalted wheat, orange peel, and coriander - offering a refreshing style that showcases the Belgian talent for brewing full-flavored ales that are also light and balanced. It is pale straw in color, slightly hazy from the yeast, and topped with a huge white, fluffy head.Witte is pleasantly light on the tongue, balanced between malt and wheat sweetness. Hops and spice with a subtle clove note backed by flavors of lemon and sweet orange give way to a dry, crisp, refreshing finish.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Red & White
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Dogfish Head Brewery Red & White
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:A big, Belgian-style witbier brewed with coriander and orange peel and fermented with pinot noir juice. After fermentation, a fraction of the batch is aged in one of our 10,000-gallon oak tanks.35 IBU\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Florida Cracker
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Cigar City Brewing Florida Cracker White Ale
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:The Cracker Cowboys of Florida were colonial-era settlers, often of Scots-Irish descent, who arrived in Florida when Spain traded their territory of La Florida to the English. The term Cracker in Florida usage relates to the whip these "cow hunters" used to herd cattle in Florida's Palmetto Prairies. Called Quaqueros by the Spanish, these hardy and hard working Cracker Cowboys helped to shape the history of Florida, the nation’s oldest cattle raising state. We brew Florida Cracker White Ale with unmalted wheat, orange peel and coriander and then ferment it with a Belgian yeast strain to give it a spicy and dry finish. Perfect for a warm day on the Palmetto Prairie.18 IBU\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Hitachino Nest White Ale
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Kiuchi Brewery Hitachino Nest White Ale

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Samuel Adams Blackberry WitbierBoston Beer Company (Samuel Adams)
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Boston Beer Company (Samuel Adams) Samuel Adams Blackberry Witbier

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: UFO White
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Harpoon Brewery UFO White
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Light, crisp, refreshing UFO White follows in the tradition of spiced wheat beers that have been brewed in Belgium for well over 300 years. Brewed with orange peel and a unique blend of spices, UFO White is the perfect choice for a summer’s barbecue, a night out with friends or any time you¹re thirsting for something a little different. Like UFO Hefeweizen and UFO Raspberry Hefeweizen, we leave UFO White Unfiltered for a more natural taste and appearance.10 IBU\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Samuel Adams White AleBoston Beer Company (Samuel Adams)
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Boston Beer Company (Samuel Adams) Samuel Adams White Ale
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Was a Spring seasonal, now a Fall/Winter seasonal.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Samuel Adams Imperial WhiteBoston Beer Company (Samuel Adams)
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Boston Beer Company (Samuel Adams) Samuel Adams Imperial White

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Clementine
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Clown Shoes Clementine

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Double White Ale
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Southampton Publick House Double White Ale

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Positive Contact
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Dogfish Head Brewery Positive Contact
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Positive Contact is the second batch of the Imperial Belgian-Style Wheat beer that Sam and Ben brewed a couple months back. For this batch, we stepped up the spice and cider additions. Instead of 200 lbs of apples, Ben pressed 300 lbs of organic Fuji apples for a total addition of 25 gallons of fresh pressed cider, which was added to the whirlpool in order to really bring out the cider character. The amount of cilantro was nearly quadrupled with 4 lbs total, which was pureed with a portion of the cider and then added after the boil was done. The cayenne was doubled, but added directly before the beer was transferred from the kettle to the fermenter in an effort to minimize the burn while increasing the flavor and aroma contributed. A different type of wit yeast was used and then fermented slightly cooler to keep the yeast character minimal and act as a supporting role to the main players the cider and spices. Lastly, this batch was boiled for less time than the original batch, leaving the beer with a lighter straw color than the amberish hue of batch #1.Overall, Positive Contact is characterized by its bright spritzy cider character and autumnal herbal quality derived from the cilantro, cayenne, and yeast.19 IBU\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Holy Moses White Ale
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Great Lakes Brewing Company Great Lakes Holy Moses

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Blanche De Bruxelles / Manneken Pis Belgian White
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Brasserie Lefèbvre SA Blanche De Bruxelles / Manneken Pis Belgian White

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Calabaza Blanca
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Jolly Pumpkin Artisan Ales Calabaza Blanca

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: White Thai
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Westbrook Brewing Co. White Thai
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:This beer, inspired by the flavors of Southeast Asian cuisine, is a twist on the classic Belgian witbier style. Instead of the traditional coriander and orange peel spicing regimen, we add fresh lemongrass, ginger root, and a dash of Sorachi Ace hops. The result is a wonderfully refreshing ale with notes of lemon candy, citrus fruit, and a slight spiciness from the ginger. Best served at 45°F in a tulip or wine glass.16 IBU\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Mothership Wit
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: New Belgium Brewing Mothership Wit (Organic Wheat Beer)
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Organic wheat beer.IBU's: 12\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Whirlwind Witbier
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Victory Brewing Company Whirlwind Witbier

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Great White
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Lost Coast Brewery and Cafe Great White

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: White
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Alaskan Brewing Co. Alaskan White
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Alaskan White Ale has a soft, slightly sweet base with the unique spice aroma of coriander and crisp, citrus finish of orange peel. A light and effervescent body combined with the smooth palate creates a complex and delicate beer that is deliciously refreshing in any season.15 IBU\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Grey Lady
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Cisco Brewers Inc. Grey Lady
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:The name "Grey Lady" comes from the nickname for the often-foggy island on which it is brewed. This hazy, Belgian-style Wit emits a complex nose with sophisticated notes.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Wahoo White Beer
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Ballast Point Brewing Company Wahoo Wheat Beer
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Previously known as Wahoo Wheat AleA fresh, unfiltered brew perfect for lazy summer days.Our Wahoo White is brewed with unfiltered, un-malted wheat and oats that give it a distinctive cloudy complexity. True to the Belgian tradition, this Witbier boasts a refreshing, citrusy flavor thanks to the orange peel and coriander we add to the boil. This makes Wahoo an ideal beer for year-round beach weather.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: ZÔN
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Boulevard Brewing Co. ZÔN
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Boulevard’s summer seasonal is our interpretation of a classic Belgian witbier. ZON (Flemish for “sun”) combines the subtle flavors of coriander and orange peel with other traditional ingredients to create a delightful, refreshing summertime brew.15 IBU\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Kronenbourg 1664 Blanc
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Brasseries Kronenbourg Kronenbourg

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Orange Avenue Wit
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Coronado Brewing Company Orange Avenue Wit
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:This So-Cal take on a traditional witbier honors Coronado’s main street, which is home to our brewpub and was once lined with orange trees. Bolstered by orange zest, coriander and orange blossom honey, it’s Belgium by way of Coronado. Expect a refreshing, light-bodied brew rife with citrus zing and a hint of earthy spice.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Two Jokers Double-Wit
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Boulevard Brewing Co. Two Jokers Double-Wit
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:They say there are two sides to every story, and that’s certainly true of Two Jokers Double-Wit. On the one hand, it’s a revival of the classic Belgian “wit,” or “white” ale, with lactic fermentation providing a refreshing tartness. On the other hand, it’s a modern, uniquely American brew; big, flavorful, and spiced with cardamom, coriander, orange peel, lavender, and grains of paradise.15 IBU\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Estrella Damm Inedit
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Damm S. A. Estrella Damm Inedit

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Half-E-Weizen
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Rogue Ales Half-E-Weizen
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Also know as 'Mom Hefeweizen'8 Ingredients:Malts: Great Western Harrington, Klages and Wheat.Hops: Saaz.Specialty: Coriander and Ginger.Yeast & Water: Rogue's Pacman Yeast & Free Range Coastal Water. 13º PLATO34 IBU77 AA3º Lovibond\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Blanche De Namur
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Brasserie Du Bocq Blanche De Namur

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Wheat Ale
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Upland Brewing Company Wheat Ale
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Upland Wheat Ale is a classic rendition of the Belgian Witbier (white beer) style. We brew it with organic coriander and orange zest to be light on the tongue and refreshingly tart. In the tradition of the Belgian Wit style, Upland Wheat Ale is unfiltered, allowing suspended yeast to create a cloudy, golden appearance. This is an everyday, every meal type of beer. It’s comforting on a cold winter day and refreshing on a hot summer evening. That’s why it’s one of our most popular brews and a flagship beer of our brewery.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Supplication
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Russian River Brewing Company Supplication
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Brown Ale aged in used Pinot Noir barrels from local Sonoma County wineries. It is aged for about 12 months with sour cherries, brettanomyces, lactobacillus, and pediococcus added to each barrel. Flavors from the cherries, Pinot Noir and oak balance each other nicely with a little funk from the brett.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Consecration
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Russian River Brewing Company Consecration
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Dark ale aged in Cabernet Sauvignon barrels with Brett, Lacto, Pedio, and currants\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Temptation
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Russian River Brewing Company Temptation
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:A blonde ale fermented with a special strain of yeast, then aged in French oak chardonnay barrels. Flavors of wine and oak absorb into the brew throughout twelve months of aging. During this aging process, a secondary fermentation occurs using a yeast strain disliked by most brewers and winemakers called Brettanomyces.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Beatification
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Russian River Brewing Company Beatification
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:This beer is very unique and inspired by breweries in the Lambic region of Belgium and, especially, our friends at Cantillon. It is 100% spontaneously fermented, meaning yeast is not added. Once the beer is brewed, it is transferred to a cool-ship or “horny” tank located in our barrel room at the pub. There it sits overnight and collects whatever funky wild yeast and bacteria may be living in the room. The next day it is transferred to oak wine barrels where it ferments wildly and ages for a few months. The end result is a wild, spontaneously fermented, sour, and tasty hand-crafted beer!\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Sang Noir
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Cascade Brewing / Raccoon Lodge & Brewpub Cascade Sang Noir
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Sang Noir is a blend of imperial spiced red ales aged in bourbon and wine barrels with Bing cherries for up to two years. Pouring a deep mahogany brown, this Northwest sour ale features rich flavors of dark roast malts, bourbon, black cherries and port wine.

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Apricot Ale
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Cascade Brewing / Raccoon Lodge & Brewpub Cascade Apricot Ale
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:This NW style sour blond ale was barrel aged for up to nine months, then aged on fresh apricot for an additional six months. Aromas of sweet apricot blossoms and tart fruit are present as you draw the glass near. Deep, rich apricot flesh, then tart apricot notes dance on the palate and lead to a sweet apricot flesh finish with a lingering fruit tartness.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Juliet
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Goose Island Beer Co. Juliet
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:A rye beer aged in French oak (Robert Craig Cabernet Sauvignon) with blackberries and Brettanomyces.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Cuvee De Tomme
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: The Lost Abbey Cuvee De Tomme
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Blended dark strong ale with sour cherries aged in American oak and French oak red wine barrels. Once upon a time it was the most award winning Pizza Port beer of all time. Now it has found a new home at The Lost Abbey.A massive brown ale base that is made from four fermentable sugars including malted barley, raisins, candi sugar and sour cherries, this beer is fully-fermented before being placed in bourbon barrels where the beer ages for one year with the sour cherries and the wild Brettanomyces yeast that we inoculate the barrels.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Framboise De Amorosa
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: The Lost Abbey Framboise De Amorosa
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Framboise de Amorosa is our first foray into the world of raspberry beers. It begins as Lost and Found ale and is sent into freshly emptied red wine barrels. The beer spends over a year in the wood during which time it is spiked with three additions of raspberries.The first sip produces a sweet start with a long drawn out sour finish. Some of the sweetness from the raspberries comes out before acidic notes join the mix. On the back end of the beer is a smoothing oak character which keeps the beer from becoming dull.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Cable Car
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: The Lost Abbey Cable Car

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Pentagram
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Surly Brewing Company Pentagram
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:This Arcane Seal guards an enigmatic brew that is FUNKY, DARK, and SOUR. If you choose to break the seal, YOU HAVE BEEN WARNED!100% Brettanomyces Dark beer fermented in stainless and aged in red wine barrels. "Brett" is a unique yeast strain that produces flavors that would be considered offensive if they were not intentional. Flavors of sour cherry, tobacco, oak, and classic "Brett" barnyard funk balanced by dark Munich malt chewiness. Enjoy immediately or age at cellar temperature for a couple years.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Framboise For A Cure
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Russian River Brewing Company Framboise For A Cure
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Blonde Ale aged in Chardonnay barrels with brett, lacto, and pedio (base beer is Temptation). This sour barrel-aged blonde ale has 31 pounds per barrel of fresh raspberries to make a beautiful reddish/pink beer! Nicely balanced with sweet raspberry and tartness. This beer is made only once a year in conjunction with our month-long fundraiser for the Sutter Breast Care Services of Santa Rosa during Breast Cancer Awareness Month! 100% of the proceeds of this beer will be used to help men and women in our community in their fight against breast cancer!Batch 1 (2010) - Sonambic base, 5.9%Batch 2 (2011 - present) - Temptation base, 6.5%\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Riserva
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Weyerbacher Brewing Co. Riserva
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Ale with raspberry purée added and aged in oak barrels.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Bottleworks XII
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: The Bruery Bottleworks XII
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Imperial Witbier, 8% ABV, sour mashed 1-2 days, and fermented with a blend of Berliner Weisse culture and Belgian Witbier yeast. Beer is barrel fermented in large red wine barrels (132 gal. barrels). Raspberries are added to the beer towards the end of fermentation directly to the barrel, and aged on the raspberries for a minimum of 1 month. The Berliner culture contains souring bacteria and the raspberries will add acidity to the beer. Brewed to commemorate Bottleworks 12th Anniversary.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Cascade Noyaux
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Cascade Brewing / Raccoon Lodge & Brewpub Cascade Noyeaux
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:This one-of-a-kind NW sour is a blend of Belgian strong blondes aged in white port barrels with raspberries, then blended with select barrels of strong blondes that were aged on the toasted meat from the apricot nut, or Noyeaux.13 IBU\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Sang Royal
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Cascade Brewing / Raccoon Lodge & Brewpub Cascade Sang Royal
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Malt Beverage with Cherries Added and Aged in Oak BarrelsA blend of double red ales aged in oak barrels and foudres for up to 22 months with Pinot Noir grapes from Oregon’s famed Willamette Valley wine region. The most regal in our series of “Sang” projects, Sang Royal captures complex notes of summer berry fruit, plum, oak and spice, with a vibrant acidity and soft tannic structure.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Cascade The Vine
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Cascade Brewing / Raccoon Lodge & Brewpub Cascade The Vine
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:The Vine is a blend of sour wheat and blond ales aged in white wine barrels for up to 18 months with Gewurztraminer grapes. ABV seems to vary, between 8.33-10.1%\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Boxer's Revenge
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Jester King Craft Brewery Boxer's Revenge
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Full-flavored, dry, champagne-like farmhouse ale, matured in oak whiskey and wine barrels with multiple strains of wild yeast and bacteria. Look for lots of tropical fruit and funk, with a sour, earthy edge.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Tart Lychee, Tropical Sour
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: New Belgium Brewing Tart Lychee
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Golden sour blended with lychee fruit and Saigon cinnamon\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Maracaibo Especial
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Jolly Pumpkin Artisan Ales Maracaibo Especial
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:A sour brown ale inspired by the enigmatic monastic brews of Belgium, and the mysterious mist shrouded jungles of the tropics. Brewed with real cacao, and spiced with cinnamon and sweet orange peel for a sensual delight. A brew to be sipped, savored, and enjoyed!\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Friek
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Odell Brewing Company Friek
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Kriek Lambic blended from three different aged beers up to 2 years old, aged in Woodcut barrels.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Samuel Adams Stony Brook Red (Barrel Room Collection)Boston Beer Company (Samuel Adams)
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Boston Beer Company (Samuel Adams) Samuel Adams Stony Brook Red (Barrel Room Collection)
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Aged in oak barrels; hand-bottled corked & caged; bottled-conditioned. A greater percentage of "Cosmic Mother Funk" was blended into this beer.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Cascade Vlad The Imp Aler
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Cascade Brewing / Raccoon Lodge & Brewpub Cascade Vlad The Imp Aler
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:This Northwest style sour is a blend of spiced Quads, Triples and Blondes aged in Bourbon and wine barrels for over 18 months with orange peel and coriander. Vlad offers a fresh acidity and mild sweetness with flavors of citrus, spice and rich oak. Winner of the Silver Medal at the 2008 GABF. ABV 12.3%First Release: 9.5% ABVSecond Release (Sept 2010): 10.6% ABVThird Release: 2011 - 10.91%\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Samuel Adams Old Fezziwig AleBoston Beer Company (Samuel Adams)
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Boston Beer Company (Samuel Adams) Samuel Adams Old Fezziwig Ale
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Old Fezziwig, Rich & Sweet: Like the character that inspired it. This beer is festive and worthy of a celebration all its own. Bursting with spices of the season, its full body accompanies a deep malt character, with notes of sweet toffee and rich, dark caramel.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Christmas Ale
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Great Lakes Brewing Company Great Lakes Christmas Ale
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Do not open ‘til Christmas? Whoever coined that phrase obviously hasn’t tasted Christmas Ale’s fresh honey, cinnamon, and ginger flavors.A Yuletide’s worth of holiday spices and sweet honey to keep you a-wassailing all season long.World Beer Championships 6-Time Medal Winner Since 1999 (Gold, Silver)\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Jubelale
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Deschutes Brewery Jubelale
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Available: October to DecemberAlc. by Vol.: 6.7%IBUs: 60Cocoa, dried fruit, and toffee notes. A robust ale with a warming spice.Bottle conditioned for quality. Live yeast added to the bottle allows this beer to age gracefully and stay fresher, longer. Keep bottles upright, and away from light & heat.216 calories per 12 oz servingLabel artwork changes annually.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Winter Welcome AleSamuel Smith Old Brewery (Tadcaster)
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Samuel Smith Old Brewery (Tadcaster) Samuel Smith's Winter Welcome Ale
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:This seasonal beer is a limited edition brewed for the short days and long nights of winter. The full body resulting from fermentation in ‘stone Yorkshire squares’ and the luxurious malt character, which will appeal to a broad range of drinkers, is balanced against whole-dried Fuggle and Golding hops with nuances and complexities that should be contemplated before an open fire.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Winter Solstice Seasonal Ale
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Anderson Valley Brewing Company Winter Solstice Seasonal Ale
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Winter Solstice® is our take on the classic style of “winter warmer.” Boasting a deep amber hue and rich mouthfeel, its creamy finish will lift your spirits. Hints of toffee, spice, and caramel tease the senses making this the perfect ale to share with friends and family during the cold days and long nights of winter.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Old Man Winter
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Southern Tier Brewing Company Old Man (Winter Ale)
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Our winter offering is here to quell your shivers and get you through the coldest of nights. A rich marriage of hops and barley to cast light upon the evening and melt your mind out of the snowdrifts. Old Man Winter’s earthy hue and thickness lace around the glass, inviting you to linger in its warmth and share the spirits of the season with your friends and family. A deceptively strong brew, it’s best to sit and ponder with this old man, sip by sip.ABV: 7.5%Fermentation: Ale yeast, three varieties of hops, two varieties of maltsColor: Brown with ruby huesNotes: Roasted malts, a touch of smoke, pepper, some floral hopsFlavor: Hints of bittersweet cocoa, nutty, defined malts and balancing hopsBitterness: Moderate (57 IBU)Availability: Nov - Dec\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Winter Warmer
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Harpoon Brewery Harpoon Winter Warmer
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:When you bring a glass of this dark copper ale to your lips to take your first sip you will notice the aroma of cinnamon. There is no aromatic hop added that might overpower the distinct spice scent. The medium body of this beer is formed from caramel and pale malts. These create enough body to support the spices without making the beer excessively rich. Bittering hops are added to counter the sweetness of the malt and spice. The finish of the beer is a blend of cinnamon and nutmeg. The combination of these two spices results in a balanced, pumpkin-pie flavor.22 IBU\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Fireside Chat
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: 21st Amendment Brewery Fireside Chat
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Like FDR’s Depression-era radio addresses, which were like a kick in the butt and a hug at the same time, our Fireside Chat is a subtle twist on the traditional seasonal brew. We begin with a rich, dark, English-style ale and then we improvise with spices until we know we have a beer worth sharing with the nation.Fireside Chat is our early winter seasonal brew available from October through December in six pack cans and on draft. Brewed like a classic, warming Strong Ale but with a subtle blend of hand-selected spices for just the right festive flair.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Christmas Ale
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Breckenridge Brewery Christmas Ale
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:The chill of a Colorado high-country winter calls for a beer with extra flavor and strength. Here it is. At over 7% alcohol, with a sturdy texture and rich flavors of caramel and chocolate, our holiday seasonal is the fermented equivalent of a good fire.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Nutcracker Winter Warmer Ale
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Boulevard Brewing Co. Nutcracker Ale
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Nutcracker Ale is Boulevard’s holiday gift for real beer lovers. This hearty, warming brew is a classic winter ale, deep amber in color, with hints of molasses balanced by the “spiciness” of freshly harvested Chinook hops.38 IBU\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Snow Cap
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Pyramid Breweries, Inc. Snow Cap
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Deep mahogany in color, our full-bodied winter warmer is brewed in the spirit of British winter ales. Crafted with a flurry of roasted chocolate and caramel malts, and generously hopped, it delivers a smooth finish that makes this beer the perfect cold weather companion.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Odell Isolation Ale
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Odell Brewing Company Odell Isolation Ale

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: K-9 Winter Ale
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Flying Dog Brewery K-9 Cruiser Winter Ale
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Formerly K-9 Cruiser Winter Ale\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: 4 Elf
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Dark Horse Brewing Company Dark Horse 4 Elf
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:4 Elf is holiday cheer in liquid form. Spicy aromas like cinnamon and clove give this dark brown winter warmer a proper holiday welcome. Balanced between malt, hops, and spice at 8.75% ABV this beer goes great with all holiday foods—from sweet snacks to the roast beast.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Festive Ale
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: SweetWater Brewing Company Sweetwater Festive Ale
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:A strong ale brewed with generous amounts of rich malt, coupled with a taint of cinnamon and mace\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: 12 Dogs Of Christmas Ale
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Thirsty Dog Brewing Company 12 Dogs Of Christmas Ale
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:This beer's name sums up the idea of bringing the best together to celebrate. It is filled with seasonal flavors from generous amounts of toasted and caramel malts, mixed with equally generous amounts of honey, cinnamon, ginger, and nutmeg. We feel it is the perfect libation, filled with flavors of the season.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Winter Ale
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Summit Brewing Company Summit Winter Ale
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:OG 14.6° Plato36 IBUsMalts: Harrington, Caramel, Carafa IIHops: Willamette, Fuggle, Tettenanger\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Barrel Aged Brrrbon (Brothers' Reserve Series)
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Widmer Brothers Brewing Company Barrel Aged Brrrbon (Brothers' Reserve Series)
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Bitterness: 40 IBUAlcohol by Volume: 9.4% ABVOriginal Gravity: 20° PLATOReleased: September 2010\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: BiFrost
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Elysian Brewing Company BiFrost

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Prelude
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Shipyard Brewing Co. Prelude Special Ale

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Never Summer Ale
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Boulder Beer / Wilderness Pub Never Summer Ale

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Powder Hound Winter Ale
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Big Sky Brewing Company Powder Hound Winter Ale
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Two words describe winter in our neck of the woods... cold, dark, and snowy. Just the way we like it! At 7.2% ABV, Powder Hound Winter Ale gives just the right amount of warmth, balanced by its rich taste and generous dose of Hallertau, Palisade, and Amarillo hops. After a cold day of getting it done or just relaxing, the avalanche of flavor will have you saying these four words - "I'll have another Powder Hound"!\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Winterbraun
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Lost Coast Brewery and Cafe Winterbraun

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Bourbon Barrel Aged Winter Warmer
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Rahr & Sons Brewing Company Bourbon Barrel Aged Winter Warmer
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:November Release - English dark ale aged in bourbon barrels - fresh American oak - dark malts - English hops - sweet, smooth vanilla & oak finish\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Christmas Ale
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Sly Fox Brewing Company Christmas Ale
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:This malty, full-bodied red ale is made with traditional mulling spices: Ginger, Clove, All Spice, Cinnamon & Nutmeg. If this one doesn't get you into the Christmas spirit, you truly are a Scrooge.Bottled: 16.0 OG | 16 IBUs | 6.5% ABVCanned: 14.0 OG | 16 IBUs | 5.5% ABV\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Frosted Frog Christmas Ale
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Hoppin' Frog Brewery Frosted Frog Christmas Ale
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:The essence of Christmas is captured in this very bottle. Perfectly blended spices compliment Frosted Frog’s rich malt flavors, creating the ultimate Christmas experience. Celebrate the holidays as you savor this very special seasonal offering.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Holly Jolly Christmas Ale
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Fat Heads Brewery & Saloon Christmas Ale
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Once upon a frozen evening way up north, a sweet local honey named Holly inspired our Jolly Fat Man (as only Holly can) to create this festive spiced holiday ale. We think you will enjoy this holiday creation with it's aromas and flavors of Christmas day. Sweet malt, ginger, honey and cinnamon spice. Sip this by the fire with your significant other. Who knows, maybe it will lead to a little inspiration of your own. From our Jolly Fat Man to yours, Happy Holidays.Chill out man, have a beer!Matt - Chris- Glenn\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Bah Humbug! Christmas Cheer! Ale
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Wychwood Brewery Company Ltd Bah Humbug

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Cabin Fever Ale
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Berkshire Brewing Company Inc. Cabin Fever Ale

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Mogul Madness Ale
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Rogue Ales Mogul Madness Ale
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:15 Ingredients:C-123, C-150, Kilncoffee, Carofa's Special 2 & Rogue Micro Barley Farm Dare & RiskMalts: Newport, Simcoe, Crystal 90, Amarillo & Rogue Micro Hopyard Revolution, Liberty & Freedom Hops; Pacman Yeast from Hood River & Free Range Coastal Water.16.5º PLATO68 IBU77.7 AA36º Lovibond\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: God Jul
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Brewery: Nøgne Ø - Det Kompromissløse Bryggeri A/S
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Nøgne Ø - Det Kompromissløse Bryggeri A/S God Jul
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:In the US this is called "Winter Ale". A dark ale brewed specially for the Christmas season, with a rich, complex taste of caramel. This is a strong, dark and rather sweet Christmas Beer – just the way we think a Christmas beer should be.19°P, 30 IBU.Ingredients: Lager, Munich, caramel, black, and chocolate malt; Chinook, Columbus, and Centennial hops; English ale yeast, and our local Grimstad water.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Lions Winter Ale
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Granville Island Brewery Lions Winter Ale
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Our Lions Winter Ale combines premium malt with aromatic specialty hops. The vanilla-like finish of this robust ale is a great excuse to get out of the cold and enjoy BC’s favourite winter beer made from the finest natural ingredients.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Special Holiday Ale
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Brewery: Nøgne Ø - Det Kompromissløse Bryggeri A/S
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Nøgne Ø - Det Kompromissløse Bryggeri A/S Special Holiday Ale - Nøgne Ø/Jolly Pumpkin Artisan Ales/Stone Brewing Co.
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:Collaboration with Jolly Pumpkin Artisan Ales & Stone BrewingIngredients: Malted Barley, malted Rye, malted oats, hops, white sage, caraway, Juniper berries, chestnuts, yeast.First brewed July 27. 2009. Batch #440. Brewed with Stone and Jolly Pumpkin, 2009. Brewed at Nøgne Ø. Also brewed at Stone, Escondido, California, USA, 2008 and Jolly Pumpkin, Dexter, Michigan, USA, 2009.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Winter Ale
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: St. Peter's Brewery Co Ltd St. Peter's Winter Ale
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:This deep mahogany red strong ale is a classic example of a winter warmer that’s high in alcohol and rich in taste. An excellent balance of malty sweetness and hoppy bitterness, gives aromas of Christmas cake with hints of black treacle and vine fruits.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Winter Warmer
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Rahr & Sons Brewing Company Winter Warmer

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Winter Shredder
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Cisco Brewers Inc. Winter Shredder

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: The First Snow Ale
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: RJ Rockers Brewing Company First Snow Ale
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:This hearty American pale ale contains a rich blend of spices that warms the soul on a cold winter's night. Chill the mug, stoke the fire, and savor this quality seasonal brew. Available only during the Winter season.\t

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Red Nose Winter Ale
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Natty Greene's Pub & Brewing Co. Red Nose Winter Ale

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Fish Tale Winterfish
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Fish Brewing Company / Fishbowl Brewpub Fish Tale Winterfish

dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Name: Frosted Frog Christmas Ale - Barrel-Aged
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Beer_Name_Full: Hoppin' Frog Brewery Barrel Aged Frosted Frog Christmas Ale
dbo.beer_profile_and_ratings.Description: Notes:The essence of Christmas is captured in this very bottle. Perfectly blended spices compliment Frosted Frog’s rich malt flavors, creating the ultimate Christmas experience. Celebrate the holidays as you savor this very special seasonal offering.\t
